loans.name: Odo Ne Biakoye Group

texts.en:
Comfort is 31 year old she is married and mother of two kids who are currently in school. She is very supportive in taking of her kids in school. She operates a seamstress shop and started this business ten years ago. She is currently having four apprentices who are learning skills and experience for their future career. She sews all forms female wears with various kinds of styles like kaba and slit, wedding dress, funeral clothes, school uniforms, traditional wears etc. She wants to use the loan to buy more sewing materials like linen, threads, thimbles, etc. to increase her output and efficiency. She hopes to increase savings to support the kids in school.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Odo Ne Biakoye’ which means Love and Oneness. She is the one sitting in the group photograph. Most of the members in this group are petty traders, food vendors and farmers etc. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more sewing material like linen, threads, thimbles, etc.

loans.name: Vasya

texts.en:
Vasya is married. He is a small entrepreneur from Vinogradovo, where he owns a business selling fishing supplies in the local wholesale market. He started this business because he loves fishing and is an experienced fisherman himself. Vasya’s merchandise is unique in the marketplace where he works, which draws many customers to his vending kiosk. Low competition and lending assistance have helped Vasya’s business develop and keep a stable standing. In the last four years his enterprise grew to 40,000 Grivnyas in inventory, 15,000 Grivnyas in gross income and 6,000 Grivnyas in net profit each month.  

Vasya is requesting a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to increase his working capital and sales as a result. One of the most outstanding characteristics of his venture is its stability and consistent growth. We believe this current loan will help Vasya keep his business running and extend it even further. One of Vasya’s future goals is to open one more vending kiosk.

loans.use: To increase his working capital

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr: adama K. est membre de la caisse de yoff depuis aout 2005.elle evolue dans le petit commerce de produits saisonniers et denrees pour enfants.elle tient une table devant chez elle ou elle etale ses produits.elle capitalise une experience de plus de cinq ans dans son activite.elle sollicite un credit de cent cinquante mille(150 000)frs pour accroitre son fond et diversifier ses produits.l'augmentation de ses benefices lui permettra de mieux assister sa famille.
texts.en:
Adama K. has been a member of the Yoff bank since August 2005. She is progressing in her small business selling seasonal products and goods for children. She has a table in front of her house, where she displays her products for sale. She capitalizes on over five years of experience in this business. Adama is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs to grow her capital and to diversify her products. The increase in her profits will enable her to assister her family further.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Savior Group

texts.en:
Kennedy is forty five years old. He is married and a father with four kids who are currently in school. He is a dealer in hardware goods like nails, hammers, paint, roofing sheets, head-pans (containers with handles used in construction), etc. Through this business he has won for himself many customers who buy from his stand and he has added the sale of cement to his inventory. This, he said, has retained most of his customers who try to buy all their hardware goods from him.

Kennedy buys his supplies from importers at wholesale prices and sells to his customers at retail prices. He requests a loan to enable him to procure an increased stock of goods. He hopes to increase his savings to expand his shop to include other items which are frequently demanded by his customers.

Kennedy is the leader of a trust bank group called “Savior”. He is the one sitting in the group photograph. The other members in this group are petty traders, food vendor, hardware sellers and farmers, etc.

loans.use: To procure an increased stock of goods

loans.name: Holiness Group

texts.en:
Theresa is 52 years old. She is divorced with two children. Her elder daughter is a trader while her last-born just completed senior high school and is waiting for her results to further her education. As a single mother, Theresa works hard to provide support for her household. She claims things are very difficult, but she has the hope that soon things will turn for her good. She is a trader who has traded in shoes, women's slippers and dressing bags for the past 20 years. She takes delivery of stock from Accra, the capital town of Ghana. She requests a loan to augment her working capital to buy more stock of shoes, slippers and dressing bags to sell. She believes the loan will enable her to raise more income to support her family.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called "Holiness." She is the one sitting in the group photograph. Most of the members in this group are petty traders, food vendors and farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan. They would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy more stock of shoes, slippers and dressing bags

loans.name: Precious Group

texts.en:
Vida started her fish sales five years ago. She takes delivery of fishes from Yeji in the eastern region of Ghana. With her very tasty and good quality fish many customers buy from her stand. She is now fifty four (54) years old she is divorced with five children. She is currently taking care of two in school whiles the others are working. She wants to use the loan to buy increased stock of assorted fishes to make increased sales and income to support her children’s education and business growth. She would be grateful for the assistance. 

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Precious’. She is the one sitting in the group photograph. Most of the members in this group are petty traders, food vendors and farmers etc. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more stock of smoked fishes.

loans.name: Esmeralda De Los Angeles

texts.es: La Señora de Nombre Esmeralda de los Ángeles Velásquez R., tiene la edad de 31 años. Tiene 2 hijos. Su compañero de vida labora en una empresa llamada impelco. Sus deseos son de tener salud para seguir trabajando en este medio de sustento y que sus hijos sean personas de bien y tengan un futuro en el plano profesional. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es mercadería en general. Hace más de 8 años, ella inicia este negocio trabajando en una tienda en la que vendía cosméticos de oriflame y comenzó a esparcir mercadería de ropa y perfumes y así se dedica a la comercialización de estos productos. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo de prendas de vestir que son encargadas del extranjero. Cosméticos y calzado.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Good News Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 54 years old. She is married and has given birth to two children. Both children are attending elementary school in the community where they live. Elizabeth sells food cereals such beans, maize and groundnut. She has been in this business for more than 10 years now. She buys her goods from the wholesalers in her community and sells to food vendors. She says she sells at the market square. She wants a loan to increase her working capital so that her dream of buying goods in bulk can be achieved. In this way, she can supply to a large number of customers to increase her market size, and hence, her profit margin.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called "Good News." She is the one sitting in the middle in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy cereals like maize, beans, etc., in bulk

loans.name: Mrs. Kumba

texts.en:
This is Mrs. Kumba M., a small-scale businesswoman in Makeni city, northern Sierra Leone. Mrs. M. sells cooked rice, meat and vegetables as well as soft drinks in her small restaurant on the Azzolini Highway in Makeni. 

Kumba is seeking a loan from SMT for the second time in order to help her further improve her business. With the previous SMT loan, she was able to improve her business and personal life. Having repaid her previous loan successfully, she is now requesting a new loan of Le 3,000,000.00.

Mrs. M. is now age 32. She was born in Bo city, southern Sierra Leone. She is married to a police officer and they have two children. One of her children has just written the Basic Education Certificate Examinations (BECE) and the other is in Junior Secondary School II (JSS II). Kumba has been selling cooked rice for a year going on two now. With this loan, Kumba will be able to buy bags of rice, palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), a floor mat, cups and spoons, plates, more drinks to sell and a musical set to entertain her customers. She will also expand her restaurant.

loans.use: Buy cooking ingredients and expand her restuarant

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr: ousmane B. est membre de la caisse de yoff depuis aout 2004.il exerce l'activite d'artiste serigraphe depuis plus de sept ans .il sollicite un credit decent soixante quinze mille (175 000)frs pour acquerir du materiel pour developper son activite.
texts.en:
Ousmane B. has been a member of the Yoff bank since August 2004. He has been working as a silk-screen artist for over seven years. He’s requesting a loan of 175,000 francs to acquire supplies and equipment to develop his business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment

loans.name: Sandra Vanessa

texts.es: Sandra Vanessa L. C. tiene  la edad de 42 años. Tiene la actividad económica de una pulpería. Hace más de 11 años que se dedica a este negocio. Anteriormente  ella solo vendía ciertos productos con jabón, detergentes y golosinas, pero con la ayuda de los financiamientos fue adquiriendo más productos, el mayor desafío que Sandra enfrento fue que  no tenía muchos clientes, pero esto no la detuvo para salir adelante. El dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, jugos, galletas, detergentes. En sus deseos esta el seguir manteniendo este negocio ya que es su único medio de vida.
texts.en:
Sandra Vanessa L. C. is 42 years old. Her economic activity is a grocery store. She has dedicated herself to this business for the past 11 years. Previously, she only sold certain products such as soap, detergents and snacks, but with the financial assistance she has received she acquired more products. The biggest challenge Sandra faced was when she didn’t have many customers, but this did not stop her from trying to get ahead. The funds she is requesting are to be used as working capital for the purchase of snacks, soft drinks, bread, juices, cookies and detergents. One of her wishes is to continue to grow her business, as it is her only source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 41-year-old trader. She is married with three children and all her children are currently in school. She sells used clothes in the local market and has been in business for six years. She takes delivery of stock from the Kumasi central market and sells them through hawking. Her major business challenge over the years has to do with funds to scale up the business. 

She has lots of marketing experience and is very confident that the loan will enable her to achieve remarkable business progress. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothes to serve her customers. She hopes to save enough to support her kids to complete school.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 40 years old. She is married and has given birth to three children. All three children are attending elementary school in the community where they live. Veronica sells food cereals such as beans, maize and groundnuts. She has been in this business for more than 15 years. She buys her goods from the wholesalers in her community and sells to food vendors. She says she sells at the market square. 

She wants a loan to increase her working capital so that her dream of buying goods in bulk can be achieved. In this way, she can supply to a large number of customers to increase her market size and her profit margin so that she can fully take care of the children's needs. She would be grateful for assistance.

loans.use: To buy cereals like maize, beans, etc., in bulk

loans.name: Blanca Julia

texts.es: La Señora Blanca Julia Juárez tiene la edad de 39 años, tiene dos hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica de Blanca es la venta y elaboración de tortillas. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que inicio con muy poco capital ya que no tenía el suficiente capital para ofrecer más productos. La ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda, a pesar de ser muy humilde tiene suficiente clientes. Los propósitos de Doña Blanca son de  mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia proporcionado lo necesario. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de maíz, leña, cal, comal entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Señora Blanca Julia Juárez is 39 years old. She has two children, and they are in school. Blanca’s business is the sale and manufacture of tortillas. She has been engaged in this business for more than 20 years. It began with very little capital, and she didn’t have sufficient capital to offer more products.

The location of her business is in her home. In spite of being very humble, she has sufficient customers. The intentions of Doña Blanca are to improve her family’s living conditions in proportion to their needs. The financing is to buy working capital for the purchase of corn, firewood, lime, among other things.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Elaboración de  la losa en la parte trasera

loans.name: Babacar

texts.fr: babacar D. est membre de la caisse deyoff depuis decembre 2007.il est informaticien de profession et gere un ciber dans la localite.parallelement il dispense des cours d'informatique aux jeunes de la zone.il sollicite un credit de trois cent mille(300 000)frs pour l'acquisition d'une nouvelle machine dans le but d'ameliorer sa rentabilite.
texts.en:
Babacar D. has been a member of the Yoff bank since December 2007. He is a computer specialist by profession and manages an internet café in his town. Concurrently, he gives computer classes to young people in his area. He’s requesting a loan of 300,000 francs to acquire a new machine with the aim of improving his profits.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment

loans.name: Andrés

texts.es:
El Señor Andrés B. es casado con 4 hijos, domiciliado en la ciudad de Caacupé del Barrio San Francisco.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         Don Andrés fue empleado de una chipería, con un pequeño ahorro y un crédito recibido de fundación paraguaya emprendió su propia chipería. La chipa es una comida típica hecha de almidón, grasa animal, huevos y queso.
 Gracias a la buena atención y a la calidad de sus productos hoy día tiene clientela formada. Don Andrés elabora en su domicilio y lleva sus productos en la capital, ofrece sus deliciosas chipas frente a un concurrido Hospital.
 El cliente comenta que sus ingresos son muy buenas y sus ventas cada día aumenta y por ende sus ingresos. Don Andrés agradece a fundación paraguaya y Kiva por el apoyo constante que les brinda para fortalecer su microempresa y a la vez espera recibir siempre tan valioso apoyo.
El crédito que solicita es para compra de insumos para chipas: almidón, queso, grasa de cerdo, leche, huevo entre otros.

loans.use: Para la compra de almidón, leche, queso, grasa de cerdo.

loans.name: Eudalda

texts.es:
La sra. Eudalda  tiene 66 años, es vida hace 3 años y tiene 4 hijos, tres ellos casados y el 4to es soltero con profesión maestro.
Doña Eudalda es comerciante desde más de 25 años y el 1er crédito de la Fundación Paraguaya lo obtuvo en el año 2000. 

Edualda es dueña de una despensa. Cuenta con clientela formada gracias al buen trato y calidad de sus productos y la mayoría esta conformada por vecinos de la zona. 

El crédito que solicita es para la compra de maíz en granel para posteriormente procesarlo en harina de maíz y comercializarlo en su despensa.
texts.en:
Eudalda is 66 years old, has been widowed for 3 years, and has 4 children. Three are married, and the 4th is single and a teacher. Eudalda has been a merchant for more than 25 years, and obtained her 1st credit from Fundación Paraguaya in the year 2000. Eudalda is the owner of a store. She has a well-established customer base thanks to the great service she offers and the quality of her products; most of her clients are neighbors from the area. The loan she is requesting is to purchase corn to then process into flour and sell in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn.

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.en:
Ysabel is a member of the Hope village bank. She is 51 years old and has three children. Her eldest is married and her other two are 30 and 21 years old.

Ysabel sold groceries from a cart for many years in front of a market but the police ousted her. She was forced to go to another market where she now sells breakfast on the corner with the help of her daughter. They get up at 2 a.m. in order to prepare quinwa (a grain like rice) and soybean juices, milk, punch, and different kinds of sandwiches. She sells sandwiches with avocado, chicken, and egg. She estimates that she sells 400 breakfasts each week.

Every fifteen days Ysabel takes one day to rest. Since she joined FINCA she feels more secure because she is able to buy a sufficient amount of materials for her business.

Ysabel needs a loan of 3,000 soles to buy sugar, milk, oil, quinwa and soy for the preparation of the breakfasts. Her dream is to put a roof on her house along with doors and windows because she is very cold in the winter.

loans.use: To buy sugar, milk, oil, quinwa and soy for the preparation of breakfasts

loans.name: Germán

texts.es:
El Sr. German tiene 53 años casado con la Sra. María Eduvigis Lesme de 52 años, el matrimonio tiene tres hijos todos mayores de edad e in dependientes.
El cliente empezó con un pequeño capital en el año 1.994, en la compra venta de maderas aserradas, luego fue ampliando su negocio, actualmente además de compra venta de maderas fabrica y vende muebles con fina terminación, gracias a la buena atención y calidad de sus productos tiene una clientela formada.
El crédito que solicita es para compra de madera materia prima fundamental para su trabajo.
texts.en:
German is 53 years old and married to María Eduvigis Lesme who is 52. Their union has produced three children who are now grown and on their own. The client started out selling cut wood with a small amount of capital he received in the year 1994. He later expanded his business, and now also makes and sells wood furniture with intricate details and finishes. Thanks to the great attention he provides, and the quality of his product, he has a well-established customer base. The loan he is requesting is for the purchase of the raw material, wood, that is fundamental to his business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wood.

loans.name: Emma Consuelo

texts.en:
Emma is a member of the Hope village bank. She is 52 years old and has three children who live with her. Her two elder children, who are 29 and 26 years old, both work but her youngest, 16 years old, studies at the local public school.

Emma is from Lima and studied secretarial skills in school. She worked for a judge but stopped working when her kids were grown up because she decided that she wanted more autonomy in her work. She started to sell beauty products from a catalogue and has been doing that for twenty years now. About a year ago she expanded by putting her product listings in the businesses where her daughters work. Her daughters have been able to help her with the sale of her beauty products.

Since she has joined FINCA she has been able to talk with other entrepreneurs about how to better administer her business.

Emma needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy rice packs, oil, sugar, and a stock of beauty products. Her dream is to open her own shop.

loans.use: buy rice packs, oil, sugar, and a stock of beauty products

loans.name: Francisca Magaly

texts.es: Francisca Magaly R. C. tiene 35 años de edad. Francisca se dedica a la venta de sillas y mesas plásticas, ella ha logrado obtener clientes fijos desde que inicio su negocio y esto le ha permitido obtener ganancias que le han ayudado a solventar gastos en su hogar. Hasta la fecha doña Francisca ha estado trabajando con financiamientos de Fundación León 2000 y nuevamente hoy recurre a esta organización con la necesidad de un financiamiento que le permita comprar ciertos artículos como: mesas, sillas  y bancas plásticas. Su deseo es lograr administrar de buena forma su negocio.
texts.en:
Francisca Magaly R. C. is 35. Francisca sells plastic tables and chairs. She has obtained fixed customers since she started her business. This has allowed her to get earnings that have helped pay the household expenses. Francisca has worked with loans from the Fundación León 2000. She now turns again to this organization. She needs a loan to buy certain articles like plastic tables, chairs, and benches. Her wish is to run her business well.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Kuña Aty Asentamiento San Antonio Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son del Asentamiento San Antonio de la cuidad de Eusebio Ayala.
Con el apoyo crediticio y las capacitaciones  que la fundación Paraguaya les brinda, hoy por hoy, aunque sea se sienten seguras de lo que comercialmente realizan ya que estos implican riesgos económicos y una buena planificación previa. 
A esta fecha operan con la fundación paraguaya en el ciclo número 3 del programa comité de mujeres emprendedoras, emprendiendo cada día proyectos de mejoramiento y desarrollo para personas  de escasos recursos. 
Estas Señoras agradecen a la Fundación Paraguaya por la oportunidad y todos los beneficios que han recibido, y esperan seguir al tanto de las reglas para continuar trabajando con la Institución. 
Las actividades que realizan estas señoras y en las cuales invertirán sus créditos son:
Guillermina Q.	Kiosko 
María Auxiliadora López	Venta de ropa
Mirian Celeste B.	Venta de cosméticos
Fermina López	Despensa                                                                                                                                                                          
Tomasa O.	Venta de chipa
Isabel V.	Venta de chipa
Laura Raquel M.	Venta de mercerías
Jeny A.	Venta de mercerías
Basilia D.	Kiosko
Gloria C.	Cría de pollo
Fátima G. 	Venta de verduras
Damasia M.	Venta de verduras
Mirian Z.	Producción y venta de croche 
Jorgelina M.	Venta de bijuterie
Salvadora V.	Venta de chipa
Fidelina C. Venta de carbón
Lorena G. Venta de Sabanas
Laura A. Venta de Ropas 
Limpia C.	Venta de dulces

Venta de Ropas 
Venta de dulces

loans.use: Compra de mercaderías varias como ropas, comestibles, carbón, biuouterie, hilos, frutas, hortalizas, etc.

loans.name: Yanina Margarita

texts.en:
Yanina is a member of the Hope village bank. She is 31 years old and has two children. She has a 1-month-old baby and a 9-year-old who goes to school at the local public school.

Yanina is the eldest of seven children. She finished her studies at public school and began studying computation, but stopped and started working as a maid in a hotel because her parents did not have enough money to pay the tuition. She stopped working as a maid after she became pregnant and took some time off to dedicate to her son. She currently sells sports clothes at gyms and her husband works as a mechanic and owns a small repair shop.

Since she joined FINCA, she says her life has improved: she has learned how to save, and she has capital to invest. Yanina needs a loan of 1200 soles to buy sports clothes and a few things for her house. Her dream is to have a shop in a commercial area.

loans.use: buy sports clothes and a few things for her house

loans.name: Alex David

texts.en:
Alex is a member of the Hope village bank. Alex is married and has one son who is 10 years-old and goes to school at the local public school. His wife is pregnant and is expecting soon. 
After Alex finished school, he served obligatory military service for two years and then began working because his family needed more money. He worked for out of his home for a while but decided to stop because it did not pay enough. With his savings he bought a car and uses it as a taxi service. Alex says since he joined FINCA it has been a great help to him because they lend him money when his taxi needs repairs. 
Alex needs a loan of 1000 soles for maintenance work on his car in order to continue his taxi service. His dream is to buy and sell used cars. Alex is dedicated to his dream and has already started saving.

loans.use: maintenance work on his car in order to continue his taxi service

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is a member of the Hope village bank. She is 34 years old and has one son who is 12 years old and studies in the local private school.

Amelia studied technical nursing and did her residency but stopped because she became pregnant and then dedicated herself to her daughter. Two years ago she decided to start selling beauty products via catalogue. Four months ago she decided to study baking in the Occupational Education Center of Government. She takes night classes and enjoys it because she is learning how to make different pastries and sweets. Amelia says that since she joined FINCA, she has developed personally and her self-esteem is high. She also says she has become economically independent and does not depend on her husband.

Amelia needs a loan of 800 soles to buy beauty products at discount rates so that she can resell them for a profit. Her dream is to have a bakery and she is confident that she will see her dream come true.

loans.use: buy beauty products at discount rates so that she can resell them for a profit

loans.name: Danilo Jose

texts.es: Danilo José T. tiene 36 años de edad, es un hombre soltero y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad. Su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de transporte de taxi la cual surge como una nueva fuente de ingreso para su familia. Este le ha permitido mejorar un poco su calidad de vida a su hogar. El combustible ha  sufrido mucho con el alza de los precios en los y es por esto que solicita a Fundación León 2000 un financiamiento de manera que le permita mejorar la condición de su automóvil y así ofrecerle a sus clientes un precio justo. Los deseos de él son aumentar sus ventas y mantener el núcleo familiar estable en todos los ámbitos.
texts.en:
Danilo José T. is 36. He is single, and he has two minor children. He provides taxi service. This developed as a new source of income for his family. This has allowed him to improve a bit the quality of life in his home. The increase in fuel prices has been difficult. That is why he is asking the Fundación León 2000 for a loan to allow him to improve the condition of his automobile. That way he can provide his customers with a fair price. He wishes to increase his sales and keep his immediate family stable in all ways.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rosalio

texts.es: Rosalio  vive en la zona # 6 de Nueva Guinea, trabaja en el instituto Rubèn Dario junto a sus dos hijas mayores de edad aquienes igual que su padre son docentes, su esposa Luisa tambien es docente de secundaria, esta solicitando su 6to crédito a la institución de AFODENIC para repellar la habitación  en su casa y asi mejorar las condiciones del hogar, se ha caracterizado por ser un profesional muy responsable, honesto y ha demostrado  buena conducta y moral crediticia, Rosalio y su familia son muy unidos y todos comparten los gastos familiares,  cabe señalar que con el crédito anterior logro satisfactoriamente construir una habitación para una mejor comodidad, esta familia aspira tener una vivienda con mejores condiciones, tener estabilidad laboral y salud.
texts.en:
Rosalio lives in area #6 of New Guinea. He works at the Rubèn Dario Institute, where he and his two oldest daughters are all employed as teachers. His wife Luisa is a high school teacher as well.

He is requesting his 6th loan from AFODENIC so that he can plaster a room in his house, thereby improving its condition. Rosalio is known for being a responsible and honest professional who demonstrates good conduct and moral credentials. He and his family are very close and everyone contributes toward the family expenses. It should be noted that his previous loan was used to build a comfortable room. His family aspires to improve their living conditions, have stable jobs, and maintain good health.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plaster a room in his house

loans.name: Blas

texts.es:
El Sr. Blas A. es de la ciudad de Carapeguá Barrio Virgen
de los Remedios, tiene 43 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Marina  y tienen 3 hijos todos en edad escolar.

      Hace más de 5 años que trabaja como vendedor ambulante  zonas, como Carapeguá, Roque González y Acahay. 

    Manifiesta que tiene clientela formadas gracias a que los productos son de buena aceptación. Gracias a su esfuerzo y su dedicación logró mejorar  su calidad de  vida y dar una vida  digna  a su familia. 

        Solicitó el préstamo con nuestra entidad para la compra de ropas.
texts.en:
Mr. Blas A. is from the city of Carapeguá, Virgen de los remedios Neighborhood. He is 43 years old, is married to Ms. Marina and has 3 children,all of whom attend school.

He has been a door to door clothing salesman for the last 5 years, in areas as Carapeguá, Roque Gonzalez and Acahay. He has regular customers due to the acceptance of the products. Thanks to his efforts and dedication he has managed to improve his family style of life and provide a decent living for them.

He is asking for a loan that will be invested in the purchase of clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Cruz Esmelda

texts.es: Cruz Esmelda es soltera, trabaja docente desde hace 10 años, tiene 2 hijos uno de 12 años estudiando su 6to grado de primaria y una niña de 5 años en preescolar, su compañero de vida trabaja en la finca como agricultor ambos comparten con los gastos del hogar y los compromisos adquiridos con AFODENIC, esta solicitando su 5to credito a AFODENIC para inventirlo en construcciòn de  una habitación para asi tener mas privacidad, a pesar que son una familia de escasos recursos económicos se caracterizan por ser muy responsables y humildes, esta familia son muy queridos por su comunidad ya que esta maestra tiene 10 años de impartir el pan de la enseñanza a los niños de su comunidad,  su sueño es tener salud, trabajo y una vivienda bonita.

loans.use: Construccion de una habitacion

loans.name: Confianza Y Desarrollo 1&2 Group

texts.en:
Jackelin is the group coordinator of the group Confianza y Desarrollo (Confidence and Development) which is based in the areas surrounding San Pedro. Here she resides with her husband and young children in a house made of wood with a tin roof, in an area where neither electricity nor running water is available.

Despite these obstacles, Jackelin has proven to be an excellent Esperanza associate, and since coming to Esperanza seeking funds to invest in her business, she has successfully repaid six loans. She is planning on using her most recent loan to continue investing in her business by purchasing items such as flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil in bulk to sell at her colmado (corner store). In this way she attains a better price and guarantees that she will have the necessary goods in stock. With the income she earns, she plans to continue improving the quality of her home, and her long-term dream is to make her home bigger. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Additional goods to sell in her Colmado (corner store)

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: Maria Luisa es casada, trabaja en la colonia San Miguel  a 22 km de Nueva Guinea, tiene 1 hijo de 10 años de edad estudiando la primaria, su esposo trabaja como agricultor en  una comarca quien le apoya con los gastos familiares, esta solicitando su primer  crédito a AFODENIC para inventirlo compra de materiales de construcciòn para mejorar algunos detalles que le hacen falta a su casa, Maria todos los dias tiene que madrugar para dejar hechos sus quehaceres y salir muy temprano a impartir el pan de la enseñanza a niños de la colonia San Miguel, se caracteriza por ser muy trabajadora, responsable y por ser una persona que ha luchado para ir poco a poco mejorando su vivienda,  su sueño es terminar de construir su vivienda para tener mejor comodidad, trabajo, y  llegar a ser una excelente profesional,  tiene como meta el proximo año estudiar una licenciatura para asi mejorar mas sus conocimientos.

loans.use: Compra de materiales de construccion

loans.name: Diego Manuel

texts.es: Diego Manuel S. Gutiérrez tiene 44 años de edad, su estado civil es casado. Tiene 3 hijos que dependen de él y asisten a clases. La actividad económica de Diego es la venta de helados, gaseosas y hot- dog. Hace más de 18 años que se dedica a esta actividad económica por lo que su negocio surgió por la falta de empleo con el objetivo de apoyar en los gastos familiar y así ayudar a su esposa. Los propósitos de Don Diego son de obtener  cada día el ingreso diario para su familia, ya que él ha luchado mucho para que sus hijos tengan la oportunidad de estudiar. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que con esto podría comprar los productos  necesarios. Los deseos más grandes de Don Diego son de establecer una pulpería.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es: Doña Rosa Amelia  trabaja como docente en en la colonia la Fonseca  a 35 km de Nueva Guinea desde hace 20 años, esta solicitando su 3er  crédito a AFODENIC para inventirlo en pintar la casa y hecharle el piso a la cocina, tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad que a pesar que no los tiene a cargo economicamente viven con ella en su casa y le ayudan con los gastos familiares del hogar,  se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy responsable y un ejemplo en su comunidad, pues enseñó a sus hijos buenos valores, a trabajar y a estudiar para ser personas de bien;  Rosa Amelia es una mujer muy querida en su colonia y en su centro de trabajo por ser una persona de buen vivir, responsable, trabajadora y  sociable en su comunidad, su sueño es mejorar sus condiciones de vida y llegar a conocer a sus nietos, salud y que su familia siempre permanezca unida.
texts.en:
Doña Rosa Amelia has been a teacher for 20 years in the town of Fonseca, which is 35 kilometers from New Guinea. She is requesting her 3rd loan from AFODENIC so that she can paint her house and install a kitchen floor. Her two adult children are financially independent, but they still contribute toward the family expenses.

Doña Rosa Amelia is known for being a very responsible woman and a role model in her community. She has taught her children good values, work ethic, and how to become good people. She is loved by many in the neighborhood. At the core of her work she tries to be a person that lives well, is responsible, works hard, and socializes within the community. Doña Rosa Amelia hopes to improve her living conditions, get to know her grandchildren, stay healthy, and always keep her family together.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: House painting & installation of a kitchen floor

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
En la Ciudad de Quiindy en el Compañía Comandante P. distante a 18km. de la oficina de Carapeguá uñas señoras de escasos recursos se enteraron del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y decidieron reunirse para recibir una información sobre el mencionado programa. 
Estas Señoras son activas la mayoría de ellas se dedica al trabajo de ventas y otras actividades ya mencionados mas arriba .Ellas buscando un poco mas de apoyo para fomentar através del crédito sus ingresos familiares y mejorar su calidad de vida . 
Necesitan de esta operación crediticia para invertir en sus respectivos trabajos y así poder lograr un crecimiento sostenible que les haga crecer como grupo y en forma individual. 
Las actividades individuales que realizan estas señoras, y en las que invertirán sus créditos son:
Ramona V.	Venta de comestibles 
Ma-Sixta R. D.	Venta de chipa
Etelvina R. D.	Venta de verduras y carne
Ermelinda R. D.	Despensa
Olga C.	Venta de Bebidas
Petrona P.	Venta de verduras
Ma-Elia C.	Venta de frutas
Mirian López	vendedora
Norma B.	Venta de remedios yuyos
Delicia G.	cantinera
Ma-Lourdes C.	Venta de verduras
Ester P.	Venta de Frutas y verduras
Vidalia C.	vendedora
Luciana F.	Despensa
Vidalia R. D.	Venta de chipas y dulces
Nancy B.	Venta de bebidas
Verónica A.	Venta de chipas
Natividad O.	Venta de chipas
Carmen G.	Venta de leche

loans.use: Compra de mercaderías varias como carnes, panificados, verduras, frutas, almidón harina de maíz, queso, leche, etc.

loans.name: Alexai Odalis

texts.es: Alexai esta solicitando su primer crédito esperando ser beneficiado por  el fondo Kiva, para invertirlo en construcción de una habitación, trabaja como docente en la colonia la Fonseca,  a el le urge construir una habiatacion y así mejorar las condiciones de vida del nucleo familiar ya que el interés es bajo por esta razon le gusta trabajar con esta intancia ya que fue recomendado por su tia, este cliente tiene capacidad y voluntad de pago, es un joven trabajador, honesto y muy apreciado en su comunidad, su esposa se encarga de los quehaceres del hogar, apesar que Alexai no tiene hijos le ayuda a su mamà con los gastos del hogar,  su mayor sueño es tener una vivienda digna y bonita, seguir estudiando para asi obtener mejores conocimientos y ser cada dia una persona mejor solicitamos al comites de crédito su aprobación.

loans.use: Construccion de una habitacion

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
El Sr. Luis M. Ruiz es de la ciudad de Quiindy, propietario de y una pequeña fábrica de miel dedicándose a esta actividad hace varios años con mucha experiencia en el ramo.
 Accedió a un crédito con nuestra entidad el cual fue empleado para la compra de caña de azúcar que es la materia prima principal de su producto, manifestando que le fue muy provechosa la asistencia crediticia que recibió. 

Con el crédito adquirirá una buena cantidad de leña que necesita para procesar la miel.
texts.en:
Mr. Luis M. Ruiz resides in the city of Quiindy. He owns a small honey business and has been engage in this activity for several years with much experience in the field.

He had a loan with our institution which was used for the purchase of sugar cane that is the main raw material of its product. He states that the financial assistance that he received was very useful.

He is asking for a loan that will be invested in the purchase of wood that is needed to process the honey.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Norwing Jose

texts.es: Norwing, esta solicitando su primer crèdito con el  fondo kiva, para repellar una habitaciòn y asi mejorar sus condiciones de vida de su familia, se caracteriza por ser un joven que ha luchado por seguir adelante en sus labores y por profesionalizarse, actualmente esta estudiando 2do año en la universidad URACCAN, muy responsable con sus deberes y es muy querido por sus alumnos y padres de familia, su sueño es terminar de estudiar la licenciatura en ciencias de Educacion, estabilidad laboral y ayudar a su familia  ya que son una familia de escasos recursos economicos que desean tener una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Norwing is requesting his first Kiva loan. He will use the funds to plaster a room in his home, thereby improving the living conditions for his family.

Norwing is known as a young man who struggled to get ahead in his work and his education. He is currently a second year student at the University of the Autonomous Regions of the Caribbean Coast of Nicaragua (URACCAN). He is very responsible in his schoolwork and beloved by the other students and his family.

Norwing dreams of completing his Bachelor of Science degree in Education and finding a stable job since his family has limited resources and desires to have a decent home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plaster a room in his house

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
El Sr. Marcelino Ávalos  tiene 28 años de edad y  vive en concubinato con   la Sra.  María Ayala  hace más  de 8 años, tienen  dos hijos uno  de 8 años que esta en etapa escolar  y el otro tiene  3 años.   

             Desde   muy  joven se dedicó a la venta ambulante,  su madre se encargaba de la  elaboración de  los  productos  y  el se encargaba de distribuir la  producción , trabajaron  juntos durante  10 años  mas adelante se independizó  y busco  nuevas  zonas  de trabajo  por cuenta propia,  trasladándose  en su motocicleta ya que es la manera  mas ágil de realizar  mayor recorrido. Hoy  día  cuenta con  mas de 300 clientes y su  actividad  le genera muy buen  ingreso 
 Gracias a este trabajo logró brindar una modesta casa a su familia 
                   Solicita el préstamo para la compra de sobrecamas, frazadas, manteles y sabanas.

loans.use: Compra de sobrecamas, frazadas, manteles y sabanas

loans.name: Geylin

texts.es: Geylin es casada, su esposo trabaja como agricultor, tienen una niña de 11 años de edad estudiando su 5to grado de primaria, vive en la colonia San Miguel de Nueva Guinea, esta solicitando su 3er crédito a la institución de AFODENIC para repellar la habitación y asi mejorar las condiciones del hogar, se ha caracterizado por ser una profesional muy responsable, honesta a demostrado  buena conducta y moral crediticia,    su familia es muy humilde pero bien unida unida,  Geylin con el crédito anterior logró construir una habitación para una mejor comodidad, aspira tener una vivienda con mejores condiciones, tener estabilidad laboral, salud y seguir estudiando para ser una profesional que le sirve al pais.
texts.en:
Geylin is married and lives in the town of San Miguel de Nueva Guinea. Her husband is a farmer and they have an 11 year old daughter, who is a 5th grade student. She is requesting her third loan from AFODENIC so that she can plaster a room in her house, thereby improving its condition.

She is known for being a responsible and honest professional who demonstrates good conduct and moral credentials. Her family is very close even though they live modestly. Geylin’s previous loan was used to build a comfortable room. She aspires to have a home with better living conditions, a stable job, and good health. She would like to continue studying so that she can become a professional who serves her country.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plaster a room in her house

loans.name: Jawas Pankarita Group

texts.es:
Gregoria V. de 46 años y Nancy Huanta de 20 años son dos integrantes del grupo “Jawas Pankarita”, son madre e hija,  ambas tienen la habilidad de tejer diferentes prendas y lo venden, las dos son madres Gregoria tiene  6 hijos, Nancy  tiene 2 hijos, y necesitan del préstamo para comprar lana y seguir en su actividad económica y así poder ayudar a generar ingresos en su familia.
Las demás integrantes de  “Jawas Pankarita” también tienen sus propios negocios, como la venta de ropa, alfombras, atención de llamadas, tienda de barrio y la venta de comida. Ellas necesitan del préstamo para la compra de  materia prima y mercadería y seguir operando en sus negocios.

loans.use: COMPRA DE MERCADERIA Y MATERIA PRIMA

loans.name: Dios Es Mi Pastor Group

texts.en:
Yoseli is the group coordinator of the group Dios es Mi Pastor (God is my Pastor) based in Boca Chica, a beach town close to San Pedro de Macoris in the Southeast of the Dominican Republic. Here she makes her home in a small house made of wood walls, tin roof and concrete floor with her husband and three children aged 14, 10 and 5. In this area of town, she says that electricity is unreliable and the water delivery can sometimes stop for "two days at a time." 

Yoseli's business is selling clothes in the street and with this loan, her second from Esperanza, she plans to purchase more blouses, jeans and women's shoes to sell to her clients. She says that she is ready to expand her offerings because she has developed a good clientele base and she always sells her clothing rapidly. With the profits she gains from this loan she plans to improve her home by adding a water pump to deliver water at all times as well as to replace the wooden walls with concrete walls (always a good idea in hurricane-prone and termite-infested Carribean islands). Additionally, she would like to continue investing in her children's education and, if possible, to purchase a computer for them to learn on. Her long-term dream is to build a second story for her home and to give a good life to her children, whom she hopes will be successful enough to support her in her old age. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Purchasing more clothes to sell

loans.name: Miller

texts.es:
El Sr.Miller G., es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, Barrio San Miguel, tiene 19 años de edad, vive con sus padres.

    Comenta que desde muy joven  trabajó con sus padres vendiendo ropas y zapatos, luego el empezó a independizarse ya que conocía varias zonas y así también poder ayudar a solventar los gastos de sus estudios. 

    Solicitó el préstamo con nuestra entidad para la compra de ropas.
texts.en:
Sr. Miller G. is 19 years old and lives with his parents in the San Miguel neighborhood of the city of Carapeguá.

He says that from an early age he worked with his parents selling clothing and shoes. He later began working independently and is now well-known in different neighborhoods. With his income, he is also able to defray the costs of his studies.

He is requesting a loan from our Institution to purchase clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Mirtha

texts.es:
La Sra. Mirtha B. es de la ciudad de Quiindy, es casada con un hijo; se dedica a la venta de ropas en dicha ciudad y en un local alquilado y que ya cuenta con muy buena cantidad de clientes.
 Había accedido a un crédito con nuestra entidad el cual fue empleado para la compra de mercaderías a modo tener un mejor inventario el cual le fue muy provechoso.

Con el crédito solicitado adquirirá distintas variedades de ropas tanto para damas como para caballeros.

loans.use: compra de ropas

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.es:
La Sra. Narcisa Domínguez tiene 26 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un niño menor de 2 años, viven en la ciudad de Carapeguá.

Es oriunda de la ciudad de Mbuyapey, de familia humilde, a sus 14 años debido a la gran necesidad económica, vino en busca de trabajo en Carapeguá donde consiguió trabajar como empleada doméstica. Cabe destacar que la señora con quien trabaja es de profesión peluquera, con ésta aprendió a trabajar en la mencionada profesión, además los fines de semana se dedica a la venta de perfumes y artículos de mercería que también significa un ingreso más para el sustento de su familia. 

Hoy día gracias a la aceptación de sus productos, logró formar una cantidad considerable de clientes en su ciudad natal, por lo que tuvo que recurrir a nuestra entidad. 

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de perfumes, remeras.
texts.en:
Sra. Narcisa Domínguez is 26 year old and lives in the city of Carapeguá. She is a single mother with a 2 year old child.

She is a native of the city of Mbuyapey and comes from a family of humble means. When she was 14 years old, out of financial necessity, she came to Carapeguá looking for work and eventually found a job as a maid. The woman who hired her is a hairdresser by profession and started teaching Narcisa everything about her business. On the weekends, Narcisa also sells perfumes and men’s clothing and accessories in order to earn money to support her family.

She is requesting a loan to purchase perfumes and T-shirts.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase perfumes & T-shirts

loans.name: Unidas En La Fe 2, 3 Group

texts.en:
Santa J. is a hardworking grandmother supporting her family selling various merchandise, such as clothing, perfume, deodorant, shampoo and kitchen goods. Selling these goods from her home and on the street, Santa is committed to getting products to her customers. She is so committed that she will wake up at 4 a.m. to take a four-hour bus to a large city to prepare her inventory.

Santa is the mother of 12 children, of which four live with her along with four grandchildren. She finds herself needing to use any profits to support the household with food and electricity. Her husband makes extra money creating and selling carbon for cooking.

Living with far too many people in too small of a house, Santa is hoping that with time, she will save enough money to improve her home. She describes the need to create more space for the 10 people living under her roof. She is thankful for the opportunity to take out her third loan with the hope of an improved business.

Thank you for this Kiva loan!

loans.use: Clothing, perfume, deodorant, shampoo, kitchen and other various goods

loans.name: Octavio

texts.es:
El Sr. Octavio C. Alcaraz   tiene 41 años de edad y  esta casado con   la  Sra. Vicenta  Sánchez   hace más  de 16 años, tienen juntos dos hijos uno  de 21 años que esta en la universidad y el otro de 12 años que actualmente se encuentra en etapa escolar. 

           Desde  muy joven se inició elaborando la tradicional sobrecamas que terminada su padre llevaba  a vender por la zona  de Caaguazù. Hoy  día el mismo realiza con  la ayuda de su esposa la venta  casa  por casa por la ciudad de Asunción.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de hamacas, frazadas, fajas y sábanas.

loans.use: Compra de  sobrecamas, frazadas, manteles y sabanas

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Ines es una mujer emprendedora de 54 años. Tiene 4 hijos todos independientes . 
Ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas y bebidas. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo ,el es comerciante  pues se dedica a la venta de materiales de pesca. Ella es socia hace dos años del Banco Comunal  “Virgen de la Natividad “. Su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles.

Con este préstamo de 2,000 soles, ella piensa invertirlo comprando más golosinas y bebidas.

La meta de Ines es  ampliar su negocio de golosinas y dedicarse a la venta al por mayor de bebidas como gaseosas y nectar.

loans.use: compra de golosinas y gaseosas

loans.name: Amor Y Amistad 2, 3 Group

texts.en:
Tania Morrobelo (fourth from left) is a mother of three who runs a beauty salon business from her home in the Dominican Republic. She has found her business to be quite successful, and is now taking out her 10th loan with Esperanza. She loves her business and is able to support her children, ages 18, 15 and 13. The 18-year-old is currently attending classes at the local university, and Tania hopes that her other children will want to follow this example.

With the profits from her business, Tania has been able to buy new equipment such as extra seats – and has also been able to make critical home improvements. With the help of the growth from previous loans, she has bought plates and decorations, and put in a bathroom.

Tania hopes in the future to have her own beauty salon outside of her house in its own location – and would love to see her one salon spread into several others in the area.

Thank you for this Kiva loan!

loans.use: scissors, shampoo, and other beauty salon supplies

loans.name: Zunilda

texts.es:
Sra. Zunilda  V.  tiene 52  años de edad es viuda desde hace  tres meses, tiene  tres hijos todos mayores de edad, viven en  el Barrio San Roque de Carapeguá.     

         Es propietaria de un  bar   que esta ubicado en centro mismo de la ciudad de Carapeguá, que  cuenta  con  muchos clientes  ya  que ella  misma  se encarga   de preparar  los menús  para  la  venta . Gracias a  su esfuerzo  y con  los ingresos  que  le genera su  bar logro pagar  los estudios  de sus  hijos  y lograron salir adelante. 
                   Solicita el préstamo para la compra de cerveza, gaseosa, vino.
texts.en:
Sra. Zunilda V. is 52 years old and has been a widow for only three months. She has 3 adult children and lives in the neighborhood of San Roque in Carapeguá.

She owns a bar located in the heart of the city of Carapeguá that is frequented by many customers. She is responsible for preparing the items on her menu. Thanks to her hard work, the revenue generated from her bar has helped pay for her children’s education and enabled them to succeed.

Sra. Zunilda is requesting a loan to buy beer, sodas and wine.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beer, sodas and wine

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
La señora Catalina R. tiene ya más de seis años dedicándose a la venta de ropa usada y elaboración de uniformes escolares, este negocio es la fuente de ella y su esposo el señor Pablo Ramírez , quien también le ayuda en el negocio.
Al negocio le esta haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía ya que se les termino y quiere surtir más y comprar tela para elaborar uniformes que le están pidiendo por el regreso a la escuela.
Es por eso que solicita un préstamo para poder invertir en el negocio y así tener más inversión en el negocio y para ellos.
texts.en:
Sra. Catalina R. has more than 6 years experience selling used clothing and making school uniforms. Her work has been the source of income for her and her husband, Sr. Pablo Ramírez, who also helps with the business.

At the moment, her business is lacking a variety of finished merchandise. She wants to increase her inventory and buy more fabric for making uniforms being requested for students returning to school. For this reason, she is seeking a loan to invest in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for resale & fabric for making uniforms

loans.name: Janny

texts.es:
Janny es una mujer emprendedora con mucha energía para el trabajo. Tiene 26 años, su principal actividad de trabajo es comprar uña de gato, que es una planta medicinal cuyos poderes curativos son muy eficientes en la salud, ella vende esta corteza a otras personas para su elaboración.
También se dedica en la compra y venta de sandalias, ella ofrece las sandalias en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad de Pucallpa.
Janny es madre de dos pequeños niños y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien trabaja en una empresa triplayera . Es socia hace cuatro años del Banco Comunal “Las Colinas”,
Empezó con un préstamo de 300 soles, el cual invirtió en productos de belleza.
En la actualidad ella requiere de un préstamo de 1,200 soles, que invertirá en la compra de  corteza de uña de gato y otra parte la invertirá en comprar sandalias.
La meta de Janny es tener un negocio de todo tipo de adornos para el hogar, juegos de sábanas, colchas, manteles, cortinas,etc.
texts.en:
Janny is an enterprising woman who possesses a lot of energy for her work. She is 26 years old and operates her primary business selling cat’s claw, a medicinal plant known for its curative properties and health benefits. She sells the bark of the plant to others for processing.

Janny also sells sandals, which she sells at different markets in the city of Pucallpa.

She is the mother of two small children and receives the support of her husband, who works at a timber company. Janny has been a member of the Communal Bank “Las Colinas” (The Hills) for 4 years. She started with a loan of 300 soles, which was used to buy beauty products.

She currently needs a loan of 1200 soles in order to buy cat’s claw bark. Part of her loan will also be used to buy sandals.

Her goal is to open a business that sells all types of home furnishings such as sheets, bedspreads, tablecloths, curtains, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cat's claw bark & sandals

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosita es una mujer entusiasta , dinámica y colaboradora, tiene 29 años, es madre de dos hijos . Ella se dedica a la costura, le gusta mucho confeccionar prendas de vestir y también hace lenceria, ya que cuenta con un pequeño taller de costura y tiene cuatro máquinas para realizar este trabajo. Rosita tiene el apoyo de su esposo quien trabaja en una tienda de repuestos y lubricantes de motos y motocarro. Ella es socia del Banco Comunal “Señor de Luren” desde hace  tres años. El primer préstamo que recibió fue de 300 soles.
Ella requiere otro préstamo de 1,500, el cual invertirá una parte en comprar telas y otra parte comprará polos y blusas hechas para vender.

La meta de Rosita es tener un taller de costura bien implementado y contratar personal para poder trabajar mejor y cumplir con el pedido que le solicitan y también de esta manera dar una oportunidad de trabajo  a otras personas.
texts.en:
Rosita is a very enthusiastic, dynamic, and collaborative 29 year old woman, mother of two children. She is a seamstress, and she enjoys making clothing items and also lingerie, as she has a small seamstress shop with 4 machines to do this work. Rosita has the support of her husband who works in a car and motorcar parts and oil store. She has been a member of the “Señor de Luren” Communal Bank for 3 years. The first loan she received was for 300 soles. She needs another loan for 1,500 soles to invest in buying fabric and polo shirts and blouses already made to sell. Rosita’s goal is to have a well implemented seamstress shop and hire people in order to be able to work better and meet the orders she has, and in this way provide an opportunity to work to other people.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric and premade polo shirts and blouses to sell

loans.name: Belen Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Belén inicia su noveno ciclo con 11 socias.
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. ropa, verduras, carnes, panes, bebidas, cereales, ferretería y crianza D. animales.
	
Como es el Caso D. Carmen que es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 6 hijos, Carmen venD. tripas D. animales, producto que adquiere en el camal D. la ciudad y lo comercializa D. manera ambulatoria.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 1050 soles, haciendo un total D. 5,400 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. verduras variadas, panes, bebidas y cereales

Los sueños D. las socias son mejorar sus negocios y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Para la compra de verduras variadas, panes, bebidas y cereales

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Family is the most important thing in Dan's life, which is why he and his wife decided to start their own greeting card business. Looking for a way to work flexibly from home while supporting their family, Dan and his wife started their business at their dining room table. A little over five years later, with five children and another on the way, Dan's business, iZon Greetings, has "grown tremendously beyond expectations". It is truly a family-run enterprise - in addition to six employees, every member of Dan's family contributes in some way, from design and photography to marketing and operations. iZon Greetings (www.izongreetings.com) provides a way for busy professionals to stay in touch with family and friends they hold dear. Over the years, Dan's business has grown from buying other wholesale cards to producing their own cards, selling them to 84 outlets in the U.S. and Canada. Dan prides himself on helping out other greeting card manufacturers by giving them free consultations on how to grow their business as he has. He is also dedicated to giving his employees the flexibility they need to meet their family's needs first, a value he holds of utmost importance in his own life. Dan came to ACCION USA because he was inspired by Kiva. He sees Kiva as an incredible opportunity to connect real people starting businesses, and an "awesome" gift for kids in lieu of the latest phone, clothes, or game. Dan truly believes in the power of the American Dream - that sense that small businesses have made the U.S. what it is, and have the power to change an entrepreneur's life. Accordingly, he wants to do his part to spread the word about Kiva. He plans to use this loan to bring his business into "the Internet age". It will pay for a rehaul of their computer and software systems, which haven't changed since the business was started, and for Web design services. iZon is also currently partnering with another organization called Hope is in the Cards that plans to spread the idea of "hope" to people experiencing rough economic times by sending greeting cards.

loans.use: To pay for a rehaul of their computer and software systems, and for Web design services

loans.name: Futurp Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Futuro inicia su ciclo 39 con 16 socias.
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. carne, cereales, ropa, animales menores, abarrotes en general, chicha, golosinas, artesanía, verduras, bebidas.
 	
Como es el caso D. Rufina que es casada y tiene 52 años, Rufina compra cereales D. las ferias y los comercializa en la ciudad D. Lima.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 600 soles, 900 soles, 1000 soles, haciendo un total D. 12,200 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. trigo, cebada, calzados, chompas, pantalones, golosinas, carne.

Los sueños D. las socias son comprar un carro, ampliar sus negocios y tener casa propia.
texts.en:
The Future Communal Bank begins its 39th cycle with 16 members. The members have different businesses like selling meat, grains, clothing, small animals, groceries, chichi, candy, artisan pieces, vegetables, and beverages. Such is the case of Rufina, married and 52 years old. Rufina buys grains in the markets and sells them in Lima. The members need different loan amounts such as 600, 900, or 1000 soles, totaling 12,200 soles for the Communal Bank loan. Their loans will be invested in buying wheat, barley, shoes, sweaters, pants, candy, meat. Member dreams incluD. buying a car, expanding their businesses and having their own homes.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wheat, barley, shoes, sweaters, pants, candy, meat.

loans.name: Felix Antonio

texts.es: Félix Antonio B. M.  tiene la edad de 38 años. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Esto surge por la idea de buscar una alternativa de otros ingresos económicos sus propósitos son de mantener a su familia y darle el beneficio de darle un lugar donde vivir ya que con su negocio es que puede salir adelante, sus sueños son edificar su casa y darle las condiciones necesarias. El un hombre muy responsable ya que le preocupa que su hijo obtenga los estudios necesarios. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo de ropa, calzado, perfumes y colonias.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Un Millon De Amigos Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Un Millón D. Amigos inicia su primer ciclo con 14 socias, la mayoría D. las socias son del barrio Nuevo Amanecer.
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. cereales, ropa, pescado, abarrotes en general, comida, se dedican a la agricultura y renovadora D. calzado.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 1000 soles, haciendo un total D. 6,100 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. trigo, maíz, cebada, ropa, arroz, azúcar, fideo y pescado.

Los sueños D. las socias son que sus hijos sean profesionales, ampliar sus negocios y tener casa propia.

loans.use: Para la compra de trigo, maíz, cebada, ropa, arroz, azúcar, fideo y pescado.

loans.name: Isaias

texts.es: Isaías G. N. tiene 40 años. Es un hombre casado. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es un taller de carpintería. Hace más de  10 años que se dedica a esta actividad. El inicio cuando tenía la edad de 15 años por lo que su Papa tenía un taller y él le enseño este medio de trabajo para salir adelante  y por medio de este pudiera mantener a sus 3 hijos. El es un hombre muy responsable y le gusto mantener esta fuente de ingresos Isaías trabaja muy duro todos los días pues siempre tiene trabajos pendientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de madera, herramientas en su taller entre otras cosas. Su deseo es mejorar la calidad de sus productos.
texts.en:
Isaías G. N. is 40 years old and married. He has a carpentry shop and has dedicated himself to this business for more than 10 years. He began when he was 15 years old as his father had a shop and he taught him this work in order to be successful and through this work he has been able to support 3 children. He is a very responsible man and Isaías works hard every day to maintain his income and he always has jobs pending to complete. The financing that he seeks is working capital to buy wood, tools for his shop, and other items. His wish is to improve the quality of his products.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to buy wood, tools, and other items for his carpentry business

loans.name: Juana Yamilette

texts.es: Juana Yamileth T. E. tiene la edad de 36 años. Doña Juana tiene 2 hijos. La actividad económica de Yamileth es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a vender este tipo de productos, la ubicación de su negocio en el mercado central en donde a diario obtiene clientes, por lo que dio inicio por cuenta propia para obtener los ingresos necesarios para cubrir los gastos de su vivienda. Ella tiene bastante tiempo de trabajar con la institución y expresa que los financiamientos son de mucha ayuda. El financiamiento que solicita por medio de Fundación León 2000 es para capital de trabajo como pantalones, calzado, camisas y cremas. El sueño de Yamileth es que sus hijos logren finalizar sus estudios para que el día de mañana sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Juana Yamileth T. E. is 36, and she has two children. Yamileth sells general merchandise. She has been selling this type of product for over five years. Her business is located in the central market. Every day she gets customers. She started her business on her own in order to get the necessary income to cover the household expenses. She has worked with the institution for quite a lot of time, and she finds the loans to be very helpful. The loan she is asking Fundación León 2000 for is for working capital to buy pants, footwear, shirts, and creams. Yamileth’s dream is that her children complete their education so that in the future they will be successful.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mundo Magico Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mundo Mágico inicia su primer ciclo con 18 socias.
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. repuestos, abarrotes en general, comida, libros, ropa, también brindan servicios D. sastrería, cabinas telefónicas y reparación D. carros.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, haciendo un total D. 8,700 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. repuestos D. carro, azúcar, arroz, leche, ropa, telas.

Los sueños D. las socias son tener casa propia, tener un local propio, sus hijos culminen sus estudios.

loans.use: Para la compra de repuestos de carro, azúcar, arroz, leche, ropa, telas.

loans.name: Aurora De La Concepcion

texts.es: Aurora de la Concepción M. Hernández  tiene  de 51 años, es madre soltera y con 3 hijos que no dependen de ella. Ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general a pesar de la edad esto no le impide salir adelante por medio del tiempo ha logrado obtener la experiencia necesaria para conocer a cada uno de sus clientes. Aurora inicio por que observo que muchos clientes buscaban la manera de proporcionarles a sus clientes lo que solicitaban y así le agrado la idea de facilitarles a sus clientes estos productos. El financiamiento es para capital y  comprar para la inversión de su negocio. El deseo de Aurora es darle mejoras a su vivienda ya que siempre ha luchado para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Aurora de la Concepción M. Hernández is 51 years old, and is the single mother of three children who are no longer dependent on her. She sells general merchandise, and her age has not prevented her from succeeding. She has gained the necessary experience to know each of her customers. Aurora started this business to be able to give her customers the products they were looking for, since she liked the idea of giving her customers these products.

The loan is for working capital to invest in her business. Aurora's wish is to improve her house, because she has always worked hard to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Trinidad Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Trinidad inicia su primer ciclo con 22 socias.
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta D. comidas, verduras, gelatina, medicina natural, cosméticos, abarrotes en general, condimentos, ropa, frutas, también brindar servicios D. sastrería, cosmetología y transporte.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, haciendo un total D. 9,300 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en L. compra D. medicina natural, arroz, ají, azúcar, fideo, frutas y verduras.

Los sueños D. las socias mejorar sus negocios, tener casa propia y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Trinidad" is beginning its first loan cycle with 22 members.

The members are involved in different businesses, like selling food, vegetables, gelatin, natural medicine, cosmetics, general groceries, condiments, clothing, and fruit. They also proviD. tailoring, cosmetology, and transportation services.

These members need loans in differing amounts like 300 or 600 soles, for a total loan of 9,300 soles for the communal bank.

Their loans will be invested in buying natural medicine, rice, pepper, sugar, beans, fruit, and vegetables.

The dreams of the members are to improve their businesses, have their own homes, and give a good education to their children.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy natural medicine, rice, pepper, sugar, beans, fruit, and vegetables

loans.name: Justacio Ramiro

texts.es: Justacio Ramiro P. tiene 67 años. Es un hombre casado, este Señor tiene 6 hijos su compañera de vida  trabaja en la administración  de una  venta de refrescos y gaseosa en su vivienda. Hace más de 30 años que se dedica a brindar el servicio de zapatería.la ubicación de su negocio es en las afueras del Mercado Santos Bárcenas por lo que en este lugar es donde hay más afluencia de clientes.  el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita  realizar las compras de hilo encerado, lija, pega, clavos y suela debido a que la compra de este se hace en Managua ya que al por mayor le resulta más conveniente y podrá realizar los encargos que tiene pendiente.
texts.en:
Justacio Ramiro P. is 67 years old. He is married and has 6 children. His wife runs a business selling soft drinks in their home. For more than 30 years he has been providing shoe-making services. His business is located on the outskirts of the Santos Bárcenas market, because this area has more affluent customers.

The loan is for working capital, which he needs to buy waxed thread, sandpaper, paste, nails, and soles, which he can buy wholesale in Managua. This will be convenient, and he will be able to fill all the orders he has pending.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Angel Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Ángel inicia su primer ciclo con 15 socias.
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta D. abarrotes en general, celulares, comidas, cereales, farmacia, además brindan servicio D. alquiler D. juegos, transporte, carpintería y albañil.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, haciendo un total D. 8,100 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en L. compra D. celulares, accesorios, madera, medicamentos, cereales.

Los sueños D. las socias son brindar una buena educación a sus hijos para que sean profesionales, tener casa y local propio y ampliar sus ventas.
texts.en:
The Ángel Community Bank starts their first loan cycle with 15 members. The members have different businesses like selling general groceries, cell phones, food, and grains. They also work in a pharmacy, proviD. a service of renting toys, proviD. transportation, work in carpentry and work as a bricklayer. The members need loans for different amounts like 300 PEN and 600 PEN. The total loan amount for their Community Bank is 8,100 PEN. Their loans will be used to buy cell phones, accessories, wood, medicine, and grains. The members’ dreams are to proviD. their children with a good education so that they become professionals, have a house, have their own location, and increase their sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cell phones, accessories, wood, medicine, and grains

loans.name: Mujeres De Combate (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El BANCO COMUNAL MUJERES DE COMBATE esta conformado por 7 socias emprendedoras y seguras de lo que desean en la vida, viven en el barrio de Huizhil perteneciente a la parroquia Baños, a unos 20 minutos fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca, es uno de muchos lugares hermosos que tiene la ciudad,  teniendo una vegetación exuberante y tierras fértiles para el cultivo, su gente es muy amable y calida como nuestras socias quienes nos brindan sus testimonios.

La Sra. Olga perteneciente al banco comunal Mujeres de Combate, vive en Huizhil, tiene 37 años de edad, casada  fruto de su amor procreo 5 hijos de 18, 14, 13, 11, 9 años de edad, todos sus hijos estudian, su hijo mayor ingresa este año a la universidad Estatal de Cuenca, su hija se encuentra estudiando en el colegio Garaicoa, y sus 3 últimos hijos en la escuela de la comunidad.

El esposo de Rosa Olga trabaja en la construcción y se apoyan en las buenas y en las malas. Olga tiene un negocio de helados y lleva trabajando desde que tenía 14 años de edad, comenzó a vender de otras personas hasta llegar ha tener su propio puesto de helados.
Nos cuenta que le va muy bien por que vende en el bar de la escuela de su comunidad, también realiza entregas en tiendas. Además tiene otro negocio  en su casa de crianza de unos pocos animales.

El préstamo que realiza en la fundación es para la compra de un refrigerador por la demanda que tiene de sus helados y además  necesita para ampliar su negocio.

El sueño de Rosa Olga es ver a todos sus hijos terminar los estudios superiores y ser buenos profesionales.

La Sra.María Gregoria es una socia activa del banco comunal Mujeres de Combate, vive en el Barrio el Paraíso que pertenece a al parroquia Baños, tiene 54 años de edad, esta casada y procreo 5 hijos de 38, 35, 33, 30, 28 años de edad, todos sus hijos se encuentran casados y viven independientemente cada uno con la familia que formaron. Viven en casa propia que es fruto del esfuerzo y  trabajo de su juventud, su esposo es su mejor amigo y compañero, el es quien le ayuda en su negocio.

Gregoria es comerciante de ropa, tiene un puesto propio en el centro comercial de la feria libre de Cuenca, trabaja hace muchos años en su local, su horario de trabajo es de 9 a.m. a 6:30 pm

Trabajó con la Fundación Espoir unos 4 años se retiro por un corto tiempo y de nuevo regresa por los buenos beneficios que obtiene y su facilidad de pago que le brindan.

El préstamo que realiza es para la ampliación de su negocio comprando más mercadería para damas, caballeros y niños,  surtiéndole mucho más, su sueño es de ya no tener deudas.

La Sra. María de Lourdes Minchalo vive en Huzhil y se integro a las socias del banco comunal Mujeres de Combate, tiene 47 años, es soltera y nunca llego a casarse, nos cuenta que mejor es estar sola que mal acompañada, vive con su mamá que tiene 74 años de edad, no viven en una casa propia.

María se dedica a la venta de granos  tierno y maduro como arveja, poroto, maíz, etc, y también a la venta de verduras y frutas de la región y otras ciudades. Esta actividad  la realiza desde la edad de 15 años en las afueras del mercado de la feria libre en Cuenca los días miércoles, sábado y domingo siendo su horario de 6 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, con nostalgia  nos dice que no ha llegado a tener un puesto propio.

Este es  su primer crédito en la fundación y espera realizar  más créditos de acuerdo a sus necesidades. El préstamo que realiza es para la compra de verduras, frutas, granos y otros productos de la región y de otros lugares y tener un mayor surtido para ofrecer a sus clientes, también para la compra de medicamentos para su mamá que por su avanzada edad sufre de algunas enfermedades

Su sueño es llegar a tener su casa propia y un carro para salir a otras comunidades con su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres de Combate" is formed by 7 hard-working women who are sure of what they want in life. They live in the Huizhil neighborhood, in the Baños parish, about 20 minutes outside of the city of Cuenca. It is one of the many beautiful areas in the city, with lush vegetation and fertile land for cultivating. The people are kind and warm, like our members who give us their testimonies.
