Currently, she needs money to cover the costs of transport to Atakpamé in order to renew her stock, which is depleted. This is why she’s requesting a WAGES loan for buying 50 sacks of charcoal. She is well-known by many hotels and restaurants.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is a member of the Pangani borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 30 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 1 child.Her child is aged 21 years.she also cares for other 2 dependent.

Stella started her own business selling wheat flour 12 years ago,she works 10 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 180,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Stella`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 250,000 Tsh in order to buy more flours for her business.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Stella hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more wheat  flour

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en: Catching fish and selling them in the neighborhood market is not an easy task or business. It needs a lot of patience and hard work. Sometimes the catch is so small it is not even enough to cover the expenses, but Mrs. Rhodora M. is determined that her children will have a good education and grow up without experiencing extreme poverty. This is the dream of the 32-year-old married woman with two children who lives in Barangay Tagda, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. Mrs. Rhodora has been engaged in this business since she was 14 years old. She helped her father catch fish and sold the catch in the neighborhood market and sometimes in the wider community. When she got married, she continued the business with her husband. As time passed, she needed more capital to invest in the business and this is why she decided to join NWTF-Project Dungganon. Mrs. Rhodora’s loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon have helped a lot in increasing her income, and this has enabled her to buy two more motorized fishing boats. She also sells dried fish and capiz shells (the shell of a marine mollusk used in interior decorating and for decorative gifts and accessories) - and these ventures earns her an aggregate of PHP 15,000 per month. For her 14th loan, Mrs. Rhodora is borrowing PHP 12,000 with which she plans to buy fishing equipment and to add to her revolving working capital. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment and to use as working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Achat de races améliorées de porcs

loans.name: Gagnaglo

texts.fr: Monsieur Gagnaglo a fait des études d’agronmie à l’Université. Après ses études, ne trouvant pas un emploi à son goût, il a décidé d’élever des races améliorées de porcs. Cette activité lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa femme et de leurs 03 enfants. Elle achète les porcins du Bénin, où il les élève pour la vente. Son parc d’élevage se situe à Agbata, à quelques kilomètres de Lomé. Actuellement il sollicite un crédit de WAGES  pour acheter 20 races de porcins améliorées ; ce prêt lui permettra également de rénover les lieux d’élevage pour accueillir de nouveaux porcins. Il a débuté son élevage en 2007 mais compte déjà beaucoup de clients
texts.en:
Mr. Gagnaglo studied agronomy at the University. Afterwards, since he found no work to his liking, he decided to raise pigs of improved varieties. This business enables him to provide for his wife and three children. He buys pigs from Benin, where he raises them to sell. His pig pens are located in Agbata, a few kilometers from Lomé. Currently, he’s requesting a WAGES loan to buy 20 improved pigs. This loan will also allow him to renovate the places where he raises them in order to accommodate some new pigs. He started his husbandry in 2007 but already has many customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy improved varieties of pigs

loans.name: Ayaovi Clémence

texts.fr: Cette dame s’est spécialisée dans la vente d’épices et d’ingrédients pour la préparation de la sauce. Elle a installé son étalage à la devanture de sa maison et exerce ce commerce depuis 1994. Elle a comme clientèle des mini restaurants, des bars et des ménages. Ce commerce lui permet d’aider financièrement son mari à subvenir aux besoins scolaires de leurs 02 enfants. Elle a besoin de renouveler  son stock hétéroclite. Pour cette raison, elle sollicite un crédit de WAGESS  pour acheter des gimgembres, de l’ail, des poivres et bien d’autres ingrédients.
texts.en:
This woman sells spices and sauce preparation ingredients. She has set up her stall in front of her house and has been practicing this occupation since 1994. Her clients are mini restaurants, bars and households. This business allows her to financially assist her husband in meeting the schooling needs of their 2 children. She needs to replenish her miscellaneous stock. For this reason she is requesting a loan from WAGES to purchase ginger, garlic, pepper and many other ingredients.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of spices and cooking ingredients

loans.name: Phlorng

texts.en:
Mrs. Phlorng D., age 60, is a widow with three sons and seven daughters. Six of them are married and live outside the family home and another two have full-time employment in Phnom Penh City. Phlorng’s family lives in a small village on National Road Number 2 about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Phlorng has been a farmer since 1979. She grows rice. Two of her daughters are garment factory workers and they spend a lot of money on transportation costs, so it’s difficult for them to manage income to support the family. To improve the situation, Phlorng is requesting her first loan of $1,000 in order to purchase a motorbike for her daughters to use to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her daughters to use to commute to work

loans.name: Kajificheni Group

texts.en:
Adela is a member of the Kajificheni borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 26 yeas old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children.Her children are aged 7 and 3 years.

Adela started her own food business selling bites 5 years ago,she works 10 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 130,000 Tanzania shilling.

This is Adela`s second loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 300,000 Tsh in order to buy more cooking oil,wheat.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Adela hopes to pay school fees,save money and expand her business.

Carolina is another member of the same borrower group.she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to expand her salon business.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil,wheat

loans.name: Danyo

texts.fr: Cette dame habite de quartier d’Adamavo à Lomé où elle vend du charbon de bois. Elle s’est lancée dans ce commerce depuis 1989. Le mari de cette femme est maçon et le couple a 04 enfants à sa charge. C’est parce que les revenus du mari n’arrivent plus à couvrir tous les besoins du foyer qu’elle a décidé de vendre du charbon de bois. Aujourd’hui sa longue expérience du domaine fait qu’elle dispose d’un nombre élevé de clients. Pour acheter 70 sacs de charbon de bois, elle sollicite alors un crédit de WAGES. Elle compte sur sa meilleure connaissance du secteur pour vite rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
This woman lives in the Adamavo neighborhood of Lomé where she sells charcoal. She launched this business in 1989. This woman's husband is a mason and the couple have 4 children in their care. It is because her husband's income no longer manages to cover all of the household needs that she has decided to sell charcoal. Today her lengthy experience in the field has given her a large number of customers. In order to purchase 70 sacks of charcoal she is requesting a loan from WAGES. She is counting on her excellent knowledge of the sector to quickly repay the loan.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Kiden

texts.en: Kiden A., a 37-year-old woman, is married to a primary teacher and has five children. She lives in Gudele town, west of Juba city, near Upendo University. Kiden sells various items in her shop near her home such as: soaps, sweets (candies), earrings, necklaces, and many other items. She is requesting a loan to purchase and stock more items to sell in her shop. With the extra profits from her loan, Kiden aims to build a drug shop at the market and to stock drugs to sell. She will need also to buy a motorbike for the easy transportation of shop materials to the main shop. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell in her shop

loans.name: Foluke

texts.en: Foluke is 45 years old and married with 4 children. She has a store where she sells t-shirt and has been in the business for long. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more t-shirt to sell . She say thank to all Kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase more t-shirt to sell

loans.name: Adjouavi Celestine

texts.fr: Célestine est revendeuse de bois de chauffage dans son quartier de Kpogan Bame à Lomé. Elle exerce ce commerce depuis 2004 et cette activité lui permet d’aider financièrement son mari éleveur de volailles pour l’éducation de leurs 03 enfants. Elle vend le plus souvent son bois à des revendeuses d’eau chaude au CHU Tokoin de Lomé et à l’Hôpital de Bè toujours à Lomé. Actuellement elle a besoin d’acheter de nouveaux bois ; c’est pourquoi elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour commander un camion de bois de chauffage.

loans.use: Achat de bois de chauffage

loans.name: Suleman

texts.en:
Suleman is 31 years old and married with a child. He lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria.

Suleman sells ties and has been in the business for a long time. He hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more ties to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more ties to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase firewood

loans.name: Tchotcho

texts.fr: Cette dame est une étudiante qui a finit ses études de gestion à l’université de Lomé. Ne trouvant pas un emploi à son goût, elle a décidé l’année dernière de se lancer dans la vente de téléphones portables dans la zone portuaire. Ses portables proviennent de la France et de l’Allemagne et elle connaît un vrai succès dans ce commerce. Pour lancer une nouvelle commande, elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 40 téléphones portables. Elle n’est pas mariée et n’a aucun enfant à sa charge.
texts.en:
This woman is a student who has finished her studies in management at the university of Lomé. Unable to find a job to her liking, last year she decided to begin selling mobile phones in the port area. Her mobile phones come from France and Germany, and she has had great success in this business. In order to place a new order she is requesting a loan from WAGES to purchase 40 mobile phones. She is not married and has no children in her care.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mobile phones

loans.name: Taingkea

texts.en:
Mr. Taingkea U., age 36, and his wife, Mrs. Chamroeun Kong, age 36, live along National Road Number One approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They were married in 1989 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. One of their children is married, another two are in primary school and one is a construction worker.

Tanigkea has been a construction worker for twenty years and his wife has been selling fruit for five years. She buys it from her village and some from the nearby village and transports it to sell at Phnom Penh market.

Tanigkea is applying for his first loan of $1,000 to help his wife to purchase fruit on contract for resale.

loans.use: To purchase fruit on contract for his wife's business

loans.name: Atito Kayi

texts.fr: Cette femme a appris la couture mais elle n’a pas trouvé les moyens pour ouvrir un atelier de couture. Elle est mariée, mais en 2001, son mari est décédé. Cette veuve a donc décidé de se lancer dans la vente des articles de merceries comme des fils à coudre, des tissus kaki et popelines. Cette nouvelle activité lui permet désormais de subvenir aux besoins de ses 03 enfants. Pour renouveler son stock presque épuisé, elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 04 rouleaux de kaki, 12 rouleaux de popelines blancs, 12 rouleaux de popelines carreau rouge, 12 rouleaux de popelines carreau vert et 20 rouleaux de diverses couleurs. Elle a ouvert sa boutique de mercerie dans le quartier de Baguida à Lomé.
texts.en:
This woman learned how to sew but she did not find the means to open a seamstress shop. She got married, but in 2001 her husband passed away. This widow therefore decided to begin selling sewing supplies such as thread, and khaki and poplin fabrics. This new business allows her to meet the needs of her 3 children from now on. To renew her almost exhausted supply she is requesting a loan from WAGES to purchase 4 rolls of khaki, 12 rolls of white poplin, 12 rolls of red checkered poplin, 12 rolls of green checkered poplin and 20 rolls of various colors. She opened her sewing store in the Baguida neighborhood of Lomé.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric and sewing supplies

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence is 48 years old and married with 4 children. He sells t-shirt and belt and he has been in this business since 1989. He hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more t-shirt and belt to sell, he say thank to all Kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase more T-shirt and belt to sell

loans.name: Thavy

texts.en:
Mrs. Thavy T., 41, and her husband, Mr. Sopheap Theng, 41, were married in 1988 and have two children: one son who attends school and one daughter who assists her mother in the business. The family lives along National Road Number One about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Thavy has been selling cucumber pickles and fruit for eight years. She buys them from her village and other nearby villages, and resells them at the market in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a motor taxi driver for three years and also assists in his wife’s business. But, his motorbike is old and breaks down and he decided to sell it.

Hence Thavy is applying for a loan of $1,200 in order to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to continue his motor taxi business. She will use a part of her loan to purchase one more shop for her daughter to sell cucumber pickles.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike for her husband's business and to set up another shop

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en: Iyabo is 45 years old and married with four children. She has a medicine store and hopes for the amount of N100,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. She say thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Amévi

texts.fr: Ce monsieur habite le quartier Avépozo à Lomé. Ce quartier est spécialisé dans la culture des produits maraîchers pour exportation. Cet homme exerce comme activité la revente d’emballages de ces produits exotiques. Les maraîchers achètent auprès de lui des paniers avec des couvercles en gros et en détail. Le monsieur s’approvisionne au Bénin et revend ensuite ces paniers. Il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour lancer une nouvelle commande de 560  paniers, 600 couvercles et le reste du prêt servira à couvrir ses frais de transport vers le Bénin. Cet homme est marié et a un enfant à sa charge.
texts.en:
This gentleman lives in the Avépozo district in Lomé that is a district specialized in market gardening for export. He has a business reselling packing materials for this exotic produce. The market gardeners buy covered baskets from him wholesale and retail. He stocks up in Benin and then resells the baskets. He’s requesting a WAGES loan to order anew: 560 baskets and 600 lids. And the rest of the loan will be used to cover the costs of transport to Benin. This man is married and has one child in his care.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy baskets for keeping and exporting exotic produce

loans.name: Mansata

texts.fr: Mansata Diédhiou est une femme de 46 ans, elle est mariée et a en charge 7 enfants. Avec son prêt elle développe un petit commerce de vente tissus teintés. Les bénéfices réalisés à partir de son activité lui permettent de participer quotidiennement aux dépenses de la famille. Elle participe également à la prise en charge de la santé de la famille.

loans.use: Renforcer son activité de commerce

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Mrs. Chantha S., age 41 (pictured with her daughter), is widow with two sons and three daughters. Two of them were married and live outside the family home and other three are garment factory workers. The family lives along National Road Number five about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Chantha has been growing rice on her own farmland in the village since 1989, a skill she learned from her parents.  She doesn’t have money to buy a motorized hand tiller for her farming business, that’s why she is applying for a loan of $1,000 to make the purchases.

loans.use: To purchase a motorized hand tiller for farming.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier de Kagomé à Lomé. Elle est mariée avec un mécanicien à deux roues (réparateur de motos). Le couple à 05 enfants. Les revenus du mari n’arrivant pas à couvrir tous les besoins du foyer, cette dame a décidé en 1998 de se lancer dans le commerce de produits  génériques pour aider financièrement son mari. Actuellement elle est très expérimentée dans ce commerce. Pour renforcer son activité, elle sollicite un prêt de WAGES pour acheter 01 carton de Sédaspir, 01 carton d’Efferalgan, 01 carton de Mixagrippe, 01 carton de Letanool, 01 carton de Grippe Water, 01 carton d’Anciclex, 01 carton d’Hémoglobine.

loans.use: Achat des produits génériques

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola is 47 years old and married with 3 children. She has a store where she sells books and has been in the business since 1999.  She hopes for the amount of N100, 000 to purchase more books to sell. she say thank you to all Kiva lender

loans.use: To purchase more book to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy generic pharmaceuticals

loans.name: Stany

texts.en: Stany J. currently lives in Hai Jebel, south of the town of Gudele, Juba City. She is a married woman with three children and is 25 years old. Stany’s business is selling tomatoes, cooking oil and onions and she is requesting a loan to improve on her stock. She will purchase and stock more foodstuffs to sell at the market. With the extra profits from her loan, Stany hopes to pay school fees for her children and to provide them with scholastic materials. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase and stock more foodstuffs to sell at the market

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a member of the Dodoma Road borrower group in Kihesa, Iringa. She is a 30-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of 4 children aged 12, 10, 5, and 3. She also cares for 3 other dependents.

Sarah started her own business selling charcoal 6 years ago. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 150,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Sarah`s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She requested the amount of 200,000Tsh in order to buy more charcoal for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Sarah hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for sale

loans.name: Leng

texts.en:
Mr. Leng P., 50, pictured with his wife, Mrs. Vy Dong, 54, were married in 1979 and have seven children: three sons and four daughters. Five of them are married and live outside the family home, one son works in plywood factory, and one daughter is a cashier, working for a restaurant in Phnom Penh. The family lives along National Road Number One about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Leng has been a chef for three years. He cooks for wedding ceremonies and other Khmer ceremonies. His wife has been selling soft drinks for five years as well. She operates the business in her village.

Now Leng is applying for his first loan of $1,000 in order to purchase a motorbike for commuting and also to buy more soft drinks for his wife to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for his business and to buy soft drinks for his wife to sell

loans.name: Joke

texts.en: Joke is 40 years old and married with 4 children. She sells books and has been in the business for long. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. She hopes for the amount of N100, 000 to purchase more books to sell. She say thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more books to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Achat d'apareils électroménagers

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is 50 years old and married with three children. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria.

Comfort has a bookshop and is requesting N100,000 to purchase more books to sell. She say thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more books to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Achat d'articles électroménagers

loans.name: Savy

texts.en:
Mrs. Savy S., 38, pictured with her husband, Mr. Samey Run, 38, lives along National Road Number One about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They were married in 1991 and have three daughters, one of whom is a garment factory worker while the other two are in school.
 
Savy has been selling desserts in front of her house for five years. Her husband has been driving a motor taxi (passenger-carrying motorcycle) for eighteen years in Phnom Penh. He now wants to drive a Tuk Tuk taxi (motorcycle-powered taxi), which will be better for him to generate income than driving a motor taxi.

So, Savy is requesting a loan of $1,200 to help her husband to purchase a trailer and also to buy piglets to raise.

loans.use: To help her husband to buy a trailer for a Tuk Tuk taxi and to buy piglets to raise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Achat d'appareils électroménagers

loans.name: Taiwo

texts.en: Taiwo is 38 years old and married with 3 children. He sell plank.He lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria and has been business for long. He hopes for the amount of N100,000 to purchase more plank to sell. He say thank you to all Kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase more plank to sell

loans.name: Minonkpè

texts.fr: Cette femme exerce comme activité le commerce de céréales, plus précisément le maïs, le tapioca, la farine. Elle exerce ce commerce depuis 1996 dans son quartier Abarakondi à Lomé. Elle est mariée et est mère de 02 enfants. Cette activité lui permet d’aider financièrement son mari conducteur de taxi moto pour couvrir les besoins du foyer. Elle vend aussi les jours de marché au Grand Marché de Lomé. Elle sollicite un prêt de WAGES pour acheter 12 sacs de maïs, 01 sac de farine et 01 sac de tapioca. Elle compte sur sa longue expérience pour rembourser son prêt.
texts.en:
This woman works in the cereal business, more precisely corn, tapioca, and flour. She has practiced this occupation since 1996 in the Abarakondi neighborhood in Lomé. She is married and is the mother of 2 children. This business allows her to financially assist her husband, a motorcycle taxi driver, in meeting the household needs. She also sells on market days at the Grand Marché of Lomé. She is requesting a loan from WAGES to purchase 12 sacks of corn, 1 sack of flour and 1 sack of tapioca. She is counting on her vast experience in order to repay her loan.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sacks of corn

loans.name: Chamroeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chamroeun H., 47, is widow with two daughters. All of them have a full-time employment. Besides of her children, she also has her nephew is living with her. Chamroeun lives in a small village along national road number two about 12 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Chamroeun has been a cleaner since 1998. She works for a garment factory. She travels to work by her bicycle very often. But, she now wants to purchase a motorbike; it will be more easily for her to manage to work. Hence Chamroeun is applying for a loan of $1,000 to make the purchases.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting to drive to work.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is 42 years old and married with 3 children. He sells medicine. He lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria.  He hopes for the amount of N100,000 to purchase more medicine to sell. He say thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Zaujat

texts.en:
Zaujat is a 24-year-old single woman and a member of the Nyamhanga borrowers' group. She lives in Ruaha, located in Tanzania’s Iringa administrative region. Zaujat opened her beauty salon two years ago where she works eight hours a day. She earns approximately 150,000 Tsh a month.

This is Zaujat’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She is requesting a loan of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more supplies for her business. With the additional profits she gains from the use of this loan, Zaujat hopes to save money and expand her business.

About BRAC Tanzania:

BRAC Tanzania is guided by the vision to aspire and work towards a just, enlightened, healthy and democratic society free from hunger, poverty, environmental degradation and all forms of exploitation based on age, sex, religion and ethnicity. The vision is explicitly reflected in the mission statement, which is to strive to bring about positive changes in the quality of life of the poor wherever it works.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for her salon

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is 45 years old and married with 6 children. She has a salon store where she fixes and braids hair for her customers. She has been in business for the past 15 years. She hopes for the amount of N100,000 to purchase more hair cream and hair extensions to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair cream and hair extensions to sell.

loans.name: Ama Dzigbodi

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier Avépozo à Lomé. Elle est mère de 03 enfants. Depuis que son mari est décédé et qu’elle est devenue veuve, elle s’est lancée en 1999 dans la production de petits biscuits traditionnels pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Actuellement elle a une clientèle assez vaste et reçoit des commandes lors des anniversaires et fêtes de famille. Ses biscuits sont très appréciés ; il arrive que des gens viennent du Bénin pour faire de commandes. Elle a même recruté 02 nouvelles personnes pour l’aider dans ses activités. Pour agrandir son offre, elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 15 sacs de farine de blé, 05 sacs de sucré granulé, 02 gobelets de beurre de Margarine.
texts.en:
This woman lives in the Avépozo neighborhood of Lomé. She is the mother of 3 children. After her husband passed away and she became a widow, in 1999 she began producing small, traditional cookies, in order to meet her family's needs. Currently she has a rather large clientele and receives orders for birthdays and family celebrations. Her cookies are well appreciated; sometimes people come from Bénin to place orders. She has even recruited 2 new people to help her in her business. To increase her supply, she is requesting a loan from WAGES to purchase 15 sacks of wheat flour, 5 sacs of granulated sugar, and 2 cups of margarine.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wheat flour, sugar and butter for cookie production

loans.name: Thavy

texts.en:
Mrs. Thavy C., 28 (pictured in front of her grocery store), and her husband, Mr. Oem Mony, 31, live along national road number one about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They were married in 2003 and have two young sons. 
 	
Thavy has been selling grocery in her village for 6 years. Her husband has been a teacher for 10 years. She is requesting her first loan of $1,000 to purchase more grocery items for expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for her stock.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 54 years old and married with 7 children. She sells sarongs and has been in business for a long time. She lives in Ibadan. She hopes for the amount of N50,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: A.k.tchamba

texts.fr: Cet homme était comptable dans une société commerciale à Lomé. Mais en 2006, cette société est tombée en faillite ; pour cela il a perdu son emploi. C’est ce qui l’a amené à devenir propriétaire d’un club de Vidéo et du foot en direct. Son club mobilise beaucoup de jeunes du quartier populaire Avepozo lors de la diffusion des grands matchs internationaux et nationaux. Cette activité lui permet désormais de subvenir aux besoins de sa femme et de leurs 02 enfants. Pour acquérir de nouveaux matériels, il sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour l’achat de 03 décodeurs, une antenne Cfi, 02 postes téléviseurs et un baffle.

loans.use: Achat de décodeurs, d'antennes, poste téléviseurs et baffles

loans.name: Diamilatou

texts.fr: Diamilatou T. est une femme de 42 ans, elle est mariée et a 5 enfants en charge. Depuis 6 ans et demi elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Tobor Kagnarou et c'est la 13ème fois qu'elle reçoit prêt. L'objectif de son crédit est d'achèter des fruits à Ziguinchor pour aller les revendre dans la capitale (Dakar). Avec ses bénéfices elle soutient son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille par rapport à la nourriture et la santé.
texts.en:
Diamilatou T. is a 42 year old woman. She is married and has 5 children in her care. For six and a half years she has been a member of the Banc Villageois (Village Bank) of Tobor Kagnarou and this is the 13th time that she has received a loan. The goal of her loan is to purchase fruits in Ziguinchor to sell in the capital (Dakar). With the profits she will support her husband in caring for the family with regards to diet and health.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promoting her fruit sales business

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is forty years old, widowed and a mother of three children ages 13, 17 and 20. She is a member of the Muhimba borrowers’ group in Ilala, located in Tanzania’s Iringa administrative region. Ten years ago Jane set up shop selling commodities like rice, cooking oil, soda, Colgate personal products and cake. She works fourteen hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 180,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Jane’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She is requesting a loan of 350,000 Tsh in order to buy more stock for her shop. With the additional profits she gains from the use of this loan, Jane hopes to save more money and expand her business.

About BRAC Tanzania:

BRAC Tanzania is guided by the vision to aspire and work towards a just, enlightened, healthy and democratic society free from hunger, poverty, environmental degradation and all forms of exploitation based on age, sex, religion and ethnicity. The vision is explicitly reflected in the mission statement, which is to strive to bring about positive changes in the quality of life of the poor wherever it works.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her shop

loans.name: Chim

texts.en:
Mr. Chim C., 48, and his wife, Mrs. Sokhoeun Am, 52, were married in 1982 and have three children: one son and two daughters. One of their daughters is a garment factory worker and the other two children attend school. The family lives along National Road Number Five about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Chim has been selling piglets for more than thirty years. His wife stays at home to take care of their children. In the past, she used to sell lotus flowers in the local market. Chim’s motorbike is old so he wants to purchase a new one, but he doesn’t have enough money. Thus, he is asking for a loan of $500 in order to make the purchase.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike to replace the old one.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase decoders, antennas, television set and speakers

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is 30 years old, married and the mother of two children, ages ten and seven. She is a member of the Mgodi borrowers’ group in Kinyanambo, located in Tanzania’s Iringa administrative region. Ester started her own clothing business selling vitenge and kanga (types of fabric) two years ago. She works twelve hours a day and earns approximately 150,000 Tsh a month.

This is Ester’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She is requesting a loan of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more fabric. With the additional profit she stands to gain from the use of this loan, Ester hopes to save more money and expand her business.

About BRAC Tanzania:

BRAC Tanzania is guided by the vision to aspire and work towards a just, enlightened, healthy and democratic society free from hunger, poverty, environmental degradation and all forms of exploitation based on age, sex, religion and ethnicity. The vision is explicitly reflected in the mission statement, which is to strive to bring about positive changes in the quality of life of the poor wherever it works.
.

loans.use: To buy more vitenge and kanga fabric

loans.name: Adakou

texts.fr: Cette dame s’est spécialisée dans la vente de pâte fermentée communément appelée « kom » dans le quartier de Kpogan à Lomé. Elle a débuté cette activité depuis 1992, ce qui lui permet d’aider financièrement son mari photographe à subvenir aux besoins de leurs 02 enfants. Elle vend le plus souvent sa pâte aux différentes couches de la population. Elle réalise actuellement de très bonnes affaires dans son commerce. Pour disposer d’un stock suffisant pour continuer ses activités, elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 17 sacs de maïs et 10 paniers de poissons.
texts.en:
Adakou D. has specialized in the sale of fermented dough commonly called "kom". Her business is located in the Kpogan neighborhood in Lomé. She has been active in this trade since 1992, which allows her to have the financial means to help her husband, who is a photographer, to provide for their two children. She usually sells her dough to a diversified clientele. Currently her business is very profitable. So as to have a sufficient inventory to continue her activity, Adakou applies to WAGES for a loan to buy 17 bags of corn and 10 baskets of fish.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn and fish to prepare fermented corn dough

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophal A., age 45, and her husband, Mr. ThA. Leang, age 50, were married in 1983 and have six sons and two daughters. Two of their sons are married and live outside the family home, one daughter is a garment factory worker, one son is a blacksmith and another son is a fisherman. The family lives along National Road Number Five about thirty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sophal and her husband have been growing rice since they were married. Besides farming, Sophal also has been selling groceries and cosmetics (lotions) since 2006. Her husband is a mason as well and operates his business in his village.

Sophal is a applying for a loan of $350 to purchase fishing nets for her son’s fishing business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets for her son’s fishing business

loans.name: A.e.augustine

texts.fr: Augustine est une dame qui habite le quartier Avépozo à Lomé. Elle s’est lancée en 2002 dans la vente de céréales de maïs et d’haricots. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle a beaucoup de clients de vente en gros et de détail. Pour disposer d’un nouveau stock, elle sollicite un prêt de WAGES pour acheter 35 sacs de maïs et 15 sacs d’haricot. Le reste du prêt lui permettra de couvrir ses frais de transport vers Cinkassé, le nord du pays.
texts.en:
Augustine is a lady who lives in the Avépozo district in Lomé. In 2002, she got started in selling grains: corn and beans. She is married and the mother of three. She has many customers who sell at the wholesale or retail level. In order to obtain a new inventory, she’s requesting a WAGES loan to buy 35 sacks of corn and 15 sacks of beans. The rest of the loan will allow her cover the costs of transport to Cinkassé, in the country’s north.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of corn and beans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Achat de sacs de mais et d'haricots

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria, a 24-year-old woman, is married and the mother of a 6-year-old child. She started her own business selling local beer three years ago. Maria works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 110,000 Tanzania shillings.

Maria is a member of the Mgodi borrower group in Kinyanambo, Iringa. This is Maria's first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more maize for local beer. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Maria hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more maize for local beer

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Cette dame a appris le métier de la couture. Elle exerce cette activité depuis 2007. Elle est mariée et son atelier lui permet d’aider financièrement son mari à subvenir aux besoins de leurs 04 enfants. Lorsqu’elle avait ouvert son atelier de couture, elle avait acheté une machine à coudre de deuxième main. Elle sollicite en ce moment un crédit de WAGES pour acheter une nouvelle machine ; elle veut remplacer son ancienne machine tombée en panne. Elle est dans l’urgence de recevoir ce crédit.
texts.en:
This is a lady who learned the trade of sewing. She has been in this business since 2007. She is married and her workshop allows her to help her husband financially in providing for their four children. When she opened her sewing shop, she had purchased a second-hand sewing machine. She’s now requesting a WAGES loan to buy a new machine; she wants to replace her old, malfunctioning one. She’s in a rush to receive this loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema, a 23-year-old woman, is married and the mother of a 4-year-old child. She started her own clothing business selling used clothes two years ago. Rehema works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 120,000 Tanzania shillings.

Rehema is a member of the Mgodi borrower group in Kinyanambo, Iringa. This is Rehema's first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She requested 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes to sell. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Rehema hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes

loans.name: Duncan Shem

texts.en:
Duncan Shem O. is thirty six years of age and married to Pauline Mbeti Mwacharo. They have two children named Sarah Bosisbori and David Mwacharo.

The client has no loans from other MFI's and was introduced to KADET through Existing clients.

Duncan's business is in the Westlands (a neighborhood in Nairobi) and his customers are tourists.

The client plans to use the loan to boost his wood carving and bag production/trade business. Duncan believes that he is hardworking and focused and that these traits will allow him to realize his dreams of selling his products internationally.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: The client intends to increase stock of wood carvings and Bags.

loans.name: Monicah Cherotich

texts.en:
Monicah is 41 years old and she is blessed with one a four year old child .Her retail shop is located in Eldoret Town (in the rift valley) and her major clients are residents of Kahoya.

She has been in this retail business for the past nine years.With the loan she is taking from KADET she intends to buy more stock which includes sugar,water,cocoa,rice,biscuits,soaps ,detergents and cooking oil.In future she wants to grow her business to wholesale,build a house and educate her child.

She was introduced to KADET by a client.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To add stock to her shop which include sugar,rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Zuwena

texts.en:
Zuwena, a 28-year-old woman, is married. She started her own shop business selling Colgate, cooking oil, salt, etc. two years ago. Zuwena works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 150,000 Tanzania shillings.

Zuwena is a member of the Mgodi borrower group in Kinyanambo, Iringa. This is Zuwena's first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She requested 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more shop commodities. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Zuwena hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more shop commodities

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is married with three children. She established her grocery shop a few years ago using her savings. With the help from FATEN, she received several loans and repaid all of them on time.

The shop helps the family to have extra income, especially since they have a young daughter who is disabled with special needs, and who needs a lot of attention and medical treatment that increases the family’s expenses.

Norma needs the loan to buy new products for her shop. She appears in the photo at her shop.

loans.use: To purchase new products for her shop

loans.name: Lydia Akossiwa

texts.fr: Cette dame a perdu son mari ; elle est devenue veuve et supporte seule les frais de scolarité de son enfant. C’est ainsi qu’en 2006, elle s’est lancée dans la vente de charbons de bois. Elle réussit bien dans ce commerce dans le quartier Adidogomé à Lomé. Actuellement elle dispose de beaucoup de clients achetant soit des sacs entiers, soit en détail. Pour renouveler son stock presque fini, il sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 25 sacs de charbons de bois. Elle est convaincue qu’elle pourra rembourser à temps.
texts.en:
This lady lost her husband; she has become a widow. She covers the schooling costs for her child all by herself. And so, she got started in selling sacks of charcoal in 2006. She is successful in this business in the Adidogomé district of Lomé. She has many customers right now who buy either entire sacks or at the retail level. To renew her almost-depleted stock, she’s requesting a WAGES loan to buy 25 sacks of charcoal. She is convinced of being able to repay on time.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Kossé Agbemébia

texts.fr: Ce jeune homme est spécialisé dans la vente des cartes de recharge cellulaire. Ce revendeur ambulant a débuté cette activité génératrice de revenus depuis 2007 à Lomé. Il vend le plus souvent dans le Grand Marché de Lomé où il est très connu des femmes d’affaires vendeuses de pagnes de qualité. Il distribue aussi ses cartes dans les bars et restaurants de la capitale. Il dispose en plus comme clientèles les cabines téléphoniques et cellulaires de la ville de Lomé. Actuellement il n’a plus presque de stock ; il sollicite donc un crédit de WAGES  pour commander 50 cartes de recharge de 1000Fcfa, 100 cartes de recharges de 2000Fcfa et 11 cartes de recharge de 4500Fcfa. Il n’est pas marié et n’a aucun enfant à sa charge.
texts.en:
This young man is specialized in the sale of rechargeable phone cards for cell phones. He makes his sales by walking through the streets and began the business in 2007 in Lomé. He makes most of his sales in the Big Marketplace of Lomé where he is well-known among the women who sell high quality "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth). He also distributes his phone cards in the bars and restaurants of the capital. He also counts telephone booths and cell booths of the city of Lomé among his customers.

Presently he has no more cards in stock; he is thus asking WAGES for a loan to buy 50 rechargeable cards for 1000 F CFA, 100 cards for 2000 F CFA and 11 cards for 4500 F CFA. He is not married and not raising any children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of rechargeable phone cards for re-sale

loans.name: Vumilia

texts.en:
Vumilia is a member of the Mgodi borrower group in Kinyanambo, Ilala.  She is a 30 year old woman, married and a mother of 3 children. Her children are aged 9, 7, and 3 years old.

Vumilia started her own business selling animal medicine 2 years ago.  She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 250,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Vumilia's first loan from BRAC Tanzania.  She requested the amount of 250,000 Tsh in order to buy more  animal medicine.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Vumilia hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more animal medicine

loans.name: Adjélé Mawuégna

texts.fr: Adjélé est une dame qui fait le commerce d’alimentation générale dans le quartier Vakpossito à Lomé. Elle a débuté ce commerce depuis 2007. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle est très connue dans son quartier où beaucoup de personnes viennent s’approvisionner chez elle. Dans son quartier, elle est la seule à vendre les produits d’alimentation générale, ce qui fait qu’elle réalise de bonnes affaires. Actuellement elle veut aussi se lancer dans la vente de maïs à la demande de ses clients. Elle doit aussi renouveler son stock d’alimentation générale. Pour cela, elle souhaite avoir un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 15 sacs de maïs, 01 carton de sardine, 01 carton de Spaghetti, 05 petits bidons d’huile et 02 cartons de savons de beauté
texts.en:
Adjélé is a lady who sells foodstuffs in the Vakpossito neighborhood in Lomé. She began this business in 2007. She is married and the mother of one child. She is very well-known in her neighborhood where lots of people come to do their shopping with her.

In her neighborhood she is the only one who runs a general store, which means she makes a lot of sales. Presently, she is also getting into selling maize, at the request of her customers. She also needs to replenish her stocks of foodstuffs. For that reason, she is asking for a loan from WAGES to buy 15 sacks of maize, 1 case of sardines, 1 case of spaghetti, 5 tins of oil, and 2 cases of face soap.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of sacks of maize and other grocery items

loans.name: Edina

texts.en:
Edina is a member of the Mgodi borrower group in Kinyanambo, Iringa. She is 30 years old, widowed and the mother of three children. Her children are 14, 11, and 3 years old.

Edina started her own business three years ago selling vitenge and kanga (different types of colorful fabric). She works eight hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 120,000 Tanzania shillings (TZS).

This is Edina`s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She requested the amount of 200,000 TZS in order to buy more fabric to sell. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Edina hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more vitenge and kanga to sell.

loans.name: Jones Kilungya

texts.en:
Jones Kilunge K. is married to Mary Jones. He is thirty-five years old and has one child named Jane Katunge Jones who is three years old. Jones believes he is hardworking and focused.

Jones has six years’ experience selling charcoal from his second-story retail space. His clientele comes from hotels, small cafes and nearby residents. With his loan Jones plans to increase his stock of charcoal in the face of the coming rainy season. With the increased profits from these sales, he will then purchase a paraffin machine pump. Jones’ hopes and dreams are to become a wholesale and retail dealer in paraffin.

Jones was introduced to KADET by other KADET members. This is his first loan with KADET, and he has no loans from other MFI's.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to empowering its clients economically through its financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To increase stocks of charcoal.

loans.name: Idowu

texts.en: Idowu is 50 years old and married with 3 children. She has a store where she sells cement. She has been in this business for the past 8 years. She hopes for the amount of N100,000 to purchase more cement to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cement to sell

loans.name: Keji

texts.en:
Keji M. is living in Gudele town next to Gudele primary school. Keji is  a mother of three children who all go to school, she is married to a driver and agging to 28 years.

Keji currently sells beer at the bar and is requesting a loan from Kiva through Brac southern Sudan in order to purchase and stock more beers, wines, whiskies and many others to sell.

With the extra profits from her loan, Keji wants to support her family by building a parmanent house for settlement.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase wines, beers, whiskies etc to sell

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael O. has been a mechanic in Naivasha town for the last eight years. He is married to Millicent O. and they have a four-year-old child. This will be Michael's first loan with KADET and he plans to use the loan to buy motor vehicle spares to use in his garage. In future, Michael plans to add a retail section in his garage to sell motor vehicle spare parts to diversify his income stream. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To buy motor vehicle spare parts

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 40 years old and married with 5 children. She sells medicine. She is requesting the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more medicine to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Oluwafumisho

texts.en:
Oluwafumisho is 50 years old and married with three children. She sells medicines and has been in this business for the past ten years.

Oluwafumisho hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. Will this, she can meet the demands of her customers. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Yemi

texts.en:
Yemi is 27 years old and married. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria.

Yemi sells sarongs. She hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She say thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Poni

texts.en: Poni J. is 25 years old and is married with a husband who is a businessman. They have three children and the children go to school. Poni is currently in the business of selling rice, beans, maize flour, etc. and is requesting a loan to purchase more beans to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, Poni hopes to be able to buy food for home consumption. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more beans to sell

loans.name: Komi Nestor

texts.fr: Nestor est un jeune homme du quartier de Gblinkomé. Il a appris la restauration et est donc cuisinier. Ne trouvant pas d’emploi dans un hôtel, il a décidé d’ouvrir en 2004 son petit restaurant pour subvenir à ses besoins. Son cafétéria est situé au bord d’un grande route internationale, ce qui fait qu’il est visité par beaucoup de clients. Pour éviter une éventuelle baisse de son stock, il sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 03 cartons de lait, 01 panier de tomates naturelles, 15 plateaux d’œufs, 10 casiers de bières, 03 cartons de pâtes alimentaires (spaghetti) et 01 grand bidon d’huile. Nestor n’est pas marié et n’a aucun enfant à sa charge.
texts.en:
Nestor is a young man from the Gblinkomé district. He learned food service and is a cook. Not having found work in a hotel, he decided in 2004 to open his own little restaurant in order to support himself. His cafeteria is situated along a big international road so he gets a lot of customers. To avoid running short of foodstuffs, he is asking WAGES for a loan to buy 3 cases of milk, 1 basket of fresh tomatoes, 15 trays of eggs, 10 cases of beer, 3 cases of spaghetti, and 1 big tin of oil. Nestor is not married and not raising any children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various foodstuffs and drinks for his restaurant

loans.name: Yetunde

texts.en:
Yetunde is 40 years old and married with six children. She rents tables, chairs, etc., and has been in this business since 1999.

Yetunde hopes for the loan of N180,000 to purchase more tables and chairs to rent. She say thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tables and chairs to rent

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam, a 30-year-old woman, is married and the mother of two children, ages 10 and 17 years old. She started selling clothes 10 years ago. Mariam works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 150,000 Tanzania shillings.

Mariam is a member of the Upendo borrower group in Kinyanabo, Iringa. This is Mariam's first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She requested 200,000 Tanzania shillings in order to buy more clothes to sell. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Mariam hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Merema

texts.fr: Cette femme assure seule l’éducation scolaire de ses 02 enfants. Elle est mariée, mais elle a perdu son mari et est devenue veuve. Pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants, elle s’est lancée en 2007 dans le commerce d’alimentation générale. Elle exerce cette activité dans sa maison dans le quartier Souza-Nétimé à Lomé. Elle a besoin d’avoir de nouveaux stocks, c’est pourquoi elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 01 carton de mayonnaises, 04 cartons de sardines, 05 cartons de tomates en boîtes, 05 cartons de Spaghetti, plusieurs sachets de savons en poudre et 05 cartons de piles de 3 voltes.
texts.en:
This woman is alone responsible for the schooling of her two children. She is married but she lost her husband and is a widow. To support her children, she began selling groceries in 2007. She does this business in her home in the Souza-Nétimé neighborhood in Lomé. She needs to replenish her stock and that is why she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 1 case of mayonnaise, 4 cases of sardines, 5 cases of tinned tomatoes, 5 cases of spaghetti, several bags of powdered soap and 5 cartons of 3-volt batteries.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of groceries for re-sale

loans.name: Sabina Anyango

texts.en:
Sabina is a single lady who owns an open-air shop where she sells second-hand clothes. She has been running her business for the past 11 years, and makes a profit of approximately 5,500 KES a month. Sabina had previously received a loan from Sunlink, another MFI in Kenya. She was later introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by a member.

Sabina's business is at the side of the road in the Buruburu area, enabling her to attract customers who are just passing by as well as neighbors. She wants to use her loan to buy more stock.  With the excess profits, she hopes to buy a stand to use as a temporary shop and, eventually, to get a more permanent location.

About KADET
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Alice Kemunto

texts.en:
Alice Kemunto is 34 years old and is married to Nashon Omenge, a businessman. Alice is hard-working, and has a second-hand clothing business and a hair salon. She has been in business for three years and was introduced to Kiva partner KADET by a current KADET client. Alice's businesses are in a highly populated area and therefore her stock is fast moving. She wants to use her loan to buy more stock for both her second-hand clothing business and her hair salon. With the extra profits generated from the loan, she plans to build some homes to rent out.

Alice's hopes and dreams are to increase her income so that she can meet her family's needs (such as school fees), and to open another clothes outlet.

About KADET
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To purchase jackets, sweaters and T-shirts for her used clothes business, and hair products for her salon

loans.name: Fatima Del Rosario

texts.es: Fátima del Rosario R. M. tiene 41 años. Su actividad económica es el destace de cerdo. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella dio inicio desde muy joven por lo que tenía que sacar adelante a su único hijo. Ella es una Señora muy luchadora y siempre le ha gustado trabajar para mantener a su familia. Su Mama le había enseñado todo lo necesario para vender este tipo de productos y además tenía que aprender a comprar los cerdos, por lo que esto le ayudaría en un futuro. Actualmente ella solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de cerdos. Ya que recorre muchos repartos para conseguir un buen cerdo y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Su deseo es que su hijo finalice sus estudios.
texts.en:
Fátima del Rosario R. M. is 41. She butchers pigs. She has been in this business for over seven years. She started very young because she had to help her only son get ahead. She is very determined, and she has always liked to work to support her family. Her mother taught her everything she needed to know to sell this type of product. Also, she had to learn how to buy the pigs because this would help her in the future. She is currently asking for a loan for working capital to buy pigs. She travels to a lot of distributors to get a good pig and satisfy her customers’ demand. Her wish is that her son completes his education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: William Xavier

texts.es: William Xavier M. tiene la edad de 31 años. Es un hombre casado y tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general. Inicio hace mas de 3 años, el logro adquirir   la experiencia necesaria para obtener clientes, anteriormente laboraba como cobrador, pero debido a ciertos problemas que enfrento tuvo que renunciar y dedicarse a ofrecer ciertos productos y como no tenía el suficiente capital y un amigo le ayudo para que comprara más productos, y así fue como logra seguir con este negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de calzado, pantalones, faldas, camisas, cremas y colonias. Su deseo es  ampliar su negocio para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
William Xavier M. is 31. He is a married man who is raising two children. He sells general merchandise. He started over three years ago. He gained the necessary experience to get customers. He previously worked as a collector, but due to certain problems he encountered, he had to resign. He started selling certain products. He did not have enough money, and a friend helped him so that he could buy more products. That is how he was able to continue with this business. The loan he is asking for is for working capital to buy footwear, pants, skirts, shirts, creams, and colognes. His wish is to expand his business in order to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Ce monsieur a appris le métier de menuiserie ; mais il n’a pas pu trouver les moyens pour ouvrir son atelier de menuiserie. Pour cette raison, il a pris la décision en 2007 de se lancer dans la vente de produits d’alimentation générale. Il est marié et est père de 03 enfants. Cette activité lui réussit bien dans son quartier d’Awatamé à Lomé. Beaucoup de gens sont contents de venir acheter chez lui à cause du bon accueil qu’il leur réserve souvent. Il a besoin de renouveler son stock ; pour cela, il sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 10 plateaux d’œufs, 10 boîtes de Spaghetti, 01 sac de farine, des biscuits et des bonbons.
texts.en:
This gentleman learned the trade of carpentry but he was not able to open his own workshop. For this reason, he made the decision in 2007 to begin selling groceries. He is married and the father of 3 children.

This business is going well in his neighborhood of Awatamé in Lomé. Many people are happy to do their shopping with him because he reserves a hearty welcome. He needs to replenish his stock, and for that reason he is asking WAGES for a loan to buy 10 trays of eggs, 10 boxes of spaghetti, 1 sack of flour, some cookies and some candy.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of groceries

loans.name: Flores De Chacaltaya Group

texts.es:
En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer, “Alto Lima”, se encuentra la Asociación Comunal “Flores de Chacaltaya”, ellas están juntas hace aproximadamente 10 años. Actualmente están solicitando un nuevo préstamo para seguir mejorando sus negocios ya que todas tienen diferentes negocios como el tejido de chompas, venta de papa, atención de llamadas, venta de fruta, aceite, lubricantes y comida. 

Elsa Q. de 31 años y Paola C. de 22 años, ambas integrantes del grupo, tejen chompas  y necesitan el préstamo para comprar lana al  por mayor y seguir operando.

Nolverta M. de 65 años, vende papa y chuño (papa deshidratada),  en la zona Alto Lima y necesita el préstamo para comprar mercadería.

Lucia C. de 38 años vente lubricantes  en la zona de Alto Lima, ella tiene un puesto fijo donde atiende todos los días, también necesita del préstamo  para comprar mercadería.
texts.en:
In one of the central focal points in Pro Woman, Alto Lima ("Tall Lime"), is the Community Association "Chacaltaya Flowers," and these women have been together for about 10 years. Currently they are requesting a new loan to continue to improve their business now that all of the women have different responsibilities such as weaving sweaters, selling potatoes, phone reception, and selling fruit, lubricants and food. Elsa Q., 31 years old, and Paola C., 22 years old, both part of the group, knit sweaters and need the loan in order to buy wool wholesale and continue operating. Nolverta M., 55 years old, sells fresh and dehydrated potatoes in the Alto Lima zone and needs the loan in order to buy goods. Lucia C., 38 years old, sells lubricants in the Alto Lima zone; she has a permanent stand where she works every day. She also needs the loan in order to be able to buy commodities.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of raw materials and commodities

loans.name: Semilla Group

texts.es:
Olga H. de 26 años vende calzados en la feria 16 de Julio hace 3 años, Nilda C. de 30 años vende vajillas en la misma feria, ambas son integrantes del grupo “Semilla” que a su vez pertenecen al Centro Focal “Allo Lima”,  y necesitan del préstamo para comprar mercadería y ofrecer productos variados a sus clientes. Las demás integrantes del grupo también tienen sus propios negocios como al venta de ropa, elaboración de pan, atención de salón de peinados, taller de chapista y necesitan del préstamo para comprar mercadería (chompas, faldas, deportivos)  o comprar algún activo fijo.
A la cabeza de su presidenta se reúnen para elaborar su reglamento interno.

loans.use: COMPRA DE MERCADERIA Y ACTIVO FIJO

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La señora Elsa Mendoza está muy agradecida por su ayuda en el anterior crédito que le servio para mejora su negocio de venta de tamales.
Nueva vente está solicitando su cooperación para un préstamo el cual tiene el proyecto de comprar mas vehículos para vender en diferentes partes de la ciudad y así su negocio tendrá más ingresos ya generara empleo para tres personas más.
Doña Elsa es soltera, vive de las ventas que tiene su negocio con el cual quiere superarse y ayudar a otras personas.
texts.en:
Elsa Mendoza is very grateful for the help from the previous loan to improve her tamale selling business. She is asking for your cooperation again for a loan. She will buy more vehicles in order to sell in different parts of the city. That way her business will have more income, and it will generate employment for three more people. Else is single. She lives from the sales from her business. She wants to succeed and help other people.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the business

loans.name: Rachel

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier de Gblinkomé à Lomé. Elle est spécialisée dans la vente des plats et sceaux en plastique. Elle se rend le plus souvent au Ghana et en Côte d’Ivoire pour s’approvisionner. Elle vend sa marchandise aux grossistes et aux détaillants qui le revendent après. Ce commerce lui permet d’apporter son aide financière à son mari pour subvenir aux besoins de leurs 03 enfants. Elle voudrait avoir un crédit de WAGES pour commander 55 plats en plastiques, 15 petits sceaux en plastique, 18 paniers en plastiques et 50 grosses marmites en plastiques également.
texts.en:
This lady lives in the Gblinkomé district in Lomé. She is specialized in selling plastic buckets and dishes. Usually she goes to Ghana and to Cote d’Ivoire to stock up. She sells her merchandise to wholesale merchants and to retailers who later sell it. This business enables her to bring financial help to her husband to provide for their three children. She would like to obtain a WAGES loan to order 55 plastic plates, 15 small plastic buckets, 18 plastic baskets, and also 50 big plastic vessels with covers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plastic plates and buckts

loans.name: Elizabeth Nilda

texts.es: La señora Elizabeth vive en la zona Escobar Uria junto a sus dos hijos. Ella es viuda, y D. esta forma lleva adelante a su familia como padre y madre D. igual manera. La actividad D. Elizabeth es la venta D. periódicos, ella tiene un puesto D. venta en la San Antonio Alto. Muy temprano en la mañana sale D. su casa a la comprar los periódicos, luego se dirige a su puesto donD. se queda hasta medio día o hasta que termine D. vender los periódicos (aunque algunas veces en que no hay mucha venta, existe la posibilidad D. devolver los que sobraron). Por las tardes ella atienD. un bazar - librería, que también esta en la zona D. San Antonio Alto, pero usualmente es su hija mayor quien colabora con atender esta última actividad. Elizabeth es una persona muy responsable con su familia y dedica su trabajo.
texts.en:
Elizabeth lives in the Escobar Uria region with her two children. She is a widow. She acts as both father and mother to get her family ahead. Elizabeth sells newspapers. She has a sales stall in San Antonio Alto. She leaves her house very early in the morning to buy the newspapers. She then goes to her stall where she stays until midday or until she sells all of the papers (although sometimes, when there are not many sales, the possibility exists to return the left over papers). In the afternoons she works in a bookstore bazaar, which is also in the San Antonio Alto region. However, her eldest daughter usually works with her in the bookstore. Elizabeth is a very responsible person with her family, and she is devoted to her work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy newspapers

loans.name: Doélé Emeline

texts.fr: Emeline a appris le métier de coiffure ; elle a débuté ce métier depuis 2005 dans le quartier d’Avédji à Lomé. Cette activité lui permet d’apporter son aide financière à son mari pour l’éducation scolaire de leurs 02 enfants. Son atelier est très visité de beaucoup de clientes pour leurs différents soins. Grâce à son expérience, elle satisfait à la demande de toute sa clientèle. Cette dame sollicite à présent un crédit de WAGES pour acheter des produits de beauté pour les soins de cheveux, des mèches de différentes gammes et des déodorants de toutes sortes. Elle a besoin de ce prêt car son stock est presque épuisé.
texts.en:
Emeline learned the trade of hairdressing; she started in 2005 in the Avédji district in Lomé. This business enables her to bring financial help to her husband for educating their two children. Her salon is patronized by many customers with different concerns. Thanks to her experience, she’s satisfying the demands of all her customers. This lady is presently requesting a WAGES loan to buy beauty products for hair care, some hair extensions in various ranges, and all sorts of deodorants. She needs this loan because her inventory is almost exhausted.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair extensions and beauty products

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Pacheco Velasquez Group

texts.es: Luz Marina P. y Blanca Estela R. ambas conforman el es Grupo Solidario P. Velásquez. Ambas tienen diferentes actividades económicas. Luz Marina se dedica a la venta y elaboración de tortillas. En cambio Blanca se dedica a la venta de frijoles hace mas de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio inicio con esfuerzos propios, ya que tenía que ayudar a sus 4 hijos para proporcionarle la oportunidad de estudio. A pesar de ser personas muy humildes y que siempre les ha gustado el trabajo duro y proporcionarles a sus familias las condiciones necesarias. El financiamiento que solicitan es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima para cada uno de sus productos.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Achat des articles de quincaillerie

loans.name: Nathaly Luz

texts.es: LA SEÑORA NATHALY TIENE LA ACTIVIDAD DE UNA TIENDA DE BARRIO, ELLA ESTA SEPARADA DE SU ESPOSO, POR LO TANTO, DEBE MANTENER SOLA A SU HIJO DE 3 AÑOS DE EDAD. VIVE JUNTO CON SUS PADRES EN CASA FAMILIAR. PARA TENER ALGUN INGRESO ECONOMICO ABRIO UNA PEQUEÑA TIENDA DE COMESTIBLES Y OTROS PRODUCTOS; EL CREDITO REQUIERE PARA SURTIR EL NEGOCIO.
texts.en:
Sra. Nathaly operates a store in her neighborhood. She is separated from her husband, so she is the only one supporting her 3 year old son. She lives at home with her parents. In order to generate income, she opened a small store where she sells food and other products. She is requesting a loan in order to stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Yawa Kafui

texts.fr: Cette dame est mariée et mère d’un enfant. En 2007, elle s’est lancée dans la vente des produits de quincaillerie. Ce commerce lui rapporte beaucoup, car elle est très sollicitée par les peintres et les menuiseries lors de la construction des grands immeubles ces temps-ci. Elle reçoit ses commandes du Ghana où elle s’approvisionne souvent. Pour renouveler son stock, elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 20 contre-plaqués, 15 petites boîtes de colles, 10 grandes boîtes de peintures blanches, 10 grandes boîtes de peintures bleues, 10 grandes boîtes de peintures jaunes ; le reste du prêt servira à couvrir ses frais de transport vers le Ghana.
texts.en:
This is a lady who is married and the mother of one child. In 2007, she started selling hardware products. This business brings in a lot because she is in high demand by painters and carpenters, most recently for the construction of large buildings. She receives order from Ghana, where she often stocks up. To renew her stock, she’s requesting a WAGES loan to buy 20 sheets of plywood, 15 small cans of glue, 10 large cans of white paint, 10 large cans of blue paint, and 10 large cans of yellow paint. The rest of the loan will be used to cover the costs of transport to Ghana.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hardware goods

loans.name: Miriam Liliana

texts.es:
Miriam tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera, y vive junto a su abuelita y a su hija de 11 años de edad en la ciudad de Reque, ubicada a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace dos años se dedica a la venta directa de productos de belleza; todas las tardes visita a sus clientes, tanto de Reque como de Chiclayo, les ofrece sus productos y los asesora en la elección de los mismos, durante todo este tiempo su negocio ha ido creciendo y ahora le dedica todo el tiempo que tiene disponible.

Su actividad es la única que sostiene a su familia por lo que día a día trata de dar todo de sí para conseguir clientes nuevos, ella desea comprar más productos para así captar más clientes por lo que se encuentra solicitando a nuestra Institución un crédito de 500 nuevos soles, los que le ayudarán a lograr sus objetivos.

Su mas grande anhelo es poder brindarle a su hija una educación de calidad y también darle a su abuelita una mejor calidad de vida.

Miriam es muy conocida entre sus vecinos los que la quieren y estiman mucho debido a su buen carácter y disponibilidad en los momentos en que la necesitan.
texts.en:
Miriam, 34, is a single mother. She lives with her grandmother and her 11 year old daughter. They live in the city of Reque, which is located 15 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She has been selling beauty products for two years. Every afternoon she visits her customers in the city of Reque as well as the city of Chiclayo. She offers her products and advises on their selections. During all of this time, her business has been growing. Now, she spends all of her available time on the business. Her activity is the only one that supports her family. Therefore, day to day, she tries to give all of herself to attaining new customers. She wishes to buy more products in order to gain more customers. That is why she is asking the Institution for a loan for 500 PEN. That will help he achieve her objectives. Her greatest wish is to be able to provide her daughter with a quality education and to give her grandmother a better quality of life. Miriam is very well known among her neighbors. They care about her and hold her in high esteem because of her good character and her availability in the times they need her.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beauty products to sell

loans.name: Christian

texts.es: El Sr. Christian D.  cuenta con una movilidad la cual trabaja como radio taxista con que mantiene a su familia que vive en la ciudad de El Alto en la casa de sus suegros, es el unico ingreso que tiene la familia ya que la esposa es ama  de casa no trabaja.  la movilidad obtuvo con un prestamo bancario el cual termina de cancelar el mes de Septiembre,   durante todo el tiempo que a trabajado junto a la institucion siempre a demostrado ser una persona trabajadora y con ganas de superacion.  El prestamo lo invertira en la construccion de un garage en su casa ya que tiene que guardar la movilidad en otro lugar y el saldo para la compra de llantas.
texts.en:
Christian D. has a vehicle, which he uses to work as a taxi driver to support his family. He lives in the city of El Alto in his in-laws house. His income is the only one the family has because his wife is a house wife and does not work. He got his vehicle with a bank loan, which he will finish paying off in September. During the entire time that he has worked with the institution, he has always shown himself to be a hard worker with the desire to succeed. He will use the loan to build a garage on his house because he has to keep the vehicle in another place. He will use the rest to buy tires.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Open a garage at his house and repair his vehicle

loans.name: Lorena De Los Angeles

texts.es: Lorena de los Ángeles A. Z. tiene 44 años de edad. Hace más de 6 años que la Señora Lorena tiene el negocio de venta de refrescos. Pero es importante resaltar que es una actividad que nació con el objetivo de apoyar en los gastos de la familia.
