Este negocio surge por la falta de empleo, pero en la actualidad Lorena laborar como docente de un colegio de su barrio. En el tiempo libre de sus estudiantes ofrece sus deliciosos refrescos. Por lo que sus alumnos disfrutan de los refrescos y Lorena adquiere mucho más fama con sus refrescos. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de azúcar, frutas naturales, bolsas plásticas entre otras cosas. Su deseo es mantener su negocio y lograr tener más recurso para invertir.
texts.en:
Lorena de los Ángeles A. Z. is 44 years old. For more than six years she has had a business selling drinks, but it is important to stress that it was an activity born with the goal of helping pay household costs. The business arose out of unemployment, but currently Lorena works as a teacher at a school in her neighborhood. In the students' free time, she offers them her delicious drinks. Due to the fact that her students enjoy the drinks Lorena has become much more famous for them. The financing is for working capital to buy sugar, natural fruit, and plastic bags among other things. Her goal is to maintain her business and and achieve having more resources to invest.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Amistad Group

texts.es: Vender de ropa y golosinas, tejer prendas a mano (macramé), costura de prendas, conducir taxi y vender comida, son los negocios que atienden las integrantes del grupo “Amistad” que se agruparon recientemente para acceder al préstamo, tal es el caso de Julia C. de 55 años, casada y vende ropa en la feria “16 de Julio” y necesita el préstamo  para adquirir ropa al por mayor, otro ejemplo es Dayonnethe A. con 21 años vende salchipapas en la ciudad de El Alto, zona de Rio Seco, específicamente en el mercado “Carmen”, ella vende por la noche ya que es cuando tiene mayor demanda y requiere del préstamo para comprar papa al por mayor.
texts.en:
The sale of clothing and candies, hand-sewing clothing (macrame), sewing, taxi driving, and food sales are the businesses that the members of the Amistad, or Friendship, group operate. The group recently formed to enter into this loan. Fifty-five year old Julia C., married, sells clothing at the 16th of July market and needs the loan to purchase clothing wholesale. Another example is Dayonnethe A., 21 years old, who sells potatoes with sausage in the city of El Alto, in the Rio Seco area, specifically in the market "Carmen". She sells at night because that is the time of highest demand and she needs the loan to purchase potatoes wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise and supplies

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
Juliana tiene 30 años de edad, es soltera, y vive junto a su madre y sus hermanos en el distrito pesquero de San José, ubicado a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Hace 10 años se dedica al arte del bordado artesanal, desde entonces se ha valido de esta actividad para ganarse la vida y solventar sus propios gastos; ella trabaja en base a pedidos, sus clientes le brindan todo el material necesario (hijos y telas) para que les borde manteles, cortinas y servilletas.

Ella desea expandir su negocio haciendo más bordados, los cuales pueda vender en diversas ferias de exposición artesanal, así como distribuirlos en las principales tiendas turísticas de la región; por este motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a nuestra Institución un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más hilos y telas para empezar a trabajar de manera independiente y con recursos propios.

Su mas grande anhelo es hacerse conocida en la región y que su trabajo tenga la difusión que se merece.

Goza de muy buenas referencias personales ya que sus clientes y vecinos la consideran una chica muy responsable y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Juliana is 30 years old and single. She lives with her mother and brothers in the fishing district of San Jose, located about 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For 10 years, she has been involved in the art of hand embroidery. Ever since, she has made use of this business to earn a living and pay her own expenses. She works based on orders. Her customers offer her all the necessary material (thread and fabric) so the she embroiders blankets, curtains and napkins for them.

She wants to expand her business by making more embroidery which she can sell in various artisans markets, as well as distributing them in the main tourist shops of the region. For this reason she finds herself applying, for the first time, for a loan of 500 new soles from our institution. She plans to invest in the purchase of more thread and fabric in order to begin working in an independent fashion and with her own resources.

Her greatest yearning is to become known in the region and that her work will have the distribution it merits. She enjoys very good references since her customers and neighbors consider her a responsible and hard working young woman.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of thread and fabric for the making and sale of embroidery

loans.name: Marlon Antonio

texts.es: Marlon Antonio Chavarría Gómez tiene 40 años. Su actividad económica es la una pulpería. La ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda, es un hombre muy trabajador y disfruta mucho conversar con sus vecinos, además con la ayuda de su esposa y sus 3 hijos, que asisten a un colegio público ya que ambos no cuentan con los recursos suficientes. Sin embargo son personas muy humildes y les gusta trabajar. El crédito se va invertir en la compra de jabón, detergentes, granos básicos, productos de limpieza entre otras cosas. Su deseo es llegar a poseer una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Marlon Antonio Chavarría Gómez is 40 years old. He runs a general store, which is located in his residence. He is a very hard-working man and really enjoys conversing with his neighbors. His wife helps him run the store as do their 3 children, who attend the public school. They lack sufficient resources; nevertheless, they are very humble people who like to work. The loan will be invested in the purchase of soap, detergent, basic grains, and cleaning products, among other things. His dream is to own a distribution company.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: business capital

loans.name: Iris Lourdes

texts.es: Iris Lourdes P. Cliente nueva en nuestra institución  dedicada a la elaboración de tejidos como ser. chambritas (ropa de Bebe), mantillas, etc el mismo que esta ubicado  en la zona de irpavi. Ella ya es una persona mayor, ya no tiene dependientes directos, sus hijos ya formaron sus propios hogares; vive solamente con su esposo, el cual es rentista. El Credito Solicitado lo invertira en la compra de materiales.
texts.en:
Iris Lourdes P., a new customer in our institution, weaves clothing such as chambritas (baby clothing), mantillas, etc. Her business is located in the Irpavi zone. She is already a mature person and does not have direct dependents; her children have already formed their own households. She lives alone with her husband, who is an investor. The requested loan will be invested in the purchase of materials.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials

loans.name: Aura Elena

texts.es: Aura Elena R. tiene 50 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos y trabajan de manera independiente. La actividad económica a la que se dedicada es a la venta de mercadería en general. Ella  inicia en este rubro siendo una madre abandonada pero que con mucho valor decidió enfrentar su situación e invirtió unos ahorros que tenía. De esta manera pudo hacer clientela quienes le compraban al contado y al crédito, al principio fue un poco difícil, pues sus niños estaban pequeños y ella no tenia clientes fijos por lo que tenía que caminar largos trechos para conseguirlos. Ella nunca opto por dejar a sus hijos, ya que siempre ha sido una madre muy responsable y cuidadosa, gracias a Dios ella ha podido enfrentar todo lo que ha su vida se ha aproximado. Ella desea un financiamiento para invertir en su capital de trabajo donde el inventario de más urgencia que necesita son: zapatos, cosméticos, pantalones, ropa para niños, perfumes, entre otras.
texts.en:
Aura Elena R. is 50 years old, has 3 children, and works independently. She sells general merchandise. She began in this line of work when she was an abandoned mother, but, with much bravery, she decided to face her situation and invested some savings that she had. In this way, she obtained customers who purchased with cash or credit. At the beginning, it was somewhat difficult because her children were young and she did not have steady customers. She had to walk long distances to win customers. She never chose to leave her children. She has always been a very responsible and caring mother. Thanks to God, she has been able to face everything that has come to her. She wants a loan to invest in her business; her most urgent inventory needs are for shoes, cosmetics, pants, children's clothes, and perfumes, among other things.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: business capital

loans.name: Arodi

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Arodi C. le está haciendo falta un cuarto más que es para su hijo ya que la familia está creciendo y necesita más espacio.
Solicita un préstamo para poder comprar el material para la construcción ya que el se encargara de realizar la mejora, en tiempo adicional a su trabajo. 
El es empleado de una compañía de compañía de trasportes en el departamento de empleado general esté es el ingreso que el tiene para su familia y con el cual una parte será destinada para el pago del crédito. El desea que su hijo tengo su propio cuarto y espacio en el casa.
texts.en:
Arodi C.’s house needs one more room for his son. His family is growing and needs more space. He is asking for this loan to be able to buy construction materials. He will take charge of making the improvement with extra time at his work. He is a general employee of a transportation company. This is the income he has for his family. Part of it will be to pay for the loan. He wishes for his son to have his own room and space in the house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room in the back part of the house

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia Q. C. trabaja con nuestra institución hace muchos años ex integrante del grupo solidario san juan, se dedica a la venta de condimentos en diferentes mercados de la ciudad. Vive con su esposo y tres de sus cuatro hijos. El esposo es albañil contratista. El prestamo sera invertido en la compra de mercaderia.
texts.en:
Lidia Q. C. has worked with our institution for many years. She is an ex member of the San Juan supportive group. She sells condiments in different markets in the city. She lives with her husband and three of her four children. Her husband is a building contractor. The loan is to buy merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise, chili, oregano, pepper, etc.

loans.name: Francisco Matilde

texts.es: Francisco Matilde Hernández S. tiene la edad de 37 años. Vive con su compañera de vida y tienen 7 hijos que dependen de él. La actividad económica es la venta de leña. Francisco inicio este negocio por que no tenía un trabajo, y su esposa y su hijo necesitaban el sustento diario, a pesar de lo difícil que es su situación Francisco mantiene la alegría con sus clientes. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio y lo más difícil de su trabajo es que tiene que recorrer muchos kilómetros en busca de sus clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de leña, madera y hacha además proporcionarle ciertas mejoras a su carretón en donde distribuye la leña. Sus deseo es salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Francisco Matilde Hernández S. is 37 years old. He lives with his partner, and they have 7 dependent children. His business is selling firewood. Francisco began this business because he didn't have a job, and his wife and son were needing daily sustenance. In spite of how difficult his situation is, Francisco stays cheerful with his customers. He has made his living with this business for more than 6 years, and the most difficult part of his work is that he has to travel many kilometers to reach his customers. The financing he is requesting is intended for business capital in order to purchase firewood, lumber and an ax. In addition, it would provide for certain improvements for his cart that he uses to distribute the firewood. His wish is to improve his family's situation.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase firewood, lumber and an ax as well as make improvements on his cart.

loans.name: Assétou

texts.fr:
Assétou Koné a 46 ans, mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle vit avec son époux et leurs enfants à Sanoubougou II, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Assétou Koné  après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, s’est initiée à cette activité de stockage et  de commercialisation des  céréales (maïs, mil, sorgho) depuis maintenant plus de trois ans. Elle dispose d’un magasin au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a plus de quatre année. Après 6 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier (Association Benkadi de Sanoubougou II), elle est actuellement à son deuxième prêt individuel. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce nouveau prêt, 6 sacs de riz, 8 sacs de maïs, 5 sacs de sorgho, 2 sacs d’arachide  et 4 sacs de mil. Elle achète le riz à Niono (région de Ségou) et les autres céréales dans les localités environnantes de la ville de Sikasso avant de les revendre au comptant et en détail à une clientèle composée généralement de chefs de famille.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt, un bénéfice mensuel de 250 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour  contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Assétou Koné, age 46, is married and a mother of three. She lives with her husband and their children in Sanoubougou II, a working-class neighborhood in the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republique of Mali.) Three years ago, after having tried a number of activities without success, Assétou Koné began to stock and sell grains (such as corn, millet and sorghum.) She has a store in Sikasso's grand market. In order to satisfy the demands of her growing clientele, she joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso four years ago. After 6 group loans with a women's association from her neighborhood (Association Benkadi de Sanoubougou II,) she is now on her second individual loan. Her previous loans were all repaid according to the terms. With this new loan, she plans to purchase 6 bags of rice, 8 bags of corn, 5 bags of sorghum, 2 bags of peanuts and 4 sacks of millet. She buys the rice in Niono (in the Ségou region) and the other grains from the area surrounding Sikasso. She retails the grain for cash. Her clients are mostly heads of households. She expects to realize a monthly benefit of 250 000 FCFA from this loan, which she will use to support the family's expenses, make loan payments, and invest in her business.

Translated from French by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bulk grains.

loans.name: Sembradoras Group

texts.es:
Venta de haba, CDs, productos plásticos, ropa y tejido de mantas, son algunos de los negocios de las integrantes del grupo “Sembradoras” que  a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal “German Busch”. 
Se agruparon hace aproximadamente tres años por la necesidad de contar un capital que les permita mejorar sus negocios. Un ejemplo claro es lo que hace  Primitiva T. de 48 años que sola mantiene a sus tres hijos ya que enviudó hace  dos años, ella vende ropa como poleras, shorth y los lleva a los Yungas ( lugar cálido) y requiere incrementar mercadería por lo que solicitó el préstamo.
texts.en:
Selling beans, CDs, plastics, clothing and woven blankets are some of the businesses of members of the "Sembradoras" group, which is, in turn, a part of the Regional Office “German Busch”.

They came together as a group approximately 3 years ago because of a need for capital that would allow them to improve their businesses. A clear example is the business of Primitiva T., who is 48 years old and supports her three children by herself, since she was widowed two years ago. She sells clothing, such as t-shirts and shorts, which she brings to los Yungas (a warm climate). She needs to increase her inventory, for which she requested the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise and primary materials

loans.name: Karim

texts.fr:
Monsieur Karim S. est un célibataire sans enfant de 24 ans qui vit à Hamdallaye, un des quartiers populaires de ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur S. après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès, s’est initié au  commerce d’articles divers et  dispose aujourd’hui  d’une boutique devant sa maison d’habitation où il mène cette activité d’achat et vente des articles divers tels les cigarettes, bonbons, allumettes, chewing-gum,  laits en poudre, thés, mayonnaises, sucre, savons etc. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre il y a environ une année, l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui, il est à son deuxième prêt individuel  après une anticipation du précédent.
Monsieur S. vend ses marchandises en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de jeunes et de voisins.
Avec ce deuxième  prêt, il compte acheter,  5 cartouches de cigarettes différentes, 7 cartons de thés, 5 cartons de mayonnaise CALVE, 10 sacs du sucre, 3 cartons de savon,  5 paquets de bonbon, 10 paquets de chewing gum, 20 paquets d’allumette et 10 sacs de riz. 
Il s’approvisionne auprès de commerçants grossistes de la place avant de les revendre.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 125 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Monsieur Karim S. is a 24 year old bachelor who lives in Hamdallaye, a working-class neighborhood in the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the République of Mali). After trying other enterprises,Monsieur S. opened a shop in front of his house where he sells miscellaneous merchandise, ranging from cigarettes, candy, matches and chewing-gum to powdered milk, tea, mayonnaise, sugar and soap, etc. His shop is very popular because of the quality of his merchandise. Monsieur S. sells to both cash and credit clients, most of whom are youth and neighbors. To satisfy increased demand, a year ago he joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This will be his second loan. With the proceeds, he plans to buy 5 cases of different cigarettes, 7 cases of tea, 5 cases of CALVE mayonnaise, 10 bags of sugar, 3 cases of soap, 5 boxes of candies, 10 cases of chewing gum, 20 packages of matches, and 10 bags of rice. He purchases his merchandise from wholesalers. He expects to realize a monthly benefit of 125 000 FCFA which he will use to build his inventory, contribute to his family's expenses, and repay his loan.

Translated from French by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: Amy B. est une femme de 59 ans, elle est mariée et a la charge de 9 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Lyndiane-2-pont depuis 8 ans. C'est un membre très dynamique dans les activités de son groupe. Elle développe une activité de vente de produits halieutiques. Elle soutien son mari dans la prise en charge familiale. Elle rembourse son prêt globalement en une seule échéance en fin de cycle
texts.en:
Amy B. is a 59-year-old woman. She is married and has nine children to support. She has been a member of Banc Villageois de Lyndiane-2-pont for eight years and is a very energetic member in her group’s activities. She’s developing a business selling seafood products. She supports her husband in meeting family expenses. She’s repaying her loan over-all in a single payment at the end of the cycle.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her work in commerce

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 59 años de edad, es viuda, y vive con dos de sus diez hijos en el Pueblo Joven Santa Rosa, en los alrededores de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Lleva 33 años vendiendo carne de pollo en el Mercado Modelo de la ciudad de Chiclayo, el mercado principal de la ciudad, por las mañanas y por la tardes vende anticuchos de carne (meat kabob) en la ciudad de Lambayeque, estos negocios ha sustentado a su familia durante todo este tiempo y sigue dando lo mejor de sí para seguir adelante.

Ella compra la carne, tanto de pollo como de vaca, a diversos distribuidores, los que la abastecen periodicamente, ofrece sus productos a sus clientes a un precio razonable, razón por la que ha sabido mantener una fiel clientela.

Su más grande anhelo es poder dedicarse a la distribución de carne de pollo al por mayor, y así asegurarle a su familia el progreso y la calidad de vida que se merecen, en su afán por seguir esta meta ella está solicitando a nuestra Institución un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la ampliación de su negocio con la compra de más carne de pollo para vender.

Carmen es una persona muy querida y estimada por sus compañeros de trabajo, ellos la consideran una mujer responsable y trabajadora y la admiran mucho por que ha sabido sacar a su familia adelante a pesar de las adversidades.
texts.en:
Carmen is a 59 year old widow. She lives with two of her ten children in Pueblo Joven Santa Rosa in the area around the city of Chiclayo. She has been selling chicken in the Mercado Modelo, the main market, in the city of Chiclayo for 33 years. In the mornings and the afternoons she sells meat kabobs in the city of Lambayeque. These businesses have supported her family during all of this time. She continues to give the best of herself in order to get ahead. She buys the meat, chicken and beef, from different distributors who periodically supply her. She offers her products to her customers at a reasonable price, which is why she has known how to keep loyal customers. Her biggest wish is to be able to devote herself to distributing chicken wholesale. This way she will assure her family of the progress and quality of life they deserve. In her effort to complete this wish, she is asking our institution for a loan for 1,000 PEN. She will use it to expand her business by purchasing more chicken to sell. Carmen is well liked and held in high esteem by her work colleagues. They consider her to be a responsible and determined woman. They greatly admire her because she has known how to get her family ahead in spite of adversities.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chicken to sell

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es:
"La Sra. Herminia Q. A., tiene como actividad  la venta de colchones de lana y polar, las cuales comercializa en su tienda ubicada en la populosa zona Eloy Salmon; esa actividad la realiza junto a su esposo, tienen tres hijos en edad escolar.
La cliente tiene antigüedad de dos años trabajando con nuestra institución, comenzó trabajando en banca de emprendimiento y en la actualidad lleva su segunda secuencia de forma individual."
texts.en:
Mrs. Herminia Q. A. sells mattresses made of wool and polar fleece which she makes in her store located in the popular Eloy Salmon district. Her husband works with her and they have three school-age children. The customer has been working with our institution for the past two years. She began by working in the beginner bank and is currently carrying her second individual loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to augment operational capital for mattress production

loans.name: Julissa Marciel

texts.es: Julissa Marciel M. F. tiene 26 años de edad, tiene 1 hijo a su cargo, su actividad es una pulpería. Inicio este negocio hace 7 años aproximadamente. Desde entonces este ha sido su negocio fuente de ingresos, de esta manera Julissa ha logrado salir adelante, con su esposo y su familia ya que han pasado situaciones muy difíciles como lo es su mayor preocupación enfermarse gravemente alega que prefiere morir luchando que jamás haberlo intentado. Esta vez Julissa ha acudido a Fundación León 2000 para que se le otorgue un financiamiento el cual le servirá en la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, detergentes y aceite.
texts.en:
Julissa Marciel M. F. is 26 years-old and has one child. She works at a small grocery store, a business she began approximately seven years ago. Since then her business has been a source of income that has allowed her to pull through with her husband and family, who have already survived many very difficult situations. Her major worry is getting severely ill. She says she prefers to die fighting than to not even have tried. This time Julissa has gone to Fundación León 2000 so that they grant her financing which will allow her to buy basic grains, sweets, detergents and oil.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ericka Liseth

texts.es:
Ericka tiene 26 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos de 8 y 2 años de edad y vive junto a su esposo y sus padres en el Centro Poblado Menor Larán, en el distrito de Monsefú, ubicado a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 10 años tiene un pequeño restaurante que atiende junto a su madre, este establecimiento está ubicado en la carretera Panamericana (la principal vía terrestre del país), lo que le permite atender a todo tipo de turistas y transportistas que pasan por el lugar, este negocio constituye la principal fuente de ingreso económico de la familia por lo que madre e hija se levantan todos los días muy temprano para iniciar las ventas y atender a sus clientes habituales.

Su restaurante sufrió un robo el pasado mes de Enero y desde entonces ha luchado por seguir manteniéndolo a pesar de contar con pocos productos que ofrecer, por lo que desea invertir en la compra de más bebidas e instalarle un circuito de luz eléctrica  y poder atender durante la noche, por este motivo se encuentra solicitando a nuestra Institución un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr sus objetivos.

Debido a que su padre ya es de edad avanzada y no puede trabajar ella desea brindarle una mejor calidad de vida, por otro lado desea asegurarle a sus hijos un futuro mejor por lo que piensa ofrecerles una educación de calidad. 

Ella trabajó con nosotros anteriormente y ha demostrado tener la responsabilidad y la capacidad suficiente para relanzar su negocio y a la vez cumplir con nuestra Institución, su puntualidad le ha permitido ser considerada como una cliente excelente.
texts.en:
Ericka is a 26-year-old married mother with two children, ages 8 and 2. She lives with her husband and parents in the Menor Larán community of the Monsefú district, located 15 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

For 10 years, she has owned a small restaurant that she and her mother run. The restaurant is located near the Panamericana highway—the country’s main road—which allows her to attend to many tourists and drivers who pass through. This business is the family’s main source of income, which is why mother and daughter get up very early every day to start serving their usual customers.

They were robbed this past January, and ever since then, they have struggled to maintain the business with what few products they offer. For this reason, she would like to invest in purchasing more beverages and installing electricity so that they can open at night. She is requesting 2,000.00 PEN from our institute in order to achieve her goals.

Because her father is elderly and can no longer work, she wishes to give him a better quality of life. Furthermore, she hopes to secure a better future for her children by providing them with a quality education.

She has previously worked with us and has demonstrated enough responsibility and aptitude to re-launch her business while fulfilling her obligations with our institute. Her punctuality qualifies her as an excellent client.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beverages

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es: Cesar Augusto Juárez P. tiene 29 años, es un hombre soltero. La actividad económica es brindar el servicio de taxi. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Inicio este negocio  como conductor de un amigo Cesar conducía el vehículo, pero al no ganar los suficiente para sufragar los gastos suficientes decide pediré ayuda a un hermano, que le ayudo a conseguir el dinero suficiente para trabajar como taxista. Todos los financiamientos que ha solicitado son destinados para capital para brindarle mantenimiento a su carro y comprar ciertos repuestos. Su deseo es mejorar los ingresos para brindar lo necesario a su familia.
texts.en:
Cesar Augusto Juárez P. is a 29-year-old single man. He provides taxi services for a living. He started this business 5 years ago as a driver for a friend, but since he did not make enough money to cover his expenses, he decided to work as a taxi cab driver. All of the loans that he has requested will be used as working capital to give his cab maintenance and purchase spare parts. His wish is to improve his earnings so that he can provide his family with whatever they need.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: LA SEÑORA TIENE A SU CARGO LA MANUTENCION D. SU HOGAR QUIEN APORTA ECONOMICAMENTE Y CON MUCHO ESFUERZO SUTENTA A SU FAMILIA COMO JEFE DEL D. SU HOGAR, EL ESPOSO EN ESTE MOMENTO SE ENCUENTRA SIN TRABAJO. LA ACTIVIDAD D. LA SRA. GLADYS ES EL D. LA REPOSTERIA (ELABORACION D. TODO TIPO D. PASTELES), ESTA ACTIVIDAD LA REALIZA EN SU DOMICILIO, PARA LUEGO VENDERLA EL LOS DIFERENTES COLEGIOS D. SU ZONA, SIEMPRE CON LA COLABORACION D. SUS ESPOSO.
texts.en:
Ms. Q. is in charge of supporting her family as the head of the household after much hard work because her husband is currently unemployed. Ms. Q. runs a confectionery business in which she makes all kinds of cakes. She makes these cakes at home, then sells them at the different schools throughout her community. Her husband always collaborates with the business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home expansion and refurbishment, and purchase ingredients to make cake

loans.name: Teodocia

texts.es:
Teodocia tiene 44 años D. edad es casada y vive junto a su esposo en el sector San Antonio, distrito D. Pomalca, ubicado a 10 minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

DesD. hace tres años es propietaria D. un pequeño puesto en el mercado D. Pomalca, donD. venD. comida a las personas que frecuentan el lugar y a algunos pensionistas (clientes que acuden a ella todos los dias), ella se dedica a trabajar desD. muy temprano en la mañana hasta la tarD., con parte D. las ventas del día compra los ingredientes D. los platos que preparará al día siguiente.

Su esposo es jubilado y el dinero que percibe D. su jubilación no es suficiente para mantener su hogar, por este motivo se esfuerza todos los días para sacar adelante su negocio, ella desea ampliarlo con la finalidad D. atender a más comensales y en un futuro próximo ser propietaria D. un pequeño restaurante, por lo que está solicitando por primera vez a nuestra Institución un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles que le permitan comprar mas insumos D. cocina  y preparar la variedad D. platos suficientes para lograr su objetivo.

Ella es muy conocida entre sus compañeros del mercado D. Pomalca y es considerada por ellos como una mujer responsable y trabajadora que todos los dias trata D. salir adelante con su negocio para ayudar  con la economía diaria D. su hogar.
texts.en:
Teodocia is a 44-year-old married woman who lives with her husband in the San Antonio sector of the district of Pomalca, located 10 minutes away from the city of Chilcayo.

For ten years, she has been the owner of a small stand in the market of Pomalca, in which she sells food to the market goers and some lodgers who frequent her stand every day. She starts working very early in the morning until the evening. She uses some of her daily profits to purchase the ingredients she needs to prepare the dishes for the next day.

Her husband is retired, but his retirement pension is insufficient to support the household. For this reason, she has to work hard every day to get ahead with her business. She hopes to expand with the aim of serving more patrons. She is requesting a loan for 1,000.00 PEN from our institute for the very first time, which will allow her to purchase ingredients and prepare a variety of dishes so that she can reach her goal. She is very well-known among her fellow vendors at the Pomalca market, and is considered to be a very responsible and hard-working woman who tries to move her business forward every day so that she can help with the household income.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for food preparation and sales

loans.name: Carlos Xavier

texts.es: El Joven Carlos Xavier Méndez Sánchez tiene 28 años. Viven con su esposa y juntos tienen 1 hijo a su cargo. Carlos se dedica a brindar la reparación y venta de bicicletas. Hace más de 7 años que inicio este negocio, por lo que poco a poco fue comprando ciertas herramientas que son necesarias para reparar las bicicletas de sus clientes. Carlos tiene muchas amistades ya que es por medio de ellas que ha logrado que su negocio aumente. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de llantas, asientos para bicicletas, alambres y repuestos. El sueño de Carlos es brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad  de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Carlos Xavier Méndez Sánchez is a 28-year-old man who lives with his wife. Together they have one son under their care. He started this business 7 years ago, and little by little he bought the tools necessary to repair his customers’ bicycles. Carlos has many friends, and because of this fact, he has managed to expand his business. The loan that he is requesting will be used as working capital to purchase tires, bicycle seats, wire, and spare parts. Carlos dreams of providing his family with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is a 58-year-old married mother of six children. Currently she takes care of just three grandchildren as her own children are independent. Comfort operates a drinking spot where she sells all kinds of drinks such as soft, canned and bottled drinks. She has a wooden kiosk from which she sells the drink. She has been in this business for two years. Comfort is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to sustain her business and provide her grandchildren with good quality education. Without adequate funds Comfort fears it may not be possible to realize her dream.

Comfort is humbly requesting your help to make her dream come true so that she would be better equipped to take care of her family. With her loan, she wants to purchase an increased stock of assorted drinks from the wholesalers to restock her shop.

loans.use: To buy assorted drinks (e.g. Coke, Pepsi) to upgrade her inventory

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is 34 years old, and is married with two school-aged children. She is very hardworking in order to support her husband in providing food and shelter for their household. For the last two years Constance has owned and operated a grocery shop selling items such as sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, skimmed milk powder and biscuits in her neighborhood. It has been her dream to expand her business by adding other foodstuffs to her existing range.

With her loan, Constance wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits, and also expand into foodstuffs such as tomatoes, smoked fish, dried fish, onions, spices, groundnuts etc. to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve her savings to support her husband in taking care of the children's educational needs.

loans.use: To purchase a greater variety of foodstuffs for her grocery store

loans.name: Jessica Maria

texts.es:
Jessica tiene 37 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive junto a sus tres hijos de 11, 9 y 6 años de edad en el Asentamiento Humano Saul Cantoral, en los alrededores de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Hace 15 años empezó a vender comida al paso en los exteriores del Terminal Terrestre de la ciudad de Chiclayo y durante este tiempo se ha apoyado en este negocio para sacar adelante a su familia, su labor empieza desde muy temprano hasta la tarde, luego compra los insumos para preparar los platos del día siguiente; usualmente vende cebiche, papa rellena y tortas de choclo, su carisma y la buena sazón con la que prepara sus platos  le han valido para mantener a su clientela durante todo este tiempo.

Ella es a la vez padre y madre para sus menores hijos quienes estudian en un colegio estatal cercano al lugar en donde viven, su más grande anhelo es poder asegurarles en el futuro algún tipo de educación superior con la cual se puedan ganar la vida, además también desea terminar de construir su casa ya que aún esta hecha de adobe, un material rustico de barro usado para construir viviendas, por lo que se encuentra solicitando por tercera vez a nuestra Institución un crédito de 2500 nuevos soles que le permitan ampliar su negocio y así lograr sus objetivos.

Jessica ya ha trabajado con nosotros anteriormente y ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus cuotas por lo que es considerada como una cliente excelente, los vecinos de su comunidad la consideran una madre luchadora y ejemplar.
texts.en:
Jessica is a 37 year old single mother. She lives with her three children, ages 11, 9, and 6. They live in Asentamiento Humano Saul Cantoral in the outskirts of the city of Chiclayo. Fifteen years ago she started selling food dishes on the outside of the bus depot of the city of Chiclayo. During this time she has been supported in this business in order to get her family ahead. Her work starts very early and goes until the afternoon. Then she buys the supplies to prepare her dishes for the following day. She usually sells “ceviche” (a popular local fish dish), “papa rellena” (stuffed potato), and “tortas de choclo” (a dish made with ground corn). Her charisma and the good seasoning she uses to prepare her dishes have served to maintain her customers during all of this time. She is father and mother at the same time to her minor children. They go to a state school near the place where they live. Her biggest wish is to be able assure them in the future of some type of advanced education, which they can use to earn a living. She also wishes to finish building her house because it is still made of adobe, a material made of mud used to build houses. That is why she is asking the Institution for a loan for the third time. She is asking for 2,500 PEN, which will allow her to expand her business and, therefore, achieve her objectives. Jessica has worked with us previously, and she has demonstrated responsibility and punctuality with her payments. She is, therefore, considered an excellent client. Her neighbors in the community consider her a determined and exemplary mother.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies to prepare and sell food

loans.name: Mario De Jesus

texts.es: El señor Mario de Jesús Pérez T. tiene la edad de 39 años, su estado civil es casado, este señor tiene 3 hijos que todavía estudian. Sus sueños son de mantener activo su negocio y de darle mejoras a su vivienda ya que esta es una de las prioridades que él tiene debido a que sus hijos están creciendo y necesita ofrecerle un espacio que sea propiedad de ellas. Su actividad económica es la carpintería, hace más de 10 años que se dedica a la carpintería. Su negocio inicia porque el mismo con su propio esfuerzo logro aprender este oficio que le ayudaría para su futuro  a prendió en  un taller y el contribuía con este taller, más tarde decide independizarse y formar su propio negocio. Ahora solicita la ayuda de Fundación León 2000 el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita invertir más en su negocio para la compra de materiales. El deseo de Mario es establecer su propia funeraria.
texts.en:
Mr. Mario de Jesús Pérez T. is 39 years old, married with three children who are still in school. He dreams of keeping his business active and of making improvements to his house. This is one of his main priorities since he wants to ensure his children have a house that they own. Mr. P. has been working as a carpenter for over 10 years. He started his business by learning carpentry on his own and then by helping out at a workshop. Later on, he decided to become independent and start his own business. He is now requesting financial assistance from Fundación León 2000 (micro-finance institution). He will invest this loan in working capital to purchase materials for his business. Some day he hopes to open his own funeral home.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate is a 40-year-old married mother of three children, all of whom currently attend the community development school. Kate comes from a very humble family that wants to invest in the children's future by providing them with a good education.

Kate is a petty trader and for the last three years has been selling items such as cooking oil, spices, pepper, onions, cassava, plantain, dried fish, tinned tomatoes, bags of rice etc. She takes delivery of goods from the regional capital of Kumasi. Kate says these kinds of product move very fast and she can easily recover her money to restock. Now she wants to offer other foodstuffs such as maize, eggs and so on, which are frequently demanded by her customers. Kate believes that this is possible with the help of a loan. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs such as maize and eggs

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa is a married mother of four school-aged children. For the past year she has been selling used clothes to support her household. She relies on the income from this business to buy food and pay the utility bills. She is requesting a loan to inject more capital into the business to purchase further bales of used clothes. She takes delivery of stock from Kumasi and mostly sells her goods through hawking. Yaa hopes to make a good income and set aside some savings to support her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es:
María tiene 21 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y su hijo de 5 meses de nacido en el caserío La Zaranda, distrito de Pítipo, ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace año y medio se dedica a la crianza y venta de cuyes de raza criolla (animales domésticos  típicos de ciertos países sudamericanos), ella los alimenta con corteza de plátano y con chala (una variedad de sembrío de maíz utilizado como forraje para animales), su esposo trabaja eventualmente como peón agrícola y entre ambos tratan de sacar adelante su hogar.

Su negocio ha ido creciendo y ahora tienen mas de un centenar de cuyes, pero lo que percibe por la venta no le alcanza para alimentarlos, por lo que está solicitando por tercera vez a nuestra Institución un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le permita invertir en la alimentación y sanidad de sus animales, por otro lado el creciente número de ejemplares amerita el mantenimiento de las javas en las que viven.

Su más grande anhelo es llegar a tener a largo plazo una granja de cuyes y también poder construir una casa propia.

Ella ya ha trabajado con nosotros anteriormente y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos, por lo que es considerada como una cliente excelente.
texts.en:
María is 21 years old, married, and has a 5 month old child. She and her family live in the village of La Zaranda in the district of Pitipo, which is located 45 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

For a year and a half, she has been breeding and selling native guinea pigs (traditional domesticated animals in certain South American countries). She feeds them banana tree bark and corn husks (from a variety of corn commonly used for animal fodder). Her husband works as a farmhand. They both try to succeed in their home life.

Her business has grown and now she has more than 100 guinea pigs. However, her revenue is not enough to continue feeding them. She is requesting her third loan from our Institution in the amount of 1500 soles so that she can invest in the nutrition and health of her animals. Since the number of animals continues to increase, María has paid more attention to maintaining the cages in which they live.

Her greatest dream is to continue her guinea pig farm for the long term and build her own house. María has worked with us previously and demonstrated her punctuality and responsibility with her payments. She is considered to be an excellent client.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase feed for her guinea pigs

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua is a 38-year-old married mother of two children, the elder of whom has completed senior school and the younger of whom is in technical school. Akua owns and operates a grocery store selling items such as rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed milk powder, polybags etc. She deems it a big opportunity to expand her business to include other items frequently demanded by her customers. Akua wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams etc. to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve sales to enable her to save more for her children’s education. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To increase her grocery inventory

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Khady D., 65 ans, mariée est membre du Banc Villageois de LYNDIANE-2-PONT depuis 8 ans. Elle n'a pas d'enfant en charge, mais pour subvenir à ses besoins primaires elle développe une activité de petit commerce. L'objectif de son crédit est de commercialiser des produits halieutiques au niveau du marché de son quartier. Elle remboursera son prêt globalement en une seule fois à l'échéance au bout de 6 mois.
texts.en:
Khady D. is 65 years old and she has been a member of the Community Bank "Lyndiane-2-Pont". She has no children in her care but in order to cover her basic needs she manages a small business. The loan will be invested in the sale of seafood in the local market. She will repay the loan in full in one installment at the end of the 6-month term.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supplement her small business

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en: Susanna is 61 years old and married with five adult children, all of whom are fully independent. Despite her age, Susanna works very hard because she always wants to look healthy and make an income to support her elderly husband, who is a pensioner. For the past four years Susanna has been selling home products, such as cooking utensils, plastic bowls, buckets and plates, at the community market where she lives. She wants to use her loan to buy an increased stock of plastic items and kitchen sets. She would be very grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy an increased stock of plastic items and kitchen sets

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es: El Nombre de la Señora Petrona M. tiene la edad de 63 años, es madre soltera, Doña Petrona  tiene 4 hijos y ninguno de sus hijos depende de ella ya que todos trabajan por cuenta propia.  Sus deseos son de mejorar cada día en la calidad de sus tortillas para que de esta forma pueda obtener más clientes. Su actividad económica es la venta y la elaboración de tortillas, la ubicación de su negocio es en su humilde vivienda, ya que tenía que proporcionarle a su familia el pan de cada día. Hace más de 18 años que inicia con este negocio y su Mama le había enseñado este tipo de oficio por lo que se convierte en un medio de trabajo para ella y decide comenzar con 20libras de maíz y con el paso del tiempo consigue fama de vender tortillas y por sus vecinos y otras personas se gana a sus clientes por lo que decide que este sería su negocio, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que tiene que comprar leña, maíz y comal que es el utensilio para la elaboración de sus tortillas.
texts.en:
Sra. Petrona M. is a 63 year old single mother. All of her children are financially independent because they are self-employed. Every day she hopes to improve the quality of her tortillas so that she can attract more customers. For more than 18 years, she has been making and selling tortillas from her modest home in order to provide for her family’s daily needs. Her mother taught her this skill. Sra. Petrona started with 20 lbs. of corn and over time became well-known among her neighbors and others for her tortillas. She later decided that this would be her full-time business.

The loan she is requesting will be used as working capital to buy firewood, corn, and a hotplate for making her tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Kaindi

texts.en:
Kaindi is a 35-year-old mother of two children. She operates a grocery business in Nairobi, and has requested her first loan of 20,000 KES in order to start the same business in another location. She plans to purchase a pick-up truck in two years for transporting and supplying onions and tomatoes. Kaindi hopes to educate her children and have a good and comfortable life. She describes herself as faithful, obedient, polite and loving.

About Faulu Kenya
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing access to financial opportunities. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To set up another grocery business

loans.name: Javanson

texts.en:
Javanson is a forty year old father of two who lives and operates his retail shop in Mukuru slums, Nairobi. He also runs a grocery besides the retail shop. He has requested for his second loan of Ksh. 50,000 to add stock of bread, wheat flour, maize flour and other products. He has acquired four rooms in the slums and desires to have many rental houses in Nairobi in future. He describes himself as social, loving and hardworking.



Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing access to financial opportunities. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock

loans.name: Elvin Jairo

texts.es: El Señor de Nombre Elvin Jairo C. Rodríguez tiene la edad de 33 años, sus sueños son establecer un restaurante para obtener más ingresos para poseer 2 negocios enfocados en lo mismo y obtener más ganancias para su familia. La actividad económica de Elvin es un restaurante la ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda.  Hace más de 6 años, que se dedica a esta actividad por la búsqueda de una fuente de ingresos que sea más y con el paso del tiempo han logrado comprar sillas, mesas, manteles entre otras cosas y así fue que su negocio fue creciendo.  El  financiamiento es para capital de trabajo destinado para la comprar de sillas y otras cosas necesarias para su local. por lo que su deseo es crear un ambiente familiar.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic is a thirty three year old father of three school going children. He runs a bodaboda (motorbike taxi) business in Nairobi; he also operates a bicycle repair garage in Kyangombe village as well as a retail kiosk that his wife operates. He has requested for a fourth loan of Kes. 80,000 after successful repayment of three other loans in order to buy a motorbike and add stock of bicycle spares. He hopes to grow his bodaboda business into a cab company, the kiosk into a wholesale shop and the spares business into sale of bicycles. He describes himself as social, peaceful and God fearing.


Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing access to financial opportunities. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Buy a motorcycle

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 29-year-old father of one who runs a transport business in Nairobi. He is requesting his third loan of 80,000 KES, having successfully repaid two previous loans. He intends to spend his loan money on vehicle repairs. James desires to raise a happy family and give his children the best education possible. He also hopes to own a cab company. James describes himself as sociable and ambitious.

About Faulu Kenya
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing access to financial opportunities. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To repair his vehicles

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is a 41-year-old father of one. An auditor and manufacturer, Godfrey owns a cosmetics manufacturing company in Nairobi. He has been in this business for the past fourteen years after early retirement from the civil service. Godfrey is requesting a loan of Kes 50,000 in order to add to his stock of raw materials. Godfrey hopes to raise a God-fearing family. He describes himself as ambitious, focused and genuine. About Faulu Kenya: Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To add to his stock of raw materials

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is the 29-year-old mother of two. A landlady, Anna also owns an electronics and mobile phones accessories shop in Mukuru slums, Nairobi. She has been in this business for the past four years. Anna is requesting a loan of Kes 60,000 in order to add to her stock of mobile accessories and electronics. As a mother of two, Anna hopes to educate her children, build a good family house, and own a supermarket one day. She describes herself as quiet and hospitable. About Faulu Kenya: Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To add to her stock of mobile accessories and electronics

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is the 46-year-old father of three. A landlord, who owns a furniture workshop, John owns a large building and rents out both residences and small business premises. He has been in this business for the past five years. John is requesting a loan of Kes 60,000 in order to add to his stock of timber and block boards and to purchase more tools. As the father of three, John hopes to build for his family a home away from the slums. He describes himself as social, kind and charitable. About Faulu Kenya: Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To add to his stock of timber and to purchase more tools

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a 30-year-old mother of three. A boutique owner and a landlady for the past nine years, Emily owns three rooms in the Mukuru slums which she rents out both as residences and small-business spaces. She describes herself as diligent and quiet, yet jovial.

Emily is requesting a loan of 60,000 KES in order to stock her boutique with new clothes. She hopes to educate her children and build a better home for them.

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing access to financial opportunities. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To add new stock to her boutique.

loans.name: Albanus

texts.en: Albanus is a 20-year-old businessman who owns a butcher shop in Mukuru slums. He has been in this business for the past two years after working for a road-construction company. Albanus is requesting a loan of Kes 20,000 in order to add to his stock of meat and to purchase a weighing machine. Albanus hopes to become a meat supplier one day. He describes himself as hardworking. About Faulu Kenya: Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To add to his stock of meat

loans.name: Luis Joaquin

texts.es: Luis Joaquín V. tiene la edad de 43 años, es un hombre casado  tiene 2 hijos  que dependen de ella, sus deseos son mantener su negocio activo por que todavía necesita mantener a su familia. La actividad económica a la que se dedica el  la venta y destace de cerdo hace mas de 5 años  que se dedica a esa actividad. Inicia este negocio  por la necesidad de trabajar ya que no tenía trabajo y sus hijos necesitaban alimentos y estudios. Más tarde decide quedarse con este negocio y empieza con la compra de un cerdo y al tener afluencia de clientes decide invertir más en su negocio, el financiamiento es para capital e trabajo destinado para la compra de  más productos cerdos para criar y además para la alimentación de estos animales que es muy cara. Su deseo es que su negocio logre tener la mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Luis Joaquín V. is 43 years old, married, and has 2 dependent children. He desires to maintain an active business so that he can continue to support his family. For 5 years, he has been selling and butchering pigs in order to earn a living. He started his business out of necessity because he needed work in order to feed and educate his children. Luis started by purchasing one pig and decided to invest more resources into his business once he experienced an influx of customers.

The loan he is requesting will be used as working capital to buy more pigs for breeding. He will also buy animal feed, which can be very expensive. He hopes that his business will continue to churn out a high quality product.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Ramtoulaye

texts.fr: Ramatoulaye D. est une femme de 50 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 8 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Vélingara Ouest2 depuis l'an 2003 et y a bénéficié de 12 prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursés sans difficulté. Elle va développer un petit commerce d'arachide et de légumes, les bénéfices qu'elle réalisera lui permettront de prendre partiellement en charge la nourriture et la santé de ses enfants. Elle rembourse le prêt en une échéance de 6 mois

loans.use: Renforcer son activité

loans.name: Fatoumata Binta

texts.fr: Fatoumata Binta L. est une femme de 31 ans, elle est célibataire et a 2 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Vélingara Ouest2 depuis le 23 décembre 2006 et y a bénéficié de 5 prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursés avec succès. Avec son prêt elle va faire un commerce de tissu teinté et les profits générés lui serviront à assurer la santé, la nourriture et la scolarité de ses 2 enfants. Le prêt sera remboursé en une seule échéance en fin de cycle de 6 mois.

loans.use: Renforcer son capital

loans.name: Idiatou

texts.fr: Idiatou D. est une femme de 35 ans elle est mariée avec 5 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Vélingara OUEST2 depuis 4 ans et a bénéficié de 8 prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursés sans problème. Ce prêt lui permettra de développer un petit commerce de tissu teinté et de réaliser des bénéfices pour soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Idiatou D. is a 35 year old married woman and mother of 5 children still in her care. She has been a member of the Community Bank "Velingara Ouest2" for the past 4 years and she has acquired 8 previous loans, all of which have all been repaid without difficulty. This loan will permit her to develop her small colored fabrics business, and to obtain earnings to help her husband support the family.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To advertise her small business.

loans.name: Santos Isidoro

texts.es: Santos Eliodoro R. L.  tiene la edad de 51 años, vive en su casa de habitación con su esposa.  Tiene 3 hijos y todos  trabajan de manera independiente.  Su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 22 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que inicio ofreciendo la venta de productos básicos como arroz, azúcar, aceite y frijoles. Ya que su negocio fue una herencia de sus padres. Por lo que el principal negocio de Santos es satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes ofreciéndoles lo que ellos solicitan. Es así como recurre a Fundación León 2000 ya que por medio ella las organizaciones amigas dan el apoyo necesario y solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo para granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, gaseosas, bisutería y leche en bolsa. El deseo de Santos es convertir su negocio en una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Santos Eliodoro R. L. is 51 years old and lives with his wife. He has 3 children who all work independently. His economic activity is a grocery store. He has dedicated himself to this business for more than 22 years. He started out offering basic items such as rice, sugar, cooking oil and green beans. He inherited the business from his parents. His primary goal is to satisfy the needs of his customers by offering them what they request. This is how he turned to Fundación León 2000, since it is through these friendly organizations that he can receive the support necessary and solicit financing for working capital to buy items such as snacks, refreshments, sodas, costume jewelry and milk in bags. Santos’ wish is to convert his business into a distributorship.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Peña Blanca Group

texts.es:
Lidia  G.  E.  (Representante del  grupo )  mujer de  36 años  de edad orgullosa de  ser  oaxaqueña , Lidia  se  a dedicado  toda  su vida  al trabajo de campo  para tener  día a día  una  mejor vida,comenta que a  la  edad de 12 años  ella  por ser la mayor de 10 hermanos  no pudo  tener una infancia  bonita  como  cualquier otra, ya que en ese  tiempo era muy difícil  seguir en  casa  viendo que faltaba  mucho apoyo  ya que sus  padres son campesinos y no les alcanzaba  el  dinero,   Lidia  al ver que   el sustento de su hogar  faltaba, decidió  salir de su  localidad para  trabajar,  es  como llego al puerto de Veracruz  donde  ella  aprendió  a  leer y escribir  así poco a poco se convirtió en una mujer trabajadora y responsable, regreso a su localidad con muchas fuerza de  salir adelante  y a trabajar en el campo , para que a sus padres y hermanos  no les  faltara  la comida y el estudio , en la actualidad Lidia  es casada  y tiene  tres hijos   de los  cuales esta orgullosa  por que dice  que son como  ella  de trabajadores y responsables ,  es por eso que  ella trabaja  y apoya  a su esposo  para que  a sus  hijos  no les falte  nada  y tengan todo lo que ella  deseo en su infancia. El sueño  de Lidia  es  que  algún día  su comunidad  llegue  a  estar pavimentada  para  que ya  no se les  dificulten bajar a vender  sus productos, ya que en tiempo de lluvia es muy difícil y peligroso bajar  caminando, comenta que ellos  se  hacen tres horas  cuando el camino esta  lodoso  y  deslavado.

Ella  es originaria  de  Peña Blanca, Oaxaca, dice  que esta orgullosa  de pertenecer  a  esta localidad  ya que Peña Blanca esta ubicado en la punta del cerro  y es dificultoso subir y bajar  pero  en  realidad tiene una vista muy hermosa  y las cosechas  son de buena reproducción, pero a Lidia  no  se le dificulta nada  ella busca  la manera  de  bajar  del cerro en burro  o caballo para realizar sus  ventas, es por eso  que se  a  unido  a  un pequeño grupo de personas  de  su localidad  para solicitar  un préstamo a FRAC actualmente  todos  los integrantes  del grupo  cuentan con su actividad  y el mayor sueño de estas  personas es seguir creciendo en sus  negocios para  que  cada día mejoren su calidad de  vida.

El grupo  esta  Integrado  de  4 personas y  tiene por nombre PEÑA  BLANCA  como su  lugar de origen, actualmente se encuentra en  su primer  ciclo del cual están solicitando  un promedio por la cantidad de $4,250.00 por cada integrante  ellos se comprometen  a ser unas  personas responsables  y cuidaran este recurso.  


 Las  personas que integran el grupo  son:

Nombres                                                                                                 Actividad

Lidia   G. E.                      vende, cerdos, gallinas  café, maíz, chiles y antojitos.
Maria de Jesús  I. F.            vende, pan  y  golosinas. 
Lucia T.  R.	vende,  gallinas  e iniciara la venta de sandalias  y servilletas.
Guillermo I.  F.	vende,  leña, café, maíz  e  iniciara  la venta de  mojarra.
texts.en:
Lidia G. E. (representative of the group) is a 36-year old woman who is proud to be an Oaxaqueña. Lidia has dedicated herself her whole life to working the land so that one day she might enjoy a higher standard of living. She tells us that, from the age of 12 and being the eldest of 10 siblings, she was not able to enjoy as happy a childhood as others. During this time it was very difficult to remain in her home since her parents were farmers and did not have the necessary resources to support the family. Lidia, upon seeing that they needed help, decided to leave her locality to find work. This is how she arrived at the port of Veracruz where she learned to read and write, and slowly turned herself into a very hard-working and responsible woman. She returned to her hometown with a great desire to get ahead and help her husband so that her children would not be lacking of anything, and have all that she’d wished for during her own youth. Lidia’s dream is for her community to one day have paved roads so that traveling to sell their products is less difficult. During the rainy season it is very challenging and dangerous to travel on foot, and she tells us that it takes three hours when the roads are muddy and washed out. She is originally from Peña Blanca, Oaxaca, and says that she is proud to be from this area. Peña Blanca is located at the tip of the mountain and it is difficult to climb up and down and, even so, the views are beautiful and the harvests of the area are bountiful. Lidia does not allow any difficulty to slow her down, however, and she manages to get down the mountain on a donkey or horse to sell her products. For this reason, she has joined a small group of people in the town to request a loan from FRAC. Currently, all the group members have their own enterprises and their collective dream is to continue growing their businesses so that each day they can improve their standard of living. The group is made up of 4 members and is called PEÑA BLANCA, like they place from which they originate. This would be their first loan cycle, for which they are requesting the amount of $4,250 per member. They commit to be responsible in their payments and will take great care of this resource. The members of the group are: (Name, Activity) Lidia G. E. sells pigs, chickens, coffee, corn, chiles and prepared foods. Maria de Jesús I. F. sells bread and snacks. Lucia T. R. sells chickens, and will start selling sandals and napkins. Guillermo I. F. sells wood, coffee, corn, and will start selling fish.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To grow their businesses so they can generate more income to help support their families.

loans.name: Soyaltepec Group

texts.es:
Ude: Soyaltepec
Ciclo: 1
Fecha de desembolso: 11 de agosto del 2009
Monto de crédito: 25,000.00



           Francisca J. A. originaria y vecina de la comunidad de Soyaltepec municipio de Temascal Oaxaca, casada de 49 años de edad madre de dos hijos los cuales se encuentran en el extranjero, con muchos sueños de superación y ánimos de salir adelante, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora ya que todas las mañanas se levanta muy temprano para abrir su tienda de abarrotes la cual le ha costado mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, por que nos platica que empezó a vender con una pequeña mesa en la cual solo vendía dulces y chicharrones a los niños,  pero que con la ayuda de dios y de sus hijos  ha ido creciendo su negocio, nos comenta que empezó con su venta por que su comunidad se encuentra a 3 kilómetros de  la carretera y a 20 minutos de su municipio, la falta de comercio que existente en su localidad y el largo trayecto  que tendrían que recorrer para comprar el consumo de la canasta básica, entonces fue  hay donde surgió la idea de vender abarrotes en general.


          En la comunidad  nos comentan que doña Francisca es una persona líder en su localidad, responsable y honesta con un carisma que a todos contagia con su forma de ser a todas las personas de la comunidad, su mayor anhelo es que en su negocio se encuentre bien surtido y se venda de todo  para  que no tengan la necesidad de salir las personas de su localidad y de esta forma  salir ella adelante  y asegurar un futuro para ella y su esposo. 

          Doña Francisca en sus sueños de superación para ella y para las personas de su comunidad ingreso a una micro financiera llamada Fundacion Realidad A.C. en la cual ingresaron con ella 4 hombres y 5 mujeres los cuales formaron un grupo llamado Soyaltepec. En el cual ella adquirió un crédito de $3,000 el cual lo utilizara para resurtir su negocio y vender más producto. El grupo nos dicen muy contentos que se sienten apoyados, y dan gracias de que se les pueda brindar este tipo de ayuda de  prestamos ya que no tienen acceso a los servicios financieros de ningún tipo y cuando quieren un préstamo les piden demasiados  requisitos con los que no cuentan, y se consideran personas de escasos recursos.  

          Los integrantes del grupo de doña Francisca son: Dora Hilda M. A. ella cría y venta de cerdo, Celerino M. C. el ofrece sus servicios de taxi, Armando M. C.  el ofrece sus servicios de mecánico, Justina B. M. ella vende comida, Tomasa C. F. ella hace servilletas y manteles tejidos o bordados, Guillermo C. J. el vende tacos,  Francisca J. A. ella tiene su tienda de abarrotes, Lorenzo A. F. el vende comida, Obdaly C. S. ella vende ropa de dama, Miriam A. C. ella vende zapatos por catalogo.

Nota: Doña Francisca es la segunda de izquierda a derecha.

loans.use: PARA EL INCREMENTO DE SU TIENDA DE ABARROTES OFRECIENDO UN MEJOR SERVICIO A SU COMUNIDAD Y PROGRESO

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama Baldé,58 ans, mariée, et des enfants adultes, a 3 ans et demi d'expérience dans le Banc Villageois de Vélingara Ouest2 pour y avoir contracté 7 prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursés avec succès. l'objet de son crédit est de développer une activité de vente de tissus teintés. Avec les bénéfices de son commerce elle soutiendra son mari pour l'amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille

loans.use: Renforcer sos capital

loans.name: Raby

texts.fr: Raby T. est une dame de 58 ans, elle est veuve et vit seule avec une de ses filles et son petit fils. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Vélingara Ouest2 depuis le 25 octobre 2002 et y a contracté 13 prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursés sans difficulté. Elle développe une activité de vente d'arachide qui lui permet, avec les bénéfices générés, de prendre entièrement en charge son petit fils et sa fille. Elle remboursera le prêt en une seule fois en une échéance de 6 mois.

loans.use: Renforcer son activité

loans.name: Bintou

texts.fr: Bintou S. est une femme de 40 ans, elle est mariée et a en charge 4 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Vélingara Ouest2 depuis le 06 mai 2003 et y a contracté 12 prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursés sans difficulté. Avec ce prêt elle développe une activité de vente sur table de légumes, de fruits, de maïs et divers produits alimentaires. Avec les bénéfices de son commerce elle soutien son mari pour la nourriture, la santé et l'amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille. Elle rembourse son prêt globalement au bout de 6 mois.

loans.use: Faire la promotion de son activité

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
Since 1994, Cesar has worked as an employee of an industrial cleaning company. In 2005 a friend told him about the opportunity to make more money as a contractor in the same industry. He accepted the challenge and started his small business. To insure his success, he had to learn how to do the proper maintenance on the equipment to avoid untimely breakdowns.
 
Cesar needs a loan to provide working capital. In his business the equipment needs maintenance often and, if it breaks, it must be fixed on the same day. Equipment maintenance may be expensive, and Cesar didn’t have the extra money in his bank account to cover these costs. His loan though ACCION USA will provide more peace of mind to do his job, as he now has cushion to cover extra expenses.
 

Cesar says that he works hard to please his clients, giving them great service and listening to their requests. In the future he wants to buy more equipment to expand his business by obtaining more contracts.

loans.use: To use as a cushion to cover extra expenses

loans.name: Pedro Eduardo

texts.es: Pedro Eduardo B. V. tiene 53 años. Es un hombre casado y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales ninguno depende de él. Su actividad económica es la venta de productos lácteos. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio. Surge por la necesidad de brindarle a su familia lo necesario. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de cuajada, crema, leche y mantequilla. Su deseo es contar con su propio medio de transporte.
texts.en:
Pedro Eduardo B. V. is 53 years old. He is married and has 4 children, none of whom depend on him financially any longer. His economic activity is the sale of dairy products. He has dedicated himself to this business for more than 6 years. The business arose from his need to provide his family with the basic necessities. The financing he is seeking would be used as working capital to buy curd, cream, milk and butter. His dream is to have his own mode of transportation.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Nely

texts.es:
Nely es socia del Banco Comunal Ladrilleros de Compañía.
Nely es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 2 hijos, Nely junto a su esposo se dedican a la elaboración de ladrillos de manera artesanal los ladrillos los venden sin hornearlos, además Nely compra y vende tara y cochinilla.
Nely necesita un préstamo de 450 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tierra.
Los sueños de Nely son tener casa propia y tener una tienda grande de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Nely is a member of the “Ladrilleros de Compañia” (Brickmakers from Compañia) Communal Bank. Nely is in a common-law marriage, is 27-years-old, and has two children. Nely, along with her husband, make and sell handmade, unbaked bricks. Nely also buys and sells tara (a Peruvian plant whose tannins are most commonly used in the manufacture of furniture leather) and cochineal (an insect used to make a red dye). Nely needs a loan of 450 Peruvian soles that will be used to buy soil for making bricks. Nely dreams of having her own home and a large grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soil to make bricks

loans.name: Dionisia Leonora

texts.es:
Leonora es socia del Banco Comunal Ladrilleros de Compañía.
Leonora es casada, tiene 43 años y 3 hijos, Leonora junto a su esposo se dedican a la elaboración de ladrillos de manera artesanal cuenta con horno propio, sus ventas los realiza en el mismo lugar y también en la ciudad de Ayacucho según pedido. Además Leonora tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa.
Leonora necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Leonora son comprar un terreno para la construcción de su casa en la ciudad de Ayacucho.
texts.en:
Leonora is a member of the “Ladrilleros de Compañía” (Brickmakers from Compañía) Communal Bank. Leonora is married, is 43-years-old, and has three children. Leonora, along with her husband, sell handmade bricks and use their own oven. They sell the bricks from home and also in the city of Ayachucho, made to order. Leonora also has a grocery store in her home. Leonora needs a loan of 2000 Peruvian soles that will be used to buy rice and sugar. Leonora dreams of buying her own land so she can build a house in Ayacucho.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Safiétou

texts.fr: Safiétou F. du Banc Villageois de Vélingara Ouest2 est âgée de 51 ans, elle est mariée et a en charge 4 enfants. Elle est d'une ancienneté de 5 ans et demi de son Banc Villageois et y a contracté 11 prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursés sans difficulté.
