L'objet de son crédit est de poursuivre son activité de vente sur table des produits alimentaires tels que des fruits, du Maïs, des œufs durs des arachides grillées etc. Les bénéfices de son petit commerce lui permettront de soutenir son mari pour la prise en charge de la famille et de subvenir à ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Safiétou Faofana, a member of the Vélingara Ouest2 Village Bank, is 51 years old and married with four children. She has been with her Village Bank for five and a half years, and has taken out and repaid eleven loans without difficulty. She plans to use this loan to continue her business selling food like fruits, corn, hardboiled eggs, roasted peanuts, etc. The profits generated by her small business will allow her to help her husband support their family and take care of her personal needs.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To promote her business

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal Ladrilleros D. Compañía.
Felicitas es casada, tiene 58 años y 9 hijos, Felicitas junto a su hijo se dedican a la elaboración D. ladrillos D. manera artesanal. Además Felicitas se dedica a la compra y venta D. tara y cochinilla.
Felicitas necesita un préstamo D. 900 soles dinero que será invertido para labrar ladrillos.
El sueño D. Felicitas es construir su casa en la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

loans.use: Para labrar ladrillos.

loans.name: Oumou

texts.fr: Oumou F. est une dame de 53 ans, elle est mariée et a un enfant en charge. Elle est cliente du Banc Villageois de Vélingara Ouest2 depuis 6 ans et demi et y a contracté 13 prêts qu'elle a chaque fois remboursés sans difficulté. Avec son crédit elle développe un petit commerce de vente de pain de signe et de charbon. Les bénéfices de son activité lui serviront à aider son marie pour la prise en charge de la nourriture, la santé et l'amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Oumou F. is a 53 year-old married woman with one child still in her care. She has been a member of the Community Bank "Velingara Ouest2" for the past 6 years and a half, and she has acquired 13 loans during that time. Each of the loans was repaid without difficulty. The loans are used to develop her small break bakery business. The earnings from her small business will help her husband in the purchase of food, healthcare and to generally improve the living conditions of her family.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop her business.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma es socia del Banco Comunal Desarrollo.
Norma es casada, tiene 30 años y 3 hijos, Norma junto a su esposo tienen una panadería, donde elaboran panes típicos, para lo cual cuenta con el apoyo de personal, sus ventas los realiza en las agencias interprovinciales. Además Norma vende condimentos secos en el mercado Covadonga.
Norma necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina y ají panca.
Los sueños de Norma son construir mas pisos en su casa, sus hijos sean profesionales y ser una empresaria de éxito.
texts.en:
Norma is a member of the Development Communal Bank. She is married, is 30 years old and has 3 children. Norma and her husband have a bakery where they make typical breads and which she has staff for. She makes her sales at interprovincial agencies. In addition, Norma sells dried seasonings in the Covadonga market. Norma needs a loan of 3000 soles which she will invest in flour and Peruvian red peppers. Norma's dreams are to add more stories to her house, for her children to become working professionals, and to be a successful businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour and Peruvian red pepper

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda  es socia del Banco Comunal Desarrollo.
Yolanda es casada, tiene 36 años y 5 hijos, Yolanda vende verduras en el mercado Nery García, ella compra de los productores y lo vende al por mayor, actividad que realiza desde las 1 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la mañana. Además tiene un mototaxi que alquila.
Yolanda necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la reparación de la mototaxi.
Los sueños de Yolanda son construir su casa y educar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the Desarrollo Microfinance Institute.

Yolanda is a 36-year-old married mother with 5 children. Yolanda sells vegetables at the Nery García market. She buys the produce from growers and sells it wholesale from 1 to 7 in the morning. Additionally, she owns a motorcycle taxi that she rents out.

Yolanda needs an 800.00 PEN loan, which will be invested in repairing her motorcycle taxi.

Yolanda dreams of building her house and of providing her children with an education so that they can one day become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Masi

texts.en:
"Masi U. (0) is a 52-year-old woman living in the town of Faala 2.  She is married and has 3 adult -aged children.  To make a living, Masi owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale.  Masi has been engaged in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 2000 WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Masi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Masi has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  Masi is now requesting a new loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Masi plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future

loans.name: Esperanza Del Socorro

texts.es: Esperanza del Socorro S. tiene la edad de 54 años, vive con su esposo. Doña Esperanza tiene 4 hijos y todos trabajan. La actividad económica de Esperanza es la venta de productos plásticos. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio. Inicio por que observo que muchos clientes buscaban la manera de obtener sus productos como le agrado la idea de facilitarles a sus clientes estos productos decidió seguir adelante. Sus  propósitos de  son de mejorar la calidad de sus productos para que sus clientes se encuentren satisfechos con sus productos. El financiamiento es para capital compra para la inversión de su negocio para la compra de bolsas plásticas, vasos plásticos, tasas y todos los productos plásticos.
texts.en:
Esperanza del Socorro S. is a 54-year-old woman who lives with her husband. She has 4 children who all work. She has been selling plastic goods for a living for 4 years. She launched this business because she noticed that many customers were looking for a way to obtain these products. Since she liked the idea of providing her customers with the products, she decided to move forward. Her goal is to improve the quality of her products so that her customers can be satisfied. This loan will be used as working capital to invest in purchasing plastic bags, cups, teacups, and all sorts of other plastic goods.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene es socia del Banco Comunal Desarrollo.
Irene es casada, tiene 57 años y 2 hijos, Irene tiene una bodega en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, bebidas, además en el mismo local tiene un restaurante, actividad que realiza hace 6 meses con la ayuda D. su esposo.
Irene necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. horno para hornear pollos.
Los sueños D. Irene son techar su casa y ampliar sus negocios.
texts.en:
Irene is a member of the Desarrollo Microfinance Institute.

Irene is a 57-year-old married mother with two children. She owns an in-home general store in which she sells provisions and drinks. She also has her own restaurant—which has been in service for 6 months with the help of her husband—in the same space.

Irene needs a 2,000.00 PEN loan so that she can invest it in purchasing an oven to bake chicken.

Irene dreams of roofing her house and of expanding her businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase oven to bake chicken

loans.name: Gloria Teodora

texts.es:
Gloria es socia del Banco Comunal Desarrollo.
Gloria es conviviente, tiene 41 años y 4 hijos, Gloria tiene un restaurante en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de una prima, además Gloria se dedica a la agricultura de papa.
Gloria necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gaseosas, arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños de Gloria son construir su casa y tener un restaurante en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the Desarrollo Community Bank. Gloria, 41, is in a common law marriage and has four children. Gloria has a restaurant in a rented location. She works there every day with help from a cousin. Also, Gloria grows potatoes. Gloria needs a loan for 1,600 PEN to buy soft drinks, rice, and sugar. Gloria’s dreams are to build her house and to have a restaurant in the center of the city.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soft drinks, rice, and sugar

loans.name: Juana Claudia

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Desarrollo.
Juana es casada, tiene 59 años y 9 hijos, Juana viaja a las diferentes ferias D. la región en donD. compra cereales, productos que venD. en el mercado señor D. arequipa, además Juana venD. golosinas D. manera ambulatoria en el mercado.
Juana necesita un préstamo D. 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. trigo y maíz.
Juana sueña con construir su casa y mejorar su negocio.

loans.use: Para la compra de trigo y maíz.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: El Sr Alejandro se dedica a alquilar su camioneta para tranasportar ladrillos, tejas, cemento , etc pertenece a una asociacion en el 5º anillo santos dumont. Vive en  la zona alto Santa Rita junto con su esposa son dueños de casa su esposa se dedica a la costura de ropa y tiene una pequeña hija. El credito utilizara para realizar algunas reparaciones a la movilidad.
texts.en:
Sr. Alejandro rents out his truck for transporting bricks, tiles, cement and other construction materials. He is a member of the #5 Anillo Santos Dumont Association. He lives in the Santa Rita district with his wife (who is a seamstress) and young daughter. His loan will be used to pay for repairs to his vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repairs

loans.name: Grand Bassin Rayon D Espoir Group

texts.en:
The “Rayon D’espoir” or Ray of Hope group is made of twenty male and female entrepreneurs.  The group not only represents a variety in both ages of the representatives but also the types of businesses they have. The youngest of the group is under twenty years old and the eldest of the group is above sixty years old. The business range from furniture and door making, to sales of used clothing and sandals, and to a restaurant with international clientele that is on the boarder of the Dominican Republic and Haiti. Gamy J. P. is a representative of the group and also the youngest associate at 19yrs old.
Gamy, who has worked on construction and specialized in door making for some year, will use this loan  to buy wood, tools and sheet metal to create a place of business for himself. He is very enthusiastic about starting out a business of his own and realizes it will require hard work and patience to be successful. He looks forward to being able to help his family, parents and siblings,  and prepare a future for himself. On behalf of Gamy, Rayon D’espoir, and Esperanza we thank you for your support.

loans.use: wood, tools and sheet metal

loans.name: Sol Naciente Group

texts.es: Es un grupo antiguo  son cumplidos en sus pagos,viven en un mismo Barrio, donde se conocen bien. Su grupo se llama "SOL NACIENTE", donde, el Banco de Emprendimiento esta en su 4º Ciclo y esta  como presidenta la señora Patricia Veronica S. , su actividad es la venta de comida ella vive en anticretico, tiene 3 hijos, su esposo trabaja como jardinero en la alcaldia, es cumplida en sus pagos. Como tesorera esta la socia Angela J. A. quien es fundadora del grupo, ella vende peluches (muñecos de tela)  y trabaja haciendo limpieza en una casa particular, tiene 4 hijos pero 2 dependen de ella, ella es muy activa, apesar de ser de la tercera edad. Como secretaria esta la socia Hilda M. J. quien vende ropa de temporada ambulando los dias de feria, tiene 3 hijos y esta concubinada, el es albañil,viven en casa alquilada.
texts.en:
This is a long-time group in which the members have completed their payments on time. They live in the same neighborhood and know each other well. The group has named their communal bank “Sol Naciente” (Rising Sun) and they are on their 4th loan cycle.

The group president is Sra. Patricia Veronica S., who is engaged in selling food. She lives in a rental property with her 3 children. Her husband is employed by the city as a gardener. Patricia has completed her previous loan payments.

Serving as treasurer, Angela J. A. is also the founder of the group. She sells stuffed toys (dolls made of fabric) and also works as a housekeeper at a private home. She has 4 children, of whom two are still dependent. She is very active despite being one of the older members.

Hilda M. J. is the group secretary. She sells seasonal clothing as a traveling merchant at the different fairs. She has 3 children with her live-in partner, who is a bricklayer. They live in a rented house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase their operating capital

loans.name: Armando Richard

texts.es: Armando Richard es una persona joven que  vive en la zona de Pampahasi. Se dedica a la confección de polleras (ropa típica de mujer), y comenzó con esta actividad hace quince años gracias a su madre que también hace polleras. Armando realiza contratos para comparsas y grupos de bailarines. Él es una persona muy responsable y dedicada con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Armando Richard is a young man who lives in the Pampahasi district. He manufactures traditional women’s skirts. His mother, who also produces these garments, taught him this skill when he was 15 years old. Armando receives contracts from musical groups and dance troupes. He is a very responsible person and dedicated to his work.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric at wholesale

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: La señora Julia tiene su frial (tienda de comestibles)en el mercado de alto San Antonio, vende pollo, panza, salchichas y carne de cerdo, además de abarrotes y conservas. Ella es de los Yunas de La Paz, y tiene también su frial en Coripata que está ubicado en Nor Yungas, al norte del departamento de La Paz, con su hija se turnan  en la atencion. Su esposo tiene su ferretería en su casa, donde vende material de construcción, ambos son conocidos en la zona y les va bien en sus negocios. Doña Julia invertirá en la compra de abarrotes para los dos friales, son clientes que trabajaron hace un año con nuestra institución descansaron un tiempo y ahora retornan para seguir trabajando con nosotros.
texts.en:
Sra. Julia has a food store at the Upper San Antonio Market, where she sells chicken, tripe, sausage, and pork, as well as groceries and canned goods. She is from Yunas de La Paz and also has a store in Coripata, which is located in Nor Yungas, north of the district of La Paz. She takes turns with her daughter in managing both locations. Her husband operates a hardware store out of their home, where he sells construction materials. Both of them are well-known in the neighborhood and have done well in their businesses.

Doña Julia will purchase groceries for her two stores. She and her husband have worked with our Institution for one year. They have been inactive for awhile, but they have now returned to continue working with us.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase groceries (oil, rice, flour, sugar, etc.)

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: El Sr Oscar Z. es un cliente nuevo que llego a nuestra institucion por recomendación de una buena clienta . El Sr Oscar es dueño de una vagoneta, ahora el necesita el credito para comprar llantas nuevas , El Sr Oscar Nacio  en santa Cruz al igual que su esposa la Sra Gabriela con la cual tiene 2 hijos,  Actualmente  viven en la casa que le dejo su madre al irse a España.
texts.en:
Mr. Oscar Z. is a new client that came to our institution through the recommendation of a good client. Oscar is the owner of a taxi and needs the loan to buy new tires. Oscar was born in Santa Cruz like his wife Gabriela, with whom he has two children. They currently live in the house that his mother left him when she moved to Spain.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of four tires for taxi

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es:
Don Eusebio D.  cuenta con 46 años de edad, esta casado con  Nilsa Caballero, tienen dos hijos menores de edad. 
Nos cuenta  Don Eusebio que hace  más de 7 años se dedica a esta actividad, para comenzar con su carnicería su padre le había regalo dos novillos para faenar y luego vender las carnes, y así el obtuvo su pequeño capital. 

Con la ganancias el puedo llevar adelante su negocio sin depender de otra persona, gracias a la Fundación Paraguaya que con el crédito obtenidos el mejoro su local aumento su carnicería, hoy en día  esta trabajando muy bien en su propio domicilio sin abandonarle a sus familia. 
Con la ayuda de su familia, el ingreso que le deja la carnicería el mantiene los gastos de la casa, y así solventar el estudio de sus hijos, y mejorar el nivel de vida económica. 
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de un congelador ya que  posee mayor demanda de carne, así brindarle mejor atención a sus  su clientela.
texts.en:
Don Eusebio D. is 46 years old and married to Nilsa Caballero. They have two dependent children. Don Eusebio tells us that he has been in business for 7 years. He started his butcher shop when his father gave him two steers to slaughter. He later sold the meat and was able to earn a little bit of capital.

Thanks to his profits, he was able to continue his business without depending on anyone else. He is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for providing him loans to expand his butcher shop. Today he is able to work effectively out of his own home without having to leave his family. With their help, the revenue generated from the butcher shop is enough to cover the household expenses. Don Eusebio is also able to pay for his children’s education and improve his family’s financial condition.

He is requesting a loan in order to purchase a freezer since there is a greater demand for meat. This will help him provide better service to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a freezer

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La Señora Gladys B. cuenta con 39 años de edad, es madre soltera de tres hijos, una mayor y dos menores y además viven con ella sus padres.
La actividad que realiza la Señora Gladys es la venta de artículos de primera necesidad tales como: arroz, fideo, azúcar, panificados y comidas, como ser: empanadas, milanesas, entre otros. 
Para poder comenzar con esta actividad, desde el año 1998, comenzó a realizar la venta de comidas rápidas montando un pequeño puesto en cada fiesta patronal de la ciudad, tanto fue el éxito de sus comidas que con el ingreso generado empezó la creación de la despensa. 
Gracias al espíritu emprendedor y la buena atención de la Señora,  en la actualidad ya tiene una clientela formada y sigue preparando comidas para la venta. 
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de un congelador que le resulta necesario para la venta de bebidas bien frías. 
El objetivo principal de la Señora es ampliar su local y así poder montar un pequeño bar.
texts.en:
Gladis B., 39, is a single mother. She has three children; one is grown and the other two are minors. Also, her parents live with her. Gladys sells basic needs items like rice, noodles, sugar, and bread. She sells food like empanadas and “milanesas” (breaded and fried veal) among others. In 1998, in order to start this activity, she started selling fast food by setting up a small stand at every Patron Saint Festival in the city. The success of her food was so great that she used the income it generated to create her store. Thanks to her entrepreneurial spirit and her good service, she currently has a good customer base, and she continues to prepare foods to sell. The loan she is asking for is to buy a freezer, which she needs to sell very cold drinks. Her primary objective is to expand her location and set up a small bar.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a freezer

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
EL Sr. Julio tiene 58 años de edad, esta casado hace varios años con la Sra. Eustaquia de profesión masajista, tienen 3 hijos, todos mayores y independientes.
El Sr. Julio es propietario de un taller de costura hace más de 6 años, tiene 4 empleados a su cargo y realiza trabajos de cortinados, tapicería y todo articulo de ropería para empresas en forma tercerizada y también a clientes exclusivos.
Se inicio con una pequeña maquina de coser junto con una ex compañera de trabajo iniciaron una pequeña sociedad. Actualmente cuenta con 7 máquinas industriales para confección de todo tipo.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de telas de temporada.
texts.en:
Julio is 58 years old and married for various years to Eustaquia who is a professional masseuse. They have 3 children, all adults living independently.

For 6 years, Julio has been the proprietor of a sewing shop. He has 4 employees under his charge making curtains, tapestry, and all articles of clothing for enterprises that outsource the work, as well as for exclusive clients.

He began with a small sewing machine. Then, he and a former work companion formed a small partnership. Presently, they have 7 industrial machines that can be used in manufacturing of all types. Julio is asking for a loan to buy cloth that is in season.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY CLOTH FOR FALL AND WINTER

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 41 años de edad, es casada, y vive junto a su esposo y sus siete hijos en el pueblo joven Jesús Nazareno, distrito de Monsefú, ubicado a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de pescado en el mercado de la ciudad de Pomalca, ubicada a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo; donde vende sus productos que compra en el terminal pesquero de la ciudad de Santa Rosa, a 10 minutos del lugar en donde vive.

Su esposo se dedica eventualmente a la pesca artesanal y con el dinero recaudado entre ambos tratan de sacar adelante a su familia, pero lo que perciben no es suficiente para sostenerlos, es por ello que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a nuestra Institución un crédito de 600 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más pescado para vender.

Su más grande anhelo es brindarle a sus siete hijos la posibilidad de asegurarse un futuro prometedor estudiando una carrera técnica o superior.

Rosa es muy conocida y estimada por sus vecinos y compañeros del mercado que la consideran una mujer alegre y responsable y que todos los día trabaja arduamente por sacar adelante a su hogar.
texts.en:
Rosa is 41 and married. She lives with her husband and their seven children in the Pueblo Joven Jesús Nazareno in the Monsefú district, which is located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She has been selling fish for four years in the market in city of Pomalca, which is located ten minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She sells the products that she buys in the fish terminal in the city of Santa Rosa, which is ten minutes from where she lives. Her husband works occasionally as a traditional local fisherman. With the money collected between the two of them, they try to get ahead for their family. But, what they receive is not enough to support them. That is why they have seen the necessity of asking our institution, for the first time, for a loan for 600 PEN. They plan to buy more fish to sell. Her biggest wish is to provide her seven children with the possibility of assuring themselves of a promising future by studying a technical field or getting a college education. Rosa is well known and held in high esteem by her neighbors and colleagues in the market. They consider her to be a happy and responsible woman who works arduously every day to give her household a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fish to sell

loans.name: Emiliano

texts.es:
El Sr. Emiliano Núñez tiene 64 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. De Jesús hace varios años, tuvieron 11 hijos de los cuales 9 siguen vivos, todos menos la menor de 20 años de edad esta a su cargo y ayuda en su actividad, los demás hijos ya son independientes.
El Sr. Núñez tiene una despensa y también se dedica a la venta de menudencias hace más de 15 años, su esposa e hijas se encargan de la despensa y él trabaja con una camioneta a repartir la menudencia. 
Se inicio con capital propio, anteriormente era albañil de obras y con un ahorro compro una pequeña camioneta y así empezó esta actividad. 
Solicita el crédito para compra de variedad de menudencias y mercaderías varias para la despensa como azúcar, yerba, panificados y bebidas en general.
texts.en:
Emiliano Núñez is 64 years old and has been married to Mrs. De Jesus for many years. They have had 11 children, 9 of whom have survived. The youngest is 20 years old and lives with them and helps in their work, the others are independent. Mr. Núñez has a small grocery store and has also sold other odds and ends for more than 15 years. His wife and children run the store and he drives a truck to distribute goods. He started his business with his own money. Prior to this he worked as a builder, and with his savings, he purchased a small truck and began this job. He is requesting a loan to purchase a variety of goods for his store, such as sugar, herbs, baking supplies and drinks in general.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase goods to sell

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
EL Sr. Ricardo M. tiene 68 años de edad, esta casado hace varios años con la Sra. Rosalina, tienen tres hijos, todos mayores de edad e independientes.
El Sr. M. junto con su Sra. trabajan hace más de 20 años a la compra venta de carbón, esta actividad lo han hecho desde que sus hijos eran pequeños, se inicio con un pequeño capital y actualmente posee un móvil con la cual realiza la entrega de sus mercaderías a despensas, copetines y kioscos del barrio.
Solicita su préstamo para la compra de carbón al por mayor.

loans.use: compra de carbón en grandes cantidades

loans.name: Korb

texts.en:
Mr. Korb K. is a battery charger. Aside from this work, he owns an "electric cow" (a machine that pulls a plough and runs on fuel). His electric cow is hired by the villagers to plow the fields. He needs money to buy a cart to connect with his electric cow for transportation. 
He is 26 years old and he now lives in Thnous village in TaK. province. His wife, Mrs. Un Mom, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. This couple has three children, one of whom is attending the local school while the others are just three and five years old. His wife is present on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cart to connect with his "electric cow" for transportation

loans.name: Bora

texts.en:
Mrs. Bora K. owns a pig breeding business. Her husband, Mr. Uk Borin, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. She wants to expand her business by purchasing five more piglets for breeding and she will use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizer for the rice field.

Mrs. Bora Keanwas born in 1972 and she lives in Chuos village in Takeo province. She has three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school and the other stays at home to do the housework. Her husband is present on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for a rice field

loans.name: Ceriaca

texts.en:
Ceriaca A. is from the village of San Isidro in Talakag Bukidnon. She is 56 years old. Ceriaca is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Ceriaca makes and sells food in the local community. Ceriaca just started this business.

In 2009, Ceriaca joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ceriaca is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products to sell. This will be Ceriaca's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok I is a villager in Hang Heng Village in Takeo Province. She owns a grocery store. Her husband, Mr. En Khun, is a construction worker. He is also a farmer who owns a piece of land on which he grows rice. He faces an obstacle because he does not have enough money to buy fertilizer or rice seed, or to hire laborers to work in his field. Thus, Mrs. Sok I has decided to request a loan for this purpose. She will use the rest of loan to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to increase their income and improve the family's living conditions with this loan. She is 37 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom attend the local school. The others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed, and to hire laborers to work on the field.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn P. is from the village of  Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 44 years old. Merlyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Merlyn sells snacks, like boiled bananas, and other delicacies and peddles in the local community. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Merlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Merlyn's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en: Mr. Sophat B. lives in Banteay village in Takeo province. He is a sugar cane middle man. Since his business is doing well, he wants to expand it. Thus, he decided to request a loan to buy more sugar cane to sell in the local district. His wife, Mrs. Mae Mom, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Mr. Sophat B. is 37 years old and the father of four children who are attending the local school. His wife is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more sugar cane to sell in the local district.

loans.name: Mr. Ya Ngao Village Bank Loan Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan which consists of 12 people and they all live in Khnach Khang Tboung village in Takeo province. Mr. Ya N. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn for living. Now he is requesting a loan to buy a cow for breeding. He hopes to increase income and improve his family living with this loan after he sales it. He is 46 years old widower with six children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. 

All the people in this group loans are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Mr. Phoeurn Suon Village Bank Loan Group

texts.en:
Mr. Phoeurn S. and his wife, Mrs. Khen Touch, are farmers who own a plot of land cultivating rice to earn a living. They have a small problem with their plantation, because the field has infertile soil which has a bad effect on their crop. Thus, Mr. Phoeurn S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and hire laborers to work on the field. He is 59 years old and the father of two children: one of whom is a goldsmith while the other is attending the local school.

Eighteen people living in Angk Svay Chek village in Takeo province make up this village bank loan. Mr. Phoeurn S. is the village bank president, selected by the members. They will all use the loan for different purposes.

Ten members of this group have end-of-term loans (the rest have monthly payment loans). They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.name: Islomiddin

texts.en: S. Islomiddin is a lively entrepreneur with a small business selling clothes and shoes for teenagers. He is an experienced entrepreneur having been self-employed for the past twelve years. Business has been good for Islomiddin. There is always demand for clothing and as the economy has improved in Tajikistan, so more people have been able to afford new clothing. Islomiddin is married and has three children. He is doing all his best to provide his children with the best future. Islomiddin has requested a loan of 2,500 USD to increase his available working capital. Eventually, he hopes to have his own small store. This loan will help him purchase new inventory and enable him to continue to invest in his business. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

texts.es: Esperanza Del Carmen H. M. reside en San Marcos, departamento de San Salvador. A sus  26 años de edad Esperanza es una madre trabajadora y responsable con su familia, vive con su esposo quien trabaja como comerciante y su hijo de 9 años de edad llamado Jose estudiante de básica. Esperanza conduce su negocio desde su humilde casa, ella elabora  variedad de pan dulce, tortas mexicanas y embutidos. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de materia prima que le permita aumentar su producción en comida.
texts.en:
Esperanza Del Carmen H. M. lives in San Marcos in the department of San Salvador. She is 26 years old, a working mother who is responsible for her family. She lives with her husband, who works as a merchant, and her nine-year-old son Jose, who is in grade school. Esperanza runs her business out of her small house. She makes a variety of sweet breads, Mexican cakes and sausages. The loan she is requesting will go toward purchasing basic materials that will allow her to increase the amount of food she makes.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Sonia Del Carmen

texts.es: Sonia Del Carmen C. R. reside en la zona occidente de El Salvador, exactamente en el departamento de Santa Ana. Sonia tiene 37 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos menores de edad entre ellos; Erika y Daysi las gemelitas de 11 años , Edwin de 9 años y Neftali de 6 años de edad. Sonia apoya a su esposo con los frecuentes gastos de su hogar, es por eso que posee una tienda y ahora para conseguir mayores ingresos también tiene una venta de yuca, pasteles y pupusas pero esto aun no es suficiente para la familia razón por la cual ahora Sonia solicita un préstamo para comprar productos para su tienda y materia prima para sus bocadillos típicos.
texts.en:
Sonia Del Carmen C. R. lives in the western part of El Salvador, in the Santa Ana department. She is 37 years old and lives with her husband and their 4 children. Erika and Daysi are 11-year-old twins, Edwin is 9 years old and Neftali is 6 years old. Sonia helps her husband with the many household expenses. For this reason she has a store and, in order to generate more income, she also sells yuca, pastries and pupusas. Unfortunately this is not enough for the family, which is why Sonia is now requesting a loan to purchase items for the store and basic materials for her dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: stock the store and purchase materials for preparing food

loans.name: Francisca Jebet

texts.en:
Francisca Jebet is 48 years old, married to Benjamin B. and blessed with five children. Her poultry business is located within the Moi University Annex. Her major clients are residents close to the university.

Francisca has been in the poultry business for the past 12 years now. She is requesting a loan from KADET to buy feed for the poultry including layer mash and chick mash and also to repair the poultry house. In the future she intends to grow her business, buy a pick-up truck and, God willing, build a residential house.

Francisca was introduced to KADET by another member.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To buy layers' mash, chick mash and  broilers' mash.

loans.name: Gloria Marina

texts.es: Gloria Marina P. D. A. resiD. en Ilopango municipio del departamento D. San Salvador. Gloria tiene 54 años D. edad, posee su propio negocio con el cual logra sostenerse mes a mes, ya que no recibe ningún respaldo económico D. nadie; es por ello que Gloria tiene que velar por sí misma y por su supervivencia, es así como lo hace cada día en su negocio, que se encuentra ubicado en su casa, una pequeña tienda con productos D. consumo y con una afluencia D. clientes muy estable. Gloria se quiere dar la oportunidad D. hacer creer su negocio por medio D. este crédito surtiendo su tienda  con variedad D. marcas y diferentes productos.
texts.en:
Gloria Marina P. D. A. lives in Ilopango, municipality of the province of San Salvador. Gloria is 54 years old and has her own business, through which she supports herself month to month as she doesn’t receive economic support from anyone. That is why Gloria has to look out for herself and her survival. She does so through her home-based business, a small store carrying consumer products and with a steady influx of customers.

Gloria wants to give herself the opportunity do grow her own business through this loan, which she will use to proviD. her store with a variety of brands and products

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Broaden store offering

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah N. is aged 41 years and is a married mother of two children, Newton and Susan. She is married to Duncan Kivida who is aged fifty years. 

Monicah runs a restaurant in Changamwe,Mombasa and she mainly sells roast meat. She has been in the business for 13 years, and her customers have been the residents of Changamwe and business people of the town. This will her first time borrowing from KADET and she plans to purchase more chairs, to repair the hotel floor (in Kenya- hotel is a small restaurant) and to purchase a new meat roasting jiko (stove).

She delights in satisfying her customers and in the future plans to open a similar restaurant in the same or another town to maximize her income.

loans.use: To purchase more chairs, to repair the hotel floor and to purchase a new meat roasting jiko.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es: Ana Cecilia R. E. de 42 años de edad resid ene Colon municipio del departamento de La Libertad. Ana es madre soltera de dos niños Cristian de 13 años y Oscar de 10 años de edad, también vive con ellos la mare de Ana quien es la mano derecha y apoyo incondicional para Ana. Hace cuatro años Ana se decidió a montar su propio negocio y fue así como nació la sala de belleza que posee en la cual se prestas servicios profesionales es cosmetología y también se vende productos para el cuidado del cabello. Ana solicita un crédito para invertir en productos ya que poseen buena demanda y esto le ayudara a incrementar sus ventas.

loans.use: Surtir su negocio con productos de belleza

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es: Luis Alonso B. reside en  Santa Tecla en el departamento de La Libertad. Luis vive junto a su esposa doña Reina madre de sus cuatro hijos de los cuales dos ya son mayores de edad y trabajan, mientras sus pequeños gemelos de 13 años de edad aun siguen estudiando. Luis posee su negocio  donde elabora cocinas industriales, asadoras, estructuras metales entre otros; de igual manera elabora variedad de muebles y puertas en madera; el crédito que solicita Luis es para la compra de hierro y cedro que le ayudara a aumentar el inventario de sus productos.

loans.use: Compra de hierro y cedro

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther A. lives in Gudele, next to the market. She is 30 years old and is married to a secondary teacher who teaches in Supiri secondary school. They have seven children who all go to school. Esther has been retailing for almost two years, selling clothes and shoes at the market. She is requesting a loan in order for her to purchase and stock sandals to sell together with her shoes and clothes for better profits. In the future, the extra profits from her loan will be used for paying school fees for her children and to support them by buying them clothes this year for Christmas. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase and stock sandals to sell

loans.name: Adeshola

texts.en: Adeshola, 27 years old and single, sells hair extensions and hair cream in her shop to make a living.  She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more hair extensions and hair cream to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and hair cream to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Phy Meng Village Bank Loan Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consisting of 16 people is located I. Sdau Aem Village I. Takeo Province, and all the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Phy M., the village bank president, is a farmer who owns 0.8-hectare of land upon which she cultivates rice. She also owns a small thriving grocery store which she wants to expand by purchasing more grocery products to re-sell. Her husband, Mr. Soeung Sophun, is a policeman. Mrs. Phy M. is 34 years old and the mother of two children who are yet too young to study.

Three members I. this group loan have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly-payment loans. The former are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s maI. product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor, allowing them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products to re-sell.

loans.name: George Boro

texts.en:
George Boro is 27 and married with one child, Benson K., who is three years old and in nursery school. George operates his milk-selling business with his brother, Peter Njoroge.

George has been selling milk for eight years and works in an area where milk and meat are staple foods, therefore ensuring a huge customer base. He is requesting his first loan in order to purchase a motorbike to make transporting milk easier, and with the extra profits generated from this investment he intends to start rearing pigs.

George, who was introduced to KADET through existing members, is hardworking and dreams of purchasing a plot of land in a prime area to build rental houses.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to make transporting milk easier.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. She makes a living selling foodstuffs in her shop. Charity has been selling foodstuffs for over 12 years. This business is the source of her income. Charity is 40 years old and married with 5 children. Charity hopes for the loan amount of N50, 000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Zenub

texts.en:
Zenub Tenza,, a 30-year-old woman living in Gudele town downside of Gudele Primary School, has three children who are all attending Gudele Primary School and is married to a peasant. Zenub has had a business selling charcoal since last year and is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders to allow her to stock more charcoal in her store to sell.

With the extra profits accruing from her loan, she intends to educate her children by sending them to school and paying their fees until they compete post-secondary levels of education.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more charcoal in the store

loans.name: Adalat

texts.en:
This young man, Adalat, was born in 1970. He is married, has two children. He has been working in his beauty salon for fifteen years.

Now Adalat needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy the necessary things for improving his beauty salon.

loans.use: To buy the necessary things for improving his beaty salon

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en: Veronicah M. is the 42-year-old single mother of two children. She lives in Shanzu, Mombasa where she runs a restaurant and she has been in the business for fourteen years. Veronicah was introduced to KADET by an existing client and this is her first loan. She intends to repair her restaurant and purchase more stock for her business. Her main customers are tourists who come to the beach in Mombassa and residents of Shanzu. In the future Veronicah hopes to establish another restaurant in Shanzu to maximize her income. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To repair her restaurant and to increase her stock

loans.name: Chann

texts.en:
Mrs. Chann M. is 56 years old and lives in the rural area of Kompong Tom Province. She has six children who are still living with her in the family home, and who are working in different occupations.

Chann M. and her husband earn a living as charcoal sellers. The family owns a brick-oven next to their house where they make charcoal for sale. They always go to buy small pieces of carving wood from the forest people and burn them into charcoal at their house.

Chann M. said that her daily living conditions are not so good because she always faces a problem where the roof of her house is cracking frequently. She is therefore requesting a loan to replace the broken parts.

loans.use: To replace the broken parts of her roof

loans.name: George Thuita

texts.en:
George is married and has a business partner.

George's loan is an asset loan and he has no loans from other MFI's. He was introduced to KADET by other KADET members.

He plans to use the loan to buy another motorcycle which he uses to transport people. His aim is to use the extra revenue generated from this loan to purchase a plot of land so he can build rental houses.

George believes that he is hardworking and his hopes and dreams are to support his siblings so that they can be self reliant and uplift their living standards.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: The client will use the loan to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Bose

texts.en:
Bose is the mother of a child and she is 29 years old. She has two years experience in her tailor shop where she also sells clothes and tailoring materials.

Bose is requesting the loan of N50,000 to purchase more clothes and tailoring materials to sell. She hopes to improve her quality of life and to remodel her tailor shop so that it looks nicer. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Beatrice Jemeli

texts.en:
Beatrice Jemeli is 38 years old and is blessed with one child. She has a salon which is located within West Market in Eldoret Town.

Beatrice has been in the salon business for the past three years now. Her clients are both adults and children who are residents of Eldoret and its outskirts.

Beatrice was introduced to KADET by a group member and she intends to use the loan from KADET buy more stock for her salon. In the future, she aims to expand her business, open a clothing store, and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her salon

loans.name: Rosemary Chepkesis

texts.en:
Rosemary Chepkesis is 53 years old and married to Sammy N.Naibei.They are blessed with two children.Her clothing business is located in the Town Centre of Eldoret Town.

She has been in the Clothing business for the past two years now. Rosemary heard of KADET through an advertisement and with the loan, she intends to buy more clothing for her store including clothes,blankets and sweaters .In the future she intends to venture into other businesses.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To buy more stock which includes clothing for both adult and children.

loans.name: Mrs. Thy Saem Group Loan

texts.en:
Mrs. Thy S. is the group leader of a six-member group who all live in Chrouy Slaeng village in Takeo province.

Mrs. Thy S. is 35 years old and the mother of five children, one of whom is a fruit seller, another three are enrolled in the local school, while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Em Somaly, is a construction worker.

Mrs. Thy S. is a fruit middle woman (wholesaler). Aside from this business, she also raises pigs. Since both of her businesses are doing well, she wants to expand them by purchasing more fruits to sell and piglets to raise. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family’s living conditions with this loan. 


All the members in this group loan have end-of-term (EoT) loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loans term. EoT loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. EoT loans allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to sell and more piglets to raise

loans.name: Mrs. Phorp Norng Group Loan

texts.en:
Mrs. Phorp N. is a group leader of five who all live in the village of Daeum Rumdael in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Gnuoy Se, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. Although this couple tries to work hard, they still make only a small income to support the family. Now Mrs. Phorp N. has decided to ask for a loan to buy two piglets and pig food. She will use the rest of money to buy zinc for her house.

All the people in this group loan are asking for end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: Piglets, pig food, and home repair

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan V. is a twenty-five year old married man. He currently lives with two young children who are not enrolled in school. He typically generates his daily income by burning charcoal for sale, while his wife stays at home to manage the daily work and care for the children.

Chan V. also owns and uses his trailer-motor to pick up charcoal to sell directly at his customer’s homes along the road around his community. Chan V. has been buying housing material for a long time in order to build a new house but still doesn't have enough to start the construction. Therefore, he will be using his loan to buy additional housing materials to begin building house.

loans.use: To buy material to build a house

loans.name: Sreymao

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreymao Y., 40, and her husband, Mr. Lim Tang, 41, live along National Road Number five about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City, and were married in 1985. They have six children: one son who is married and lives in separate house, three daughters who work in a garment factory, and two daughters who stay at home.

Sreymao and her husband have been selling bricks they make in a kiln for five years. She now wants to create a new business selling fruits, so she is a asking for a loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike and a trailer for carrying fruits to sell.

loans.use: For a motorbike and a trailer to carry fruits

loans.name: Christine Chemaswa

texts.en:
Christine is 45 years old .She is married to Jobin Kiliswa and they are blessed with six children. Her clothing business is located in Eldoret Town and her major clients are professionals working in Eldoret Town.

She has been in this business for the past year and was introduced to KADET by another KADET client.With the loan, she intends to purchase more stock such as trousers, blankets and sweaters. Her dream is to expand her business.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To add more stock which includes trousers,blankets and sweaters.

loans.name: Ifeoma

texts.en: Ifeoma sells clothes, shoes, bags and under wears in her shop. She is successful in her business because she is known for her good business and competitive prices. Ifeoma is 27 years old and married with a child. Ifeoma hopes for the loan amount of N50, 000 to purchase more clothes and under wears to sell. She is grateful to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and under wears to sell

loans.name: Oun

texts.en: Mrs. Oun K. lives in Doem Pour village in Takeo province. She grasses to sell. Her husband, Mr. Hang Meng, is a fisherman. Since his fishing going well, he wants to expand it purchasing boat and machine to connect the boat for fishing. Thus, Mrs. Oun K. is decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She is 46 years old and the mother of two children who are farmers who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan for boat and machine to connect the boat for fishing.

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Mrs. Im T. and her husband have been married since 1987. They have two sons and two daughters. One of their sons is radio repairer, one daughter is a garment factory worker and other attends school. The family lives approximately 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

The couple has been farming more than 20 years. They grow vegetables and other kinds of crops on their farmland in the village and sell their products to a middleman who comes to their house. Im doesn't have enough capital to farm, so she is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase oxen to plow her farmland.

loans.use: To buy oxen

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Lorn S. is a villager in Ro Neam Thnaut village in Takeo province. She owns a general store. Her husband, Mr. Touk Phorn, is a rice middleman. Now Mrs. Lorn S. is requesting a loan to buy piglets and pig food for a pig breeding business.

She is 43 years old and the mother of five children, one of whom is a motorbike taxi driver while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: For piglets and pig food

loans.name: Aun

texts.en: Mrs. Aun M. was born in 1967 and she now lives in Bam village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because her field is infertile and it is far away from any irrigation system. In order to deal with this problem, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and a machine to pump water. This will support her efforts to increase crop production. Her husband, Mr. Paen Klou, is a machine repairer. This couple has six children, one of whom helps the parents work while the others four are enrolled in the local school. Their youngest child is still too young to work or study.  Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and a pump machine.

loans.name: Phlorng

texts.en: Phlorng M. is 51-year-old widowed woman. She is the mother of two children who are married but still live with her. She currently sells Khmer noodle for breakfast to her neighbors in the village. One of her daughters is making wooden furniture for a profit. She provides income to better meet the family’s financial crisis. Phlorng M.’s daughter purposes to build a new house in order to live independently. Her savings is not yet enough to begin building. Hence, Phlorng M. has decided to seek a loan from HKL that will be used to add to her daughter’s personal money to build a new wooden house on her own plot of land.

loans.use: To build a new wooden house on her own plot of land.

loans.name: Savorn

texts.en: Mrs. Savorn K. is a villager in Bam village in Takeo province. She is a Khmer cake seller. Her husband, Mr. Ou Uk, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, he is a construction worker. Now Mrs. Savorn K. needs a loan to add to her saving to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and to improve the family’s living conditions with this loan. She is 27 years old and the mother of two children. One child is attending the local school while the other is still too young to work or study. Her husband is shown in the photo, on the right.

loans.use: To add to her savings to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Ebere

texts.en: Ebere sells rechargeable phones and phones accessories to make a living. This business needs a greater variety of merchandise. Ebere does not have the money to invest. That is why she is asking for a loan to be able to stock her shop. Ebere is 31 years old and married with a child. Ebere hopes for the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more rechargeable phones and accessories to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phones and accessories to sell

loans.name: So Khou

texts.en: Mrs. So Khou N. lives in Phnum Lorn Tes village in Takeo province. She is a duck breeder who also collects the duck eggs to sell. Since her poultry business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing 160 more ducks for breeding, to earn income. Her husband, Mr. Prum Lean, is a farmer who owns a piece of land for cultivating rice. Mrs. So Khou N. is 49 years old and the mother of six children. One of her children is employed in a Casino Club while another is an electrician. The other children are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy 160 more ducks for breeding to earn income.

loans.name: Savy

texts.en: Mrs. Savy T. is a farmer in Doem Pour village in Takeo province. In her plantation, she faces an obstacle because her field is infertile and is affecting her crops. In order to deal with this problem, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to improve the field and to increase crop production. Her husband, Mr. Seang Rotha, is a construction worker. Mrs. Savy T. is 35 years old and the mother of five children. Two of her children are farmers while the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support the field to increase crop production.

loans.name: Srey Pov

texts.en: Mrs. Srey Pov Y. lives in Prey Kvav village in Takeo province. She owns a grocery store. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more grocery products to re-sell, to earn more income. Her husband, Mr. Kum Nub, is a security guard. Mrs. Srey Pov Y. is a 37-year-old mother of two children who are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is also presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products to re-sell to earn more income.

loans.name: Khum

texts.en: The two people shown in the picture are Mr. S. and his wife. They have one young child who is still not enrolled in school. The young couple earns a living by making furniture for sale. S. says that he currently faces difficulty transporting his finished products to sell because he doesn’t have a vehicle. He has decided to ask for a loan of US$1000 to purchase a trailer-motor in order to supply his business. In addition, he proposes to use this trailer to provide a taxi service. He dreams of opening a small shop to provide a tailoring service and he feels that this loan will bring his dream closer.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer-motor in order to transport his products to sell.

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en: Mrs. Sophy N. is a villager in Trapaing Khlout village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate both rice and corns. Now she has a problem because she does not have enough money to support her corn growing. Thus, she needs a loan to buy corn seeds and pesticides to support the corn field. Her husband, Mr. Muong Saroeun, transport the coconuts to sell. Mrs. Sophy N. is 30 years old and the mother of four children who are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is also shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy corn seeds and pesticides to support the corn field.

loans.name: Yoeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Yoeurn H. lives in Ank Kor Ky village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn for living. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to support the rice field. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and she would use the rest of money to buy piglets and pig food for breeding. She hopes to increase income and improve the family living conditions with this loan. Mrs. Yoeurn H. is 55 years old widow with five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while another is a construction worker and the others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and she would use the rest of money to buy piglets and pig food for breeding.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Mrs. Visitacion S. is a 70-year-old widow from Brgy. Tagda, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She has 3 adult children, all of whom are now professionals, thanks to her own efforts and the help of NWTF-Project Dungganon.

Mrs. S. became a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon Himamaylan Branch in 1998. She used her first loan to expand her "Sari-sari" or General Store. Later, she operated a coffee shop to increase her income capacity, using loans to fund her business expansion. When her husband died, she had to try harder to earn more to support her family. It was at that time that she started her food vending business by selling cooked food during lunch time and snacks.   

This is now her 13th loan from NWTF- Project Dungganon and she is borrowing PHP 10,000 to add to her revolving working capital for her food vending business.

Visitaction is not planning to retire any time soon. She is determined that, for as long as she is able, she will stay independent and earn her own living, and not be a burden to her children.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital for Food vending

loans.name: Kimsan

texts.en:
Mr. Kimsan O., age 27, and his wife, Mrs. Sreyneang Theng, age 22, live a long National Road Number six about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 2006 and have a one year old son. 

Kimsan has been a driver for over ten years. He drives for a brick link in his village. His wife stays at home to take care of their son. He hopes to build his own house to live because currently he and his wife rent a house to stay. So, Kimsan is applying for a loan of $700 in order to purchase wooden materials to make the building.

loans.use: To purchase wooden materials to build his own house for living.

loans.name: Chroeb

texts.en: Mrs. Chroeb H. is 32 years old and she lives in Ank Kor Ky village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables to earn for living. In her plantation, she needs a loan to buy fertilizer and to hire laborers to work on the rice field. Her husband, Mr. Kong Sokha, is a construction worker. Her husband is on the the left of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and to hire laborers to work on the rice field.

loans.name: Chhong

texts.en: Chhong P. is 31 years old and has been selling fresh fish in the local busy market for nearby nine years. She sells fish that she buys from wholesale suppliers and other fishermen. She is married to Touch Phon, 39. He helps her in selling fish. In the past, Chhong P. always hired a taxi motor in order to supply her business operation, since she doesn’t have her own vehicle for these purposes. She hopes to buy a motorbike by using her first loan from Kiva. The new motor will allow her to pick up fresh fish quickly and to bring them to the market for selling. Note: Chhong P.'s husband appears in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for business transport.

loans.name: Nkechi

texts.en:
Nkechi is the mother of nine and she is 41 years old. She has a poultry farm where she rears birds and also sells eggs.

Nkechi hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more poultry and poultry feed. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry and poultry feed

loans.name: Mrs. Eng Nil Group Loan

texts.en: Mrs. Eng N. is a group leader of four members who all live in Prey Chheu Teal village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Since her breeding pigs business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets for breeding to earn more income. Her husband, Mr. Nol Thoeurng, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, he is a traditional musician who has been by the villagers to play on the wedding ceremony, party, and so on.  Mrs. Eng N. has a child who is a worker in Thailand border.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding to earn more income.

loans.name: Johnna

texts.en:
Mrs. Johnna S. is from Puntas, Brgy. Tagda, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She is 39 years old, married with 4 school-aged children.

Aurillo, her husband, is a contractual worker, which is not a stable source of income. So early on they both decided that Johnna should have a business to supplement her husband's salary, and they saved enough capital to start a business selling salted dried fish. With the help of NWTF-Project Dungganon over the last 9 years, Johnna's business has flourished and has been able to support their young family, even with school-age kids.

Now on her 12th loan cycle, Johnna is proposing to borrow the amount of PHP 28,000 to add more capital to her dried fish business. She plans to use her profits to have their house repaired, buy appliances for their home to make life a bit more comfortable for her family, and to save up for the education of her children.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional Capital for her Dried Fish Business

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Mrs. Lay N. is a villager in Doem Pour village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land where she cultivates rice. In this plantation, she faces a problem because she does not have enough money to hire labor with two oxen to plow the field and to buy fertilizer to support the field to make the crop more productive.

She is a widow with three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other is attending the local school.

loans.use: To hire two oxen to plow the field and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Krim

texts.en:
Krim H. currently makes rattan furniture. She is 50 years old and a resident of Kompong Tom province, located about 200 km from the capital, Phnom Penh. She is a single mother wH. has seven children: five are married and the remainder are single. Most of her children work with her making rattan.

Krim H. saves up more than 10 sets of rattan and then sells them to her customers for a profit. Generally, her valued customers need to order a few days or a week in advance. To earn extra income, Krim H. is requesting a loan of US$ 600 to order beds from other furniture makers to sell at a profit; with the rest of the loan she will buy more raw materials for making furniture. She and her daughter are pictured here.

loans.use: To order beds from other furniture makers to sell at a profit

loans.name: Mrs. Met Hort Group Loan

texts.en:
Mrs. Met H. is the group leader for four members who all live in Konlaeng Kha village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land where she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Chhenh Thoeun, is a basket middleman. Since his business is doing well, he wants to expand it by purchasing more baskets to resell to earn more income to support the family. Mrs. Met H. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She is a 25-year-old mother of two children who are too young to work or study.

One member in this group loan has an end-of-term loan and the rest have monthly payment loans. EoT borrowers are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more baskets to resell

loans.name: Theary

texts.en:
Mrs. Theary K., 38, and her husband, Mr. Borun Uk, 45, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They married in 1988 and have four children. Of their three sons, one of them has full-time employment, and another one studies in the local school. One daughter is a garment factory worker.

Theary has been a silk weaver for 23 years, a skill she learned from her parents. She sells finished products to a middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market. Her husband has been growing rice for 27 years.

Theary is asking for a first loan of US$ 200 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mrs. Mary Jane N. is 42 years old, married with six children and a resident of Brgy, Tagda, in Hinigaran Negros Occidental. Mary Jane is a fish vendor, a suitable trade as she lives near the sea and has easy access to the local fisher folk's catch. Working in partnership with her husband, Cenon, she is determined to raise her six children well and provide all of them with a good future.

In 1998 she joined NWTF—Project Dungganon to have access to additional capital for her fish-vending business. She later used her loans and savings to build her own fishing boat, and the resulting profits from this move come to approximately PHP 10,000 per month, just enough to support the needs of her family. She now plans to use the PHP 19,000 loan from NWTF—Project Dungganon, her thirteenth consecutive loan from this MFI, as revolving working capital for her fish-vending business.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through its alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a dollar a day to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live lives that they can finally call honorable ones. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: For additional capital for fish-vending trade

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is 40 years old and married with three children. She sells medicines and bottles of wine in her shop. This business is her source of income. Helen is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more medicines and bottles of wine to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines and bottles of wine to sell

loans.name: Yan

texts.en:
Mrs. Yan M., 52, and her husband, Mr. Toem Chab, 60, live on an Island in Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married in 1977 and have eight children: four sons and four daughters. Four of them were married and live out side the family home. 
 
Yan has been selling grocery for 20 years. She buys grocery items from Phnom Penh market for resale in her village. Her husband is a farmer. Yan is asking for a loan of $1,000 in order to purchase motorized hand tiller for her husband to farm.
