loans.use: To purchase motorized hand tiller.

loans.name: Khin

texts.en: Mr. Khin K. is 38 years old and married with three children, one of whom works in construction. Khin K. is a rattan furniture vendor. He sells furniture products that he orders from a wholesale supplier who lives near his village home. His wife (shown in the photo above) stays at home to care for the children and look after the house, and she also makes rattan cupboards for a profit. Khin K. is looking for a loan to increase his business capital; he will buy more furniture to sell and will use the remainder of the loan to purchase raw materials for his wife to make cupboards. This will provide the family with extra income.

loans.use: To buy more furniture to sell

loans.name: Aleksandr

texts.en: Aleksandr was born in 1969. He is married, has 2 children and lives in Baku city. 20 years ago he started building houses. Now  he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy the necessary materials for building houses for improving his business.

loans.use: to buy the necessary materials for building houses

loans.name: Panha Pork’S Group

texts.en:
Miss Panha P. selected to be a group leader by members for a loan from Maxima. In the group there are two families including hers. The entire group members are living on an Island in Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

1-Miss. Panha P., 28, is single, lives with her widowed mother. She has been a garment factory worker for 11 years. Some parts of her house break down and she wants to repair it, but Panha doesn’t have money. That’s why she is requesting a loan of $400 to in order to make the repairs.

2-Mrs. Kimhour K., 48, is widow with five children: three sons and two daughters. One of them was married and lives outside the family home. One daughter is a garment factory worker and one son is a blacksmith. 

Kimhour has been a farmer for twenty years. She lacks capital to use for her farming business, so she is requesting a loan of $400 in order to help her business.

loans.use: To use for repairing house and to farm.

loans.name: Toem

texts.en: T. is a 29-year-old married woman and mother of four children. She lives with her family in her own small family home in Kompong Tom Province. T. owns a piece of land that she inherited from her grandmother. She grows different kinds of crops on her land, such as potatoes that she will collect and sell to buyers when the plants mature every three months. T.'s husband is a firewood seller. T.'s crop is not growing well because she lacks a supply of fertilizer. She is requesting a loan to buy three sacks of fertilizer to increase her crop yield.

loans.use: To buy three sacks of fertilizer to increase her crop yield

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia sells used plastic. She works from 8am to 6pm, seven days-a-week. She hopes to borrow N150, 000 to purchase more used plastic to sell. She is 39 years-old and married with no children. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more used plastic to sell

loans.name: Seab

texts.en:
Mrs. Seab S., 45, and her husband, Mr. Vannak Roeung, 46, were married in 1990 and have four daughters, two of them attend school and other two assist their mother in silk weaving business. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Seab is a silk weaver, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village who then in turns it to sell at market in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a soldier. Seab is requesting her second loan of $1,100 to purchase silk materials for continuing her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for continuing her weaving business.

loans.name: Sipha

texts.en:
Miss. Sipha O., 43, is single, lives with her mother and sister on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City, the capital city of Cambodia.

Sipha has been a silk weaver since she was 15 years old, having skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village who then take s it to sell at market in Phnom Penh. Sipha is requesting a loan of $150 to purchase silk materials fO. her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Olajumoke

texts.en: Olajumoke is business oriented and she sells foodstuffs in retail. She is 35 years old and married with 5 children. She hopes for the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs

loans.name: Ilgar

texts.en: Ilgar is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Azerbaijan Fuzuli region, and he is now settled in Absheron region. Ilgar was born in 1963, and he is married with three children. He started his taxi business 14 years ago. Now he is requesting a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy spare parts to improve his taxi.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his taxi

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is 34 years old and married with two children. She has a retail business selling second-hand clothes. Her business needs a greater variety of merchandise as her customers are asking her to sell more clothes. This is why she is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to stock her business. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Kifayat

texts.en: Kifayat is single and was born in 1955. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Azerbaijan Kalbadjar region, and is now settled in Khirdalan town. For ten years Kifayat has had a general store business. Now she is requesting a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy goods to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah lives in Lagos State, Nigeria, and is 36 years old and married without children. She sells textbooks and notebooks from her home. Deborah is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more textbooks and notebooks to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more textbooks and notebooks to sell

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
BilA. is 29 years old and lives in Saida, southern Lebanon. He works as a home painter and is successful in his work because he does a nice, clean job. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others, and he also works on projects with interior designers. When BilA. first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. He set up the business because he learned it when he was young and he wanted to work as an interior designer.

BilA. has requested a loan of $2,000 USD from Kiva partner, A. Majmoua, in order to purchase a second-hand car for his work. This is his second loan cycle and he has always paid on time. In the future, BilA. plans on expanding his business by making himself know in other regions.

loans.use: To purchase a second-hand car for his work

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 49-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and four children. He has owned a pick-up and a grocery store for 13 years, and is successful because he is hard-working. His clients are family members, friends and neighbors. Ahmad set up his businesses because he wanted to improve his family’s income. When he first started out, he didn’t have a lot of cash.

Ahmad has requested a loan of $2,500 USD from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase merchandise for his store and do some maintenance work on his pick-up. This is his third loan cycle and he has always paid on time. In the future, Ahmad plans on expanding his businesses.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store and do some maintenance work on his pick-up

loans.name: Arif

texts.en:
"Thank you very much Kiva! Good luck Kiva!"

Arif is applying for his second Kiva loan. He has improved his business and started a taxi business. Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy spare parts to improve his taxi business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his taxi

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 45-year old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and nine children. Ibrahim has been working as a car painter and repairer for the last twenty-five years. Ibrahim is asking for a loan of $ 1000 US from Kiva partner A. Majmoua in order to purchase an air compressor. This would be his second loan cycle and he has always paid on time.

Ibrahim is good at his work because he knows how to treat clients and does a good job. His clients are friends, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties save that he didn’t have all the required tools. Ibrahim decided to do this business because he learned it when he was young. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase an air compressor

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en:
Rabih is 31 years old and lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and two children. He has been working as a successful furniture painter for eleven years. His clients are friends, neighbors and other craftsmen such as carpenters, designers, etc. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Rabih set up his business because he learned it when he was young, and he also wanted to increase his family’s income.

Rabih has requested a loan of $1,300 USD from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase tools for his work. This is his fourth loan cycle and he has always paid on time. In the future, he plans on opening his own shop and purchasing new tools.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his furniture-painting work

loans.name: Rafail

texts.en: Rafail has a business selling metal. He is applying to Kiva for his second loan, and is requesting 2,000 AZN to buy metals and other necessary items to improve his business. Rafail is very thankful to Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: To buy metals and other necessary items for his metal sales business

loans.name: Souzan

texts.en:
Souzan is a 38 year old woman who lives in Beirut, capital of Lebanon with her husband and their child. Souzan has owned a grocery store since 2006. She requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store. This is her third cycle and she has always paid on time. 
Her previous loans helped her improve her store by diversifying her merchandise. Souzan is special in her work because her store is well positioned; it is in front of a school and on a main street. Her clients are people from her friends, neighbors, students and passer-bys. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. Souzan decided on doing her business because she wanted to supplement her family’s income. In the future, she plans on improving her store.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Mhammad

texts.en:
Mhammad is 26 years old and lives in Beirut, the Lebanese capital. He has been working as a car electrician for five years. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Mhammad first started his business, he had financial issues, especially because he was used to being an employee. He set up his business because he learned it when he was young.

Mhammad has requested a loan of $2,000 USD from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase parts for his work such as car batteries, car accessories, car radios, alarms and wipers. This is his second loan cycle and he has always paid on time. Mhammad's previous loans helped him improve his business. In the future, he plans on improving his store.

loans.use: To purchase parts for his work

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 50 year old man who lives in Beirut, capital of Lebanon with his wife and their five children. Ali has been selling accessories for four years. He sells perfumes, home decoration, home products, toys etc.... He requested a loan of 1500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan. 
Ali is special in his work because of his good reputation. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Ali first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. He decided on doing his business because he likes his work. In the future, he plans on expanding his work.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en:
Mouhamad is a 19-year-old man who lives in Beirut, capital of Lebanon. Mouhamad has owned a bakery for two years. He uses a “saj” oven to make bread and “mankoucheh”. A “saj” is a metal oven, a traditional Lebanese cooking dome, used to make Markouk (“thinned”) bread and doughy confections or Mankoucheh. A mankoucheh looks like a folded pizza, most common toppings are zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat it anytime of the day, but somehow it tastes better in the morning. 

Mouhamad requests a loan of $1,500 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase raw material for his bakery. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan. Mouhamad is works hard to treat his clients well and to make good mankoucheh. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he rented a bakery, but now he has his own. He developed this business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase raw material for his bakery.

loans.name: Respekte Lavi Grandbassin Group

texts.en:
The “Respekte Lavi” or Respect Life group of Grand Basin is made of twenty male and female entrepreneurs. These businessmen and businesswomen are excited to grow their businesses with the help of their first loan from Esperanza. The group has a range of wide range of businesses including charcoal production and sales, used clothing, and a variety of food sales. 

Souverain A. is one of four representatives of the group. She is married and has three children. Souverain works with her husband selling charcoal. He buys or chops down the trees and makes the charcoal by a process using dirt, leaves, and the semi burning of the wood. From her home, she sells both bulk and smaller amounts of charcoal. She also sells in the local markets. She is looking forward to being able to accomplish more things for herself and family. 

She prays for the growth of Esperanza and that she may grow with the organization. On behalf of Souverain, Respekte Lavi of Grand Basin, and Esperanza we thank you for your support. The loan will be distributed amongst the members of the group.

loans.use: To purchase materials for members' businesses, including making charcoal

loans.name: Las Grandiosas 5 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of the group Las Grandiosas based in Los Alcarrizos, an industrial town north of Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic where both water (none of which is potable) and electricity services are unreliable at best. Here she lives in a modest home of concrete blocks and a tin roof with her husband and four young children. 

With this loan Maria intends to purchase higher quality jewelry, such as earrings and necklaces, to sell in a shop she owns near her home. With the higher profits she expects to turn, she intends to invest first in her children's education by providing the necessary school supplies for them to attend school. her long term goal is to continue investing in the quality of her merchandise to gain higher and higher profits which she will in turn invest in her children. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Jewelry to sell in her shop

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is divorced with two children. She sells vegetables at an open market in Ivano-Frankovsk town. Lilia co-owns this business with a friend of hers. They work in shifts to be able to extend the workday and increase their sales.

Lilia has been in this business for five years. During this time she has earned her clients' loyalty and respect The business enables Lilia to have a stable income and take care of her children. Lilia requests a loan of $775 to purchase seasonal produce that is high in demand. Offering more produce for sale will increase her income and help care for her family.

loans.use: To increase assortment of produc

loans.name: Mbathio

texts.fr: Mbathio D. est une vendeuse de chaussures de tissus et autre articles pour femmes. Elle  fait ce métier depuis plus de cinq (5) années.les revenus tirés de son activité lui permettent d’aider son mari dans l’entretien du ménage. Avec le prêt qu’elle sollicité elle compte renforcer son activité  par l’achat de plus de marchandise en vu de préparer les fêtes de korité. Elle a démarré son commerce avec un premier prêt obtenu de L’U IMCEC.

loans.use: achat de marchandises

loans.name: Nuevo Por Venir Group

texts.en:
Joselin O. is currently participating in her second cycle as an associate of Esperanza International. She lives with her husband and four young children in Boca Chica, an area in the Southeast of the Dominican Republic where running water and electricity are often unreliable. She has begun a small business selling clothes and medicine which she operates from her wooden house.

With this loan, Joselin will buy more blouses, pants, and underwear to sell to her customers. Currently she has to supplement her business with outside work, and she hopes to one day be able to make enough money to quit her other job and be her own boss. With the money she'll gain from increasing her business, she hopes to put her children in high school, improve the family's nutrition, and one day create a bigger and more comfortable house. She has truly enjoyed working with Esperanza International and greatly appreciates your support.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for reselling

loans.name: Ameth

texts.fr: Ameth D. enseignent de son état s’active dans l’élevage de la volaille .Il a aménagé dans sa maison une poulaille   où il élève des poulets destinés à la vente. Cette activité annexe qu’il exerce depuis trois (3) ans lui permet de gagner des revenus supplémentaires  pour payer les frais de scolarités de ses enfants  mais aussi certaines dépenses de son ménage. Le poulet est très demandé pendant la fin du mois de ramandan et les fêtes de fin d’année  pour faire face à cette forte demande Monsieur D. sollicite un prêt  a fin de renforcer des capacités de production
texts.en:
Ameth D. teaches and engages in poultry farming. He created a hen coop within his house where he breeds chicken for sale.This side business that he's been doing for three (3) years enables him to make additional income in order to pay for school fees of his children and also for some expenses of the house. The chicken is in high demand during the end of ramadan and end of year festivities. In order to meet this high demand Mr. D. requests a loan in order to strengthen his capacity for production.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chicken

loans.name: Vida Group

texts.en:
Sira M. is an associate of Esperanza International living in Boca Chica, Dominican Republic. She lives in a cement house with her husband and six children and has access to occasional running water and electricity. From her hom, she runs a small restaurant that sells juice and typical Dominican cuisine.

Currently her eldest daughter runs the restaurant while she works in a nearby hotel in order to make ends meet. With the loan she will buy a toaster, a blender, and more stock supplies (sugar, rice, beans) to be able to produce more food and earn more money. She is hoping to expand her business enough for it to become her primary source of income, which will allow her to be her own boss and finish her roof. She hopes that this money will help her children get a better education. Sira also aspires to one day be a loan officer with Esperanza. She is very grateful for all of your support.

Sira is part of a loan group, and this loan will be distributed amongst the members.

loans.use: To support member business which include purchasing foodstock for a restaurant

loans.name: América Esperanza Ascensión

texts.es: América Esperanza Ascensión C. D. S.  D. 45 años D. edad resiD. en el municipio D. Cojutepeque en el departamento D. Cuscatlán. América  no tuvo la oportunidad D. prepararse académicamente curso hasta básica en la escuela, razón por la cual sus oportunidades profesionales se acortaron, pero desD. hace veintidós años ella ha logrado mantener su negocio el cual es, el único medio D. ingresos para su subsistencia. América posee una venta D. verduras y diferentes granos básicos; el destino del crédito que solicita América será utiliza para surtir su local con productos como cereales, frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
América Esperanza Ascensión C. D. S. is 45 years old and lives in the town of Cojutepeque in the department of Cucatlán. América did not have the opportunity to educate herself beyond primary school and for that reason her professional opportunities were limited. For the last twenty-two years, she has successfully run her own business, her sole means of support. América sells vegetables and basic staples. She will use the loan to purchase products like grains, fruits and vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Mirna Angélica

texts.es: Mirna Angélica R. C. reside en Rosario de La Paz municipio del departamento de La Paz. Mirna posee tan solo 25 años vive con su único hija Carolina de 5 años de edad y su madre Doña Tomasa. Mirna hace todo lo posible por brindarla lo mejor a su pequeña hija que depende ella, actualmente Mirna posee una tienda, una venta de antojitos y bebidas. Ahora ella solicita de un crédito para destino de inversión en sus negocios, surtirá su tienda y también para comprar insumos para la elaboración de los antojitos que prepara diariamente.

loans.use: Surtir su negocio

loans.name: Víctor Alfonso

texts.es: Víctor Alfonso Q. M., reside en el municipio de Tacuba en el departamento de Ahuachapán. Con 44 años de edad Víctor se encuentra felizmente casado con Doña Inés quien le ha dado tres hermosas niñas  Jaqueline de 11 años, Karla de 10 años y la pequeñita Karen de 3 años de edad. Víctor es un padre ejemplar en su hogar  con su humilde negocio ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia estos años, el se dedica a la venta de minutas; se transporta con su carretón donde lleva el hielo y sus esencias saborizadas de frutas, caminando por varias colonias de su puebla y sonando la campanita que anuncia su llegado donde varios de sus clientes lo están esperando. Víctor ahora solicita un crédito para surtir su carretita de más sabores para sus minutas y también para otros insumos que le implica su negocio.
texts.en:
Víctor Alfonso Q. M. lives in the town of Tacuba in the department of Ahuachapán. Víctor is 44 years old and is happily married to Doña Inés who has given him three beautiful daughters. Jaqueline is 11, Karla is 10 and the little one Karen is 3 years old. Víctor is an excellent father. With his small business, he has been able to improve his family's standard of living. He sells slushy frozen drinks from a cart which carries the ice and the fruit flavors, walking around different neighborhoods and ringing the little bell that announces his arrival to his waiting customers. Víctor is now requesting a loan to purchase more slushy flavors and other supplies for his business.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Sandra Arely

texts.es: Sandra Arely M. reside en Ilopango municipio del departamento de San Salvador.  Sandra tiene 41 años de edad, vive con su esposo quien es empleado y posee un sueldo de $200.00 US mensuales con los cuales aporta a su familia, también vive con ellos sus dos hijos uno ya es mayor de edad y trabaja; mientras el más pequeño Jairo de 16 años se encuentra estudiando el bachillerato. Sandra posee diez años de experiencia en su negocio es un taller de costura para la elaboración de ropa a la medida, sus ingresos obtenidos a través de su negocio son utilizados para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar;  y es por eso que ahora Sandra pretende por medio de un crédito incrementar su producción de ropa para obtener mayores ganancias, con este crédito Sandra comprara materia prima como tela, hilos, botones, para la confección de ropa.
texts.en:
Sandra Arely M. lives in the town of Ilopango in the department of San Salvador. Sandra is 41 years old and lives with her husband who has a job and earns a monthly salary of US$200 which helps the family get by. Their two children also live with them. The eldest is an adult and has a job while the youngest, Jairo, is 16 and is in high school. Sandra has ten years of experience with her custom tailoring business. The income she earns from the business goes towards helping her husband with their household expenses. That is why Sandra would like a loan that would allow her to increase her clothing output and to get higher profits. With the loan, Sandra will buy supplies such as cloth, thread and buttons to use in the making of clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies to make clothing

loans.name: Rosas 1 Group

texts.en:
Ramona is the group coordinator of the group Las Rosas (the roses). The group is based in Los Alcarrizos, an industrial town north of Santo Domingo, where running water and electricity utilities are unreliable at best. It is here that she makes her home with her husband and four children in a simple structure comprised of wooden walls and a tin roof, a home she owns but to which she does not have the title.

With this loan, Ramona intends to continue expanding her business of selling shoes door to door to various customers in her neighborhood. She has over two years' experience in this business and will use her loan to purchase large quantities of merchandise at better prices. With the profits her business provides, Ramona intends to invest in school supplies for her children and continue investing in her business. Her long-term dream is that her children grow up to be important members of her community. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase large quantities of shoes at a better price

loans.name: Yesenia Elizabeth

texts.es: Yesenia Elizabeth R. M. reside en Ilopango municipio del departamento de San Salvador.  Yesenia tiene 24 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus padres. Yessenia se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, posee una pequeña vitrina en su casa donde tiene su inventario en productos;  también sale a vender de manera ambulante en varias colonias. El crédito que Yesenia solicita es para comprar productos de belleza al por mayor, de esta manera lograra aumentar su margen de ganancias.
texts.en:
Yesenia Elizabeth R. M. lives in the town of Ilopango in the department of San Salvador. Yesenia is 24 years old and lives with her husband and his parents. Yesenia sells beauty products and she has a small display counter in her house where she keeps her inventory of products. She also sells her products as a street vendor in different neighborhoods. Yesenia is requesting a loan to buy wholesale beauty supplies and increase her profit margin.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es: Alexander F. E. reside en Apopa municipio del departamento de La Libertad. Alexander cuenta con 33 años de edad, se encuentra soltero y vive con su madre quien se dedica a la venta de carnes y su hermana soltera pero madre de tres hijos menores de edad. Alexander es el hombre de familia el apoyo para las dos mujeres del hogar su madre y hermana. Alexander se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras posee su carro con el cual se transporta a varios pueblos y colonias para ofrecer de sus productos. Alexander solicita un crédito para surtir su negocio con una gran cantidad de plátanos  ya que estos son muy demandados y obtendrá ganancias inmediatas.
texts.en:
Alexander F. E. lives in the town of Apopa in the department of La Libertad. Alexander is 33 years old, single and lives with his mother who sells meat and his single sister who has three young children. Alexander is the head of the household, supporting both his mother and his sister. Alexander sells fruits and vegetables from a cart that he takes to different neighborhoods to sell his products. Alexander is asking for a loan to purchase a large quantity of bananas since they are very popular and will generate immediate profits.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bananas for his business

loans.name: María Julia

texts.es: María Julia R. Vda. D. P., resiD. en el departamento D. Cuscatlán. Con 62 años D. edad María se encuentra acompaña D. su segunda pareja sentimental, ya que hace varios años murió su primer esposo. Jose la actual pareja D. María se dedica a la jardinería y ayuda a su esposa en todo. María posee una tienda en su casa con un inventario D. productos D. consumo y también maneja el vivero en el cual don Jose trabaja arduamente para que sus clientes compren sin dudar sus plantas. María solicita un crédito para invertir en su tienda surtiéndola con nuevos productos que le ayudan a incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
María Julia R. Vda. D. P. lives in the department of Cuscatlán. Maria is a 62-year-old woman who lives with her second life partner because her first husband passed away several years ago. Jose, Maria’s current spouse, is a gardener and helps out his wife with everything. María owns an in-home general store in which she sells provisions. She also manages the plant nursery where Jose works arduously so that his customers will buy his plants hands down. María is requesting a loan to invest it in her store, stocking it up with new products that will boost sales.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock general store

loans.name: Concepción Vicenta

texts.es: Concepción Vicenta R. reside en el oriente del país en el departamento de San Vicente. Concepción cuenta con 57 años de edad y vive con su esposo don Jorge quien se dedica a la agricultura en tierras de San Vicente. Hace treinta años Concepción monto su primer negocio, el cual es ahora su mayor fuente de ingresos , es una tienda  ubicada en su casa con productos de consumo, Concepción posee una clientela estable por ser muy conocida en su Cantón y por no tener competencia a sus alrededores; el crédito que solicita en para surtir su tienda con cereales y bebidas que son solicitadas por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Concepción Vicenta R. lives in the eastern part of the country, in the department of San Vicente. Concepción is a 57-year-old woman who lives with her husband, Jorge, who is a farmer in the area. Thirty years ago, Concepción launched her very first business—an in-home general store—which is now her main source of income. She has a fixed clientele because she is very well-known in her canton as she has no competition nearby. The loan that she is requesting will be used to restock her shop with the grains and beverages that her customers request.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock general store

loans.name: Marta Aracely

texts.es: Marta Aracely R. D. A. resiD. en  Atiquizaya en el departamento D. Ahuachapán. Marta vive solamente con una hija a quien trata D. darle lo mejor, Marta posee un negocio hace veinte años, es un taller D. costura D. ropa. Marta elabora sus diseños para después confeccionarlos produciendo en cantidades D. sus prendas, para luego salir a venderlos en diferentes lugares D. Ahuachapán. El crédito que Marta solicita es para la compra D. tela, carrizos D. hilos y otros insumos para la confección D. ropa, D. esta manera María lograra confeccionar mayor cantidad D. prendas D. vestir para salir a vender.
texts.en:
Marta Aracely R. D. A. lives in Atiquizaya, in the department of Ahuachapán. Marta lives with her daughter, to whom she tries to give the best. Marta has owned this business—a small garment factory—for 20 years. She creates her own designs, then produces the outfits in large quantities and sells them throughout Ahuachapán. The loan that Marta is requesting will be used to purchase fabric, thread, and other dressmaking supplies, thus she can produce larger quantities of apparel to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dressmaking materials

loans.name: Los Girasoles 1 Group

texts.en:
Amerfi is the coordinator of the group Los Girasoles based in Los Alcarrizos, an industrial town north of Santo Domingo where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable at best. She makes her home here with her husband and three school-aged children in a simple home made of concrete block with a tin roof and a concrete floor which she owns but to which she does not have title.

Amerfi came to Kiva's partner, Esperanza, for the chance to improve her business by having access to credit. Having successfully completed one loan cycle she is taking her second loan with Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to purchase a blower and women's underwear to sell at her combination beauty salon and boutique, which she runs out of a rented location.

She has over two years experience in this business and she is looking forward to using her increased profits to continue investing in her children and to have a "great" salon that will be productive for her and her family. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase a blower and underwear

loans.name: Erika Suleima

texts.es: Erika Suleima G. D. F. vive en Chiltiupan en el departamento D. La Libertad.  Erika vive con su madre quien es comerciante y su hermana D. 16 años D. edad estudiante D. básica. Erika tiene tan solo 19 años D. edad, pero ya es una mujer responsable y trabajadora tiene dos años D. haber montado su negocio, una sala D. belleza donD. ofrece varios servicios en cosmetología y también venD. variedad D. productos D. belleza;  en la zona donD. Erika posee su negocio no hay ningún otro D. este rubro por lo tanto Erika tiene una clientela muy estable. El crédito que Erika solicita es para invertir en su negocio con materiales utilizados en su salón y así también surtir D. más variedad su inventario en productos D. belleza.

loans.use: Compra de productos para salón  de belleza

loans.name: Vision Large Group

texts.en:
The “Vision Large” or Large Vision group is made of ten male and female entrepreneurs. These businessmen and women are excited to grow their business with the help of their first loan from Esperanza. The group’s name is indicative of their sentiments.  The group shares a large vision for both their personal development and their community as well. They recognize at the same time that the changes they’d like to see on a large scale start with them as individuals. Carline M. is one of four representatives of the group. 

Carline sells rice, sugar, oil, corn meal and a variety of other food. She says she doesn’t mind travelling to various markets because she isn’t married and has no children, but she hopes to have a boutique and expand her merchandise. Carline says she decided to work with Esperanza because “…it has the potential to remove both young and old from poverty…” On behalf of Carline, Vision Large, and Esperanza, we thank you for your support.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, corn meal, sardines, tomato paste, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat de marchandises

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Fifty-year-old Yaa is married with six children, four of whom attend school in their local community. They are a very humble family who want to invest in their children's future by providing them with a quality education.

Yaa is a grocery shop owner and sells item like cooking oil, spices, pepper, onions, cassava, plantain, dried fish, tinned tomatoes, and bags of rice etc. Yaa says these products sell very fast and she can easily recover her money to restock. Her goods are delivered from the capital city of Kumasi.

With two years experience in her business, Yaa wants to expand her stock in response to frequent customer demands for items such as maize, smoked fish, and more. She believes that this could be possible with the help of a loan.

Yaa says she would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Aliou Sow

texts.fr:
MBTH/1421
Aliou Sow  Y.  est un chauffeur de taxi urbain il conduit son propre véhicule qu’il a acquis grâce à ses économies. Chaque jour il fait avec son véhicule le tour de la ville de Mbour à la recherche de passagers. Les revenus tirés de son activité lui permettent d’aider ses parents mais aussi d’économiser pour  préparer son mariage. Avec le prêt qu’il sollicite il compte dépanner son véhicule de transport. Il est âgé de 28 ans et est célibataire.

M
texts.en:
MBTH/1421 Aliou Sow Y. is a taxi driver.  He drives his own vehicle that he acquired, thanks to his savings.  Every day, he takes his vehicle around the city of Mbour in search of passengers.  The revenues derived from his business enable him to help his parents and also to save money in preparation for his marriage.  With this loan he's requesting, he intends to repair his transport vehicle.  He is 28 years old and unmarried.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repaire his vehicle

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia is 47years old she is divorced and mother of four children but three are presently living with her. Two are schooling whiles one has graduated from the welding training. She works very hard to provide for her children as a single parent. She trades in onions to food vendors and has been in business for five years now. She provides her children needs through the proceeds from the business. She takes stocks of goods from the capital of Kumasi. She requests for the loan support to buy bulk supply of onions. She would be grateful for the assistance.

loans.use: To buy bags of onions for supply to food vendors.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia is 48 years old she is widowed and mother with six children. All her children are in school. She operates a drinking spots where she sells all kinds of drinks such as soft drinks, canned malts, canned and bottle drinks etc. She is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to provide for her business and the children with quality education. But she claim without adequate fund it can’t be possible to realize that dream. She is been running the drinking spots for ten years now. And she needs the loan to buy assorted drinks like Coke, Pepsi and canned drinks to upgrade her inventory.

loans.use: To buy assorted drinks like Coke, Pepsi and canned drinks to upgrade her inventory.

loans.name: Maria Felicita

texts.es: La señora Maria U. G. ella tiene 43 años de edad, es madre soltera y posee 3 hijos, uno mayor de edad y los otros dos son menores. La señora Maria  tiene una pequeña pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, en la cual vende granos básicos y otros artículos. Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace 11 años. Porque su mama quería ingresos adicionales que reemplazaran la escasez de trabajo. Al poco tiempo, la pulpería la empezó a administrar Maria y ahora es propiamente de ella, quien la administra y quien invierte para mantenerla. Su crédito será invertido en la compra principalmente de granos básicos, ya que en este momento aprovecha a comprar y almacenar para cuando los granos suban de precio. Su sueño es llegar a instalar una distribuidora en el municipio en donde vive, ya que actualmente no hay ninguna.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua is 25 years old, married and has three children. She lives with her husband and children in a single room apartment. She is diligent and committed to her work of retailing assorted soaps and detergent, which she obtains from Kumasi, a nearby city.

She conducts the majority of her business through market centers and selling door-to-door. She has become very popular in her community because of the nature of her business. However, due to the lack of adequate funds, she is unable to purchase enough volume of supplies to turn a profit. She hopes to save more for her children's education and is sure that she can repay your loans on time because she has five years of retailing experienced.

loans.use: To buy assorted soaps and detergents.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca started selling fish 15 years ago. She takes delivery of fish from Yeji in the eastern region of Ghana. With her very tasty and good quality fish, many customers buy from her stand. She is now 46 years old and is married with six children. All her children are currently in school in the community where they live. She wants to use the loan to buy more stock of assorted fish to increase sales and income to support her children’s education and grow her business. She is grateful for the assistance.

loans.use: To buy more smoked fish

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia is 46 years old and is a married mother of six children. Three of the children are in school while the rest are learning a trade. She is a petty trader who trades in used clothes. Her husband and kids are very proud of her because of the enormous contribution she makes in the home. Used clothing has a very big market in Ghana as brand new clothes are very expensive for the economic poor. Therefore, the selling of used clothing has created a market for many women like Felicia. She wants to use the loan to buy more used clothing to increase her inventory, which she takes in from Accra and Kumasi. She believes this loan would help her save for her children’s education and also to rent a store. She is grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more used clothing

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth started selling fish four years ago. She takes delivery of fish from Mankessim in the central region of Ghana. With her very tasty and good quality fish, many customers buy from her stand. She is now fifty years old and is married with five children. Four of her children are currently in school in the community where they live. She wants to use the loan to buy more stock of assorted fish to increase sales and income to support her children’s education and grow her business. She is grateful for the assistance.

loans.use: To buy more smoked fish

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 44 year old she is married and mother of four children. She lives with her husband and the children. Currently three of her children are schooling in the junior and the primary level respectively. She is a local manufacturer of Soaps for a year now. She combines materials like palm oil, soda powder, cocoa pods and coconut oil to obtain her soaps. She is not able to produce in large quantities for lack of funds. She wants to take advantage of the loan facility to buy more raw materials and processing equipment to scale up production. She hopes to raise improved income to support her children education. It is her desire to provide quality education to the children and she would be grateful for that support.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials like palm oil, soda powder, cocoa pods and coconut oil etc.

loans.name: Silvia Yaroslav

texts.es: Silvia Yaroslav E. M. es cliente de Fundación León 2000 tiene 34 años de edad. Ella tiene 2 hijos que dependen de ella. Este negocio lo aprendió por su abuela como es la brindar el servicio de salón de belleza. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad, además que tiene que hacerse cargo de sus hijos y atender el local, ella abre desde muy temprano para que atender a cada uno de sus clientes. El lugar está ubicado en las afueras del mercado donde transitan muchas personas por lo que le da la oportunidad de tener nuevos clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de sillas de salón, tijeras, tratamientos para el cabello, tintes y secadoras. El sueño de Silvia es poseer su propia academia de belleza para trasmitir sus conocimientos.
texts.en:
Silvia Yaroslav E. M. is client of Fundación León 2000. She is a 34-year-old woman with two dependent children. She learned this trade—providing beauty salon services—from her grandmother. She has been in business for 7 years. Besides running the beauty salon, she has to take care of her children. She opens the salon very early in the morning to attend to each and every one of her customers. The business is located on the outskirts of a bustling market, which gives her the opportunity to gain new clients. The loan that she is requesting with will be used as working capital to purchase styling chairs, scissors, hair treatments, hair dyes, and blow-dryers. Silvia’s dream is to open up her own beauty school so that she can pass on her skills.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Pablo Antonio

texts.es: El señor Pablo Antonio Aguirre López Alemán , tiene la edad de 38 años , habita en el barrio San Caralampio , ubicado en la Concepción , municipio de Masaya , junto a su esposa  la cual trabaja como domestica para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen tres hijos , actualmente estudiante , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , don Pablo desde hace ocho años se dedica a  la agricultura , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , el inicio esta actividad con el apoyo de sus padres , los planes futuros hacia su cultivo es diversificarlo . Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos y aplicar al cultivo.
texts.en:
Mr. Pablo Antonio Aguirre López Alemán is a 38-year-old man who lives with his wife in the San Caralampio neighborhood, located in La Concepción, in the municipality of Masaya. His wife works as a housekeeper to help him with the household expenses. They have three school age children. He plans on improving his family’s quality of life. Pablo has been in agriculture for 8 years, and his biggest problem is lack of funds. He started out this business with the help of his parents. He plans to diversify his crops in the future. With this loan, he will purchase fertilizer and supplies for his crop fields.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and supplies

loans.name: Bertha

texts.en: Berth is 35 years old she is married and mother with four children. Currently all are schooling in the community where they live. They are very humble family who wants to invest in their children future by providing them with quality education.  She is a petty trader and sells item like cooking oil, spices, pepper, onions, smoked, cassava, plantain and dried fish’s, tin tomatoes, bags of rice etc. Selling of these products, she says they move very fast and you can easily recover your money to restock. She takes delivery of goods from the capital city of Kumasi. With her four years experienced in her business she wants to add other stuffs like maize, eggs and others which are frequently demanded by her customers. She says she would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs like cooking oil, bags of rice spices and tin tomatoes etc.

loans.name: Diene

texts.fr: Diene N.   est horticulteur  fleuriste  il est âge 27 ans  marié et père de deux (2) enfants  .Sans formation professionnelle il a su se faire un nom dans le domaine du jardinage  par l’aménagement des maisons et de espaces publiques  dans la zone touristique de saly située à 80km de Dakar la capital sénégalaise. Les revenus tirés de son activité lui permettent d’entretenir sa famille. Avec le prêt il compte acheter de nouvelles plantes ornementales pour préparer les fêtes de fin d’année.

loans.use: ACHAT DE MARCHANDISE

loans.name: Dora

texts.en: Dora is 43 years old and married with four children. Two of her children are in school and the others are working. Dora is very resourceful at providing food for her family and paying the bills. She is a food vendor, selling kenkey, which is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and eaten with hot pepper and fried fish. She sells kenkey in the mornings and in the afternoon, and has many customers because Ghanaians enjoy kenkey for breakfast, lunch and supper. Dora wants to use the loan to buy more supplies: bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to increase her savings in order to support her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en: Beauty is 33 year old she is divorcee and mother of fourteen year daughter. She lives with her child. Currently her child is in the junior high school at the community educational complex. She works very hard as a single mother in providing for her child. She is a local manufacturer of Soaps for two years now. She combines materials like palm oil, soda powder, cocoa pods and coconut oil to obtain her soaps. She is not able to produce in large quantities for lack of funds. She wants to take advantage of the loan facility to buy more raw materials and processing equipment to scale up production. She hopes to raise improved income to support her children education. It is her desire to provide quality education to the children and she would be grateful for that support.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials like palm oil, soda powder, cocoa pods and coconut oil etc.

loans.name: Souleye

texts.fr: Souleye D. âge de 34 ans est un exploitant de sel minéral Il achète le sel produit pour le revendre  .les revenus tirés du commerce lui permettent de nourrir sa famille. Pour faire face à la demande il sollicite un prêt lui permettant d’acheter des quantités plus importantes de sel.
texts.en:
Souleye D., age 34, is a mineral salt provider.  He buys salt produced for resale.  The revenues derived from commerce enable him to feed his family.  To cope with the demand, he's requesting a loan allowing him to buy larger quantities of salt.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Luz Del Transito

texts.es: Luz del Transito R. P. tiene la edad de 36 años. Doña Luz  tiene 2 hijos que son menores de edad y están a su cargo. La actividad económica de  es la venta de ropa. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio. Inicio este negocio por la necesidad de cubrir los gastos de su casa, la ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante ya que es la única manera en la que puede ofrecer sus productos. Tiene los propósitos de incrementar su inventario para competir fuertemente. El financiamiento que solicita es destinado para capital de trabajo efectuara la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, chaquetas. Los sueños de Luz son de establecerse en una tienda y así  proporcionarle este negocio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Luz del Transito R. P. is 36 years old and has two children who are still minors and under her care. Four years ago, Luz began selling clothing to make money to pay the household costs. Her business is mobile as this is the only way she can sell her products. With this loan, Luz hopes to add to her inventory and make her venture more competitive. She would use the money to buy pants, shirts, skirts, and jackets. Luz's dream is to open a store and eventually pass the business on to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is 38 years old he is married and father of three children. All his children are in school. He operates drinking spots where he sells all kinds of soft drinks such as  canned malts, Coke, Pepsi, tonic water, canned and bottle drinks etc. He is an achiever, very hard working and his focus is to save enough to provide for his business and the children with quality education. But he claims without adequate fund it can’t be possible to realize that dream. He is been running the drinking spots for ten years now. And he needs the loan to buy assorted drinks like Coke, Pepsi and canned drinks to upgrade his inventory. He would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy assorted drinks like Coke, Pepsi and canned drinks to upgrade her inventory.

loans.name: Bertha Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Bertha Patricia vive con su esposo el señor Ricardo Macias, forman una familia unida y trabajadora. Ella trabaja para una empresa de ventas de artículos de oficina, su esposo trabaja en un restaurante como músico desde hace 5 años.
Ellos están tramitando este crédito para la colocación del alambrado eléctrico de su casa, porque se quemo y requieren instalarlo ya que la luz es un servicio básico dentro de cada hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bertha Patricia lives with her husband, Mr. Ricardo Macias, and together they make up a close-knit, hard-working family. Bertha works for a company that sells office supplies, and her husband has been working for five years as a musician at a restaurant.

They applied for this loan for the purpose of installing electric wiring in their house. The old wiring burned out and needs to be reinstalled, since electricity is an essential service in any home.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installation of household electrical wiring.

loans.name: Awurade Naye Group

texts.en:
Ophelia is 33 years old she is married and mother with two children. Currently all are schooling in the community where they live. They are very humble family who wants to invest in their children future by providing them with quality education.  She is a petty trader and sells item like cooking oil, spices, pepper, onions. She supplies the onions to the food vendors in bulk. Selling of these products, she says they move very fast and you can easily recover your money to restock. She takes delivery of goods from the capital city of Kumasi. With her six years experienced in her business she wants to add other stuffs like maize, eggs and others which are frequently demanded by her customers. She says she would be grateful for your assistance.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Awurade Naye’ which means ‘It is the doing of the LORD’. She is the one sitting in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors etc. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs like cooking oil, bags of rice spices and tin tomatoes etc.

loans.name: Gladys Petronila

texts.es: Gladys Petrona B. Ramírez tiene 52 años. Su estado civil es casada, tiene 2 hijos. Su actividad económica es una pulpería, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación. Hace mas de  de 10 años que inicio este negocio por lo que su familia atravesaba una fuerte crisis económica pero con la buena administración que logro proporcionarle a su negocio siguió adelante con este negocio.  Por lo que actualmente solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de más productos como arroz, frijoles, aceite, detergentes, jabón, productos de limpieza y golosinas. Su deseo es que todos sus esfuerzos tenga frutos y así el día de mañana sus hijos logren retribuir  todo lo que ella les ha ofrecido.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Peace Group

texts.en:
Ophelia is 38 years old and married with two children who are both in school. She has been selling food for the past eight years to take care of her family. She sells gari with beans together with ripe plantain in the community school.

Gari and beans is enjoyed by many Ghanaians because it contains lots of protein and it is also affordable. (Gari is fried grated cassava root.)

Ophelia's business is doing well because of her good relationships with people. She wants a loan to restock her inventory of gari, plantain, beans, charcoal, red oil and so on. It is also her dream to save more from her business proceeds in order to take care of the children's schooling. She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Peace’. She is the one sitting in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors etc. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs like gari, plantain, beans etc.

loans.name: Remigio Antonio

texts.es: El señor Remigio Antonio P. Sánchez , tiene la edad de 37 años , habita en el barrio San José de los Ríos , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposa la cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos de hogar , ellos tiene dos hijos a su cargo , los cuales estudian su secundaria y le apoyan con las actividades agrícolas , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , don Remigio desde hace 20 años se dedica a la agricultura , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento ya que el cultivo carece de insumos necesarios para tener una buena producción , el inicio esta actividad con el esfuerzo propio , los planes futuros hacia el cultivo es diversificarlo . Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos y poder mejorar la producción el cual espera vender a buen precio  para poder cubrir los gastos y necesidades personal.
texts.en:
Mr. Remigio Antonio P. Sánchez is 37 years old and lives in the neighborhood of San José de los Ríos, in the municipality of Ticuantepe. Remigio lives with his wife, who works and helps out with the household costs. They have two children who attend secondary school and also assist with the farm work. Remigio hopes to improve his family's living conditions. For almost 20 years he has worked in the agriculture business, starting the venture independently with his own effort. In the future, Remigio hopes to diversify the crops grown on his property, but now the biggest difficulty he faces is that the farm lacks the tools and supplies necessary to cultivate a good harvest. With the loan, Remigio is going to buy fertilizers and other supplies that will allow him to increase his production, which he hopes to sell at a good price to cover the business costs and his family's needs.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and use them on the farm

loans.name: Yesom Awurade Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is thirty years old she is married and mother with five children. She has three of the children who are currently in school. She is a trader in palm nuts fruits. Palm nut fruits are used to produce almost all cooking oil in the country and beyond. She takes stock from the farmers and supply to the big companies for further production. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of palm nuts to increase and to boost sales. She believes this will help expand her business to raise more income to support her husband, to provide food for her family and finance her children’s education.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Yesom Awurade’ which literary means ‘We are serving God’. She is the one sitting in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors etc. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of palm nuts to increase her sales.

loans.name: Marlene De La Cruz

texts.es: La señora Marlene de la Cruz E. , tiene la edad de 46 años , habita en el barrio las enramadas , junto a su esposo el cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen cuatro hijos , dos  ya independientes y dos a su cargo los cuales estudian ,le apoyan en la actividades agrícolas y del hogar , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , doña Marlene desde hace 21 años se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , los planes futuros hacia su cultivo es diversificarlo . Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos y mejorar su producción. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo para hacer posible este mejoramiento.
texts.en:
Mrs Marlene de la Cruz E., 46 years old, lives in the neighbourhood of Las Enramadas together with her husband who helps her with home expenses. They have four children, two already independent and two that they look after who study and help her with agricultural activities and in the home. The family's plan is to improve their living conditions. Since the age of 21, Marlene has dedicated herself to agricultural work, however the most difficult part has been the lack of financing, so her future plan is to diversify her crops. With the loan she will buy fertilizers and supplies and improve her production. She gives thanks to Kiva for the support that makes this improvement possible.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer to improve cultivation

loans.name: Janeth

texts.es: La señora Janeth vive con sus 3 hijos y su esposo el señor Alexandro Ríos quien es albañil independiente desde hace 5 años y juntos establecieron un negocio de nombre  “Abarrotes Alejandra “el cual esta funcionando muy bien desde hace 6 años son una familia muy trabajadora y comprometida con sus proyectos a realizar. En este momento su objetivo es invertir en su negocio para cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes y así incrementar las ganancias, motivo por el cual están solicitando este crédito

loans.use: Compra de mercancia para su negocio

loans.name: Groupement Gouye Gui N°1

texts.fr:
Groupement Gouye Gui N°1 est un groupement de femme dont la moyenne  d’âge est de 30 ans .Elles sont des vendeuses de poissons frais au port de pèche de Mbour. Le but du prêt est le renforcement d’activité de mareyage en cette période de l’année où le poisson est en abondance 
Montant demandé 500000F remboursable en 12 mensualités

loans.use: fonds de roulement

loans.name: Elfego Bismark

texts.es: El señor Elfego Bismarck Villalobos Reynosa , tiene la edad de 44 años , habita en el barrio Buenos Aires , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe  junto a su esposa la cual trabaja para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar  ellos tiene dos hijos , los cuales estudian y le apoyan con las actividades agrícolas en tiempos libres, don Elfego desde hace cuatros años se dedica a la agricultura la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , el inicio esta actividad con el apoyo de sus padres , los planes futuros hacia su cultivo es diversificarlo . Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos y poder obtener mejores resultados. Dando las gracias Afodenic por financiamiento de poder seguir mejorando su cultivo.
texts.en:
Mr Elfego Bismarck Villalobos Reynosa is 44 years old and lives in the neighbourhood of Buenos Aires, located in the municipality of Ticuantepe. He lives with his wife who works to help him with the costs of living. They have two children who study and help them with agricultural work in their spare time. For the last four years Elfego has dedicated himself to agriculture, which he began with the support of his parents. The greatest difficulty has been the lack of financing, so his future plan is to diversify his crops. With this loan he will buy fertilizers and supplies to obtain better results. He gives thanks to Afodenic for financing this loan which will allow him to continue improving his cultivation.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers and improve cultivation

loans.name: Adilia Waleska

texts.es: La señora Adilia Waleska López Hernández , tiene la edad de 23 años , habita en el reparto Juan Ramón Padilla , junto a su esposo el cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos de hogar , ellos tiene  un hijo de tres años , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , doña Adilia desde hace dos años tiene su negocio de variedades , eventos y decoraciones , durante este tiempo la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento ya que la demanda de sus clientes , su capital de trabajo no lo cubre , los planes hacia su negocio es expandirse dentro del sector , ella inicio esta actividad con sus propios esfuerzos y el apoyo de su esposo . Con el préstamo va a comprar materiales y accesorios para las diferentes actividades a si como ropa. Da las gracias a la institución por hacer posible su incremento en las ventas.
texts.en:
Adilia Waleska López Hernández is 23 years old and lives in Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla with her husband, who works and supports her with the household expenses. They have a 3-year-old son. Her plan for her family is to improve their quality of life. Adilia has had her variety, event, and decoration shop for the past two years. During this time, the biggest difficulty is the lack of financing, as her working capital does not cover her customers’ demand. Her plan for her business is to expand it within the sector. She began this business with her own efforts and the support of her husband. With this loan, she will buy materials and accessories for the different activities, such as clothing. She thanks the lending institution for making her increase in sales possible.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a variety of clothing

loans.name: Cosme

texts.es: El señor Cosme A. Martínez, tiene la edad de 59 años, habita en el barrio San José de los Ríos, junto a su esposa la cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene cinco hijos , cuatro de ellos ya casados y uno a su cargo actualmente estudiante , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , don Cosme desde hace 39 años se dedica a la agricultura la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento y la sequilla , él inicio está actividad con el apoyo de la reforma agraria , los planes hacia su cultivo es diversificarlo Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para lograr una mejor producción.
texts.en:
Cosme A. Martínez is 59 years old and lives in the San José de los Ríos neighborhood with his wife, who works and helps him with household expenses. They have five children, four of which are already married and one is currently a student. His plan for his family is to improve their quality of life. Cosme has been in agriculture for the past 39 years. The biggest difficulty for him is the lack of financing and drought. He began working in this business with the support of the agrarian reform. His plan is to diversify his crops. With this loan, Cosme will purchase fertilizers and supplies to achieve a better yield.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers to improve his crop yield

loans.name: Carlos Luis

texts.es: El señor Carlos Luís López  P. , tiene la edad de 41 años , habita en el Municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa la cual  trabaja como conserje para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene tres hijos a su cargo , todos estudiantes de secundaria , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y apoyar a sus hijos para que sean unos profesionales , desde hace 25 años don Carlos se dedica a los trabajos de campo , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento ,  don Carlos inicio esta actividad con su propio esfuerzo y el de su familia; los planes hacia su cultivo es diversificarlo . Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos.

loans.use: Comprar insumos y fertilizante para aplicar al cultivo

loans.name: Binta

texts.fr: Binta D. est une femme de 28 ans, elle est mariée et a 3 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de MEDINA DIAMBERE depuis juillet 2006 et a bénéficié de 5 prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursés régulièrement. Avec ce prêt elle développe une activité de broderie. Elle confectionne des draps de lit qu'elle vend dans d'autres localités. Les profits générés par son commerce lui permettent de subvenir à ses besoins et à soutenir son mari pour la prise en charge de la nourriture et la santé de la famille.
texts.en:
Binta D. is a 28-year-old woman. She is married and has three children in her care.  She has been a member of the Banc Villageois de MEDINA DIAMBERE since July 2006 and has benefited from five loans, which she always repaid regularly.   With this loan, she's developing an embroidery business.  She makes bed sheets that she sells in other towns.  The profits generated from her commerce allows her to provide for herself and to support her husband, who is responsible for the family's food and health.  

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her capital

loans.name: Bayardo Javier

texts.es: Este joven emprendedor Bayardo Javier Méndez Hernández tiene 30 años. Es casado y tiene 2 hijos. Su actividad económica es la venta de productos de medicina natural. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, el inicio con muy pocos productos, ya que no tenía el suficiente capital para comprar muchas medicinas, además Bayardo tenía que vender su medicina de manera ambulante en los buses y por medio de un amigo que le facilitó el dinero logro salir adelante y de esta forma obtuvo muchos beneficios. El recurre a Fundación León 2000 para solicitar un financiamiento para la compra de productos. Su deseo es seguir apoyando a sus hijos para que no pasen lo mismo que el.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: La señora Rosa B. S. , tiene la edad de 48 años , habita en el barrio Los Martínez , ubicado en el municipio de La Concepción , junto a su esposo el cual trabaja y le apoya con las actividades del hogar , ellos tiene tres hijos ya todos independientes , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar una pulpería que tiene y por ende las condiciones de vida , doña Rosa desde hace 26 años se dedica a la agricultura la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , ella inicio esta actividad con el apoyo de su papá , los planes futuros hacia su cultivo es mejorar la producción . Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos y poder seguir adelante con el cultivo. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo en estos diez ciclo el cual ha logrado hacer mejoras en su casa y en sus siembras.
texts.en:
Rosa B. S. is 48 years old and lives in the Los Martínez neighborhood, located in the municipality of La Concepción. She lives with her husband, who works and helps with household activities. They have three children, all of which are now independent of them. Her plans for her family are to improve a grocery store that they have and, as a result, improve their living conditions. Rosa has worked in agriculture for the past 26 years. The biggest difficulty for her is the lack of financing. She began working in agriculture with the support of her father. Her future plan for her crops is to improve the yield. With this loan, Rosa will purchase fertilizers and supplies to be able to improve her crops. She thanks the lending institution for their support in these ten loan cycles, as it has helped her to make housing improvements and improve her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers to be able to improve her crop yield

loans.name: Lola Lorenza

texts.es: La señora en  cliente antigua, antes el esposo era el cliente con la actividad de carpinteria.Hace dos años que el esposo fallecio, ahora la señora se dedica a la venta de comida,solo por las noches ya que en el dia trabaja a medio tiempo como empleada domestica. Paga sus cuentas y se sustenta con su trabajo porque sus hijos ya son independientes.                                                                                                            La señora es un cliente responsable
texts.en:
This lady is an elderly client. Previously, her husband was the client, working in carpentry. Two years ago her husband passed away, and now this lady works selling food in the evenings. At the same time, during the day she works as a domestic employee. She pays her debts and sustains herself with her work, because her children are all grown up. This lady is a responsible client.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Gloria Del Carmen Gutiérrez  se dedica a la  elaboración de mochilas, las cuales vende ciertos lugares en los que tiene suficiente clientes. Hace más de 6 años de trabajar este negocio, sus hijos asisten a clase, Gloria ha luchado para sacar adelante su negocio por lo que tiene que proporcionarles a sus hijos estudios y alimentos. Ella disfruta mucho de su trabajo pues siempre recuerda que este el medio de vida que le genera los ingresos necesario del pan de cada día.  La señora está solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para la compra de materiales ya que tiene variedad de pedidos y necesita el crédito para cubrir la demanda. Su deseo es seguir con este negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Gloria Del Carmen Gutiérrez works making backpacks, which she sells in certain places where she has enough clients. She has done this work for more than 6 years. Her children are going to school. Gloria has fought in order to improve her business so that she can support her children’s studies and nutrition. She enjoys her work very much, and she always remembers that this is her way of getting the income needed for bread each day. Señora Gloria is asking for a new loan for the purchase of materials as she has a variety of orders and she needs the credit to meet the demand. Her dream is to continue with this business.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working funds

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama D., 42 ans, mariée et 8 enfants en charge est membre du Banc Villageois de MEDINA DIAMBERE depuis 2 ans et y a bénéficié de 4 prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursé avec succès. Avec ce prêt elle fait un petit commerce en vendant de l'huile, du lait en poudre, de la kolas, du sucre, de la cigarette etc. Elle n'a pas de boutique mais elle vend à domicile. Elle soutien son mari pour l'amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Mariama D., age 42, is married and has eight children to support.  She has been a member of Banc Villageois de MEDINA DIAMBERE for two years and has obtained from it four loans, each of which she repaid successfully.  With the current loan, she's operating a small business selling oil, powdered milk, kola, sugar, cigarettes, etc.  She doesn't have a store, but she makes sales out of her house. She supports her husband in improving the family's living conditions. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her capital

loans.name: Guéréwou

texts.fr: Guéréwou K. est une dame de 48 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est très dynamique dans les activités de groupe, elle est présidente de son Banc Villageois depuis 2 ans et demi. Avec son prêt elle va développer un petit commerce de tissus teinté. Elle participe beaucoup pour la santé et la nourriture de la famille.
texts.en:
Guéréwou K. is a 48-year-old woman who is married and the mother of four children.  She is very dynamic in group activities.  She has been the president of her banc villageois for two and a half years.  With her loan, she is going to develop  a small business involving dyed cloth.  She helps her family a lot in terms of health care and food. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her capital

loans.name: Eddy Jose

texts.es: El joven  Eddy José de 21 años de edad, es un joven esforzado para apoyar  a sus padres pues vive junto con ellos, reside en Villa el Carmen en la capital de Managua, el trabaja en servicios de seguridad en la alcaldía de Villa el Carmen, tiene 8 meses de estar laborando ya que anteriormente se dedicaba a la construcción pero a veces no había trabajo y necesitaba un salario fijo ya que le tiene una niña. Con este préstamo que esta solicitando es para hacer un cuarto a su hija y que tenga buenas condiciones como un techo propio. Da las gracias a la institución por lograr estas mejoras en su vida personal.
texts.en:
21 year old Eddy José is a young man dedicated to supporting his parents who he lives with in Villa el Carmen in the country's capital, Managua. He has worked in security services in the mayor's office of Villa el Carmen for 8 months. Previously he worked in construction, however at times there was no work and he needed a fixed salary as he has a daughter to support. With this loan he will build a room for his daughter, which he hopes will be in good condition, such as having its own roof. He gives thanks to Kiva for making these improvements possible in his personal life.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build a room

loans.name: Douglas De Jesus

texts.es: El señor Douglas de Jesús de 35 años de edad, reside en Villa el Carmen en la capital de Managua,  casado y con UN hijo de 11 años de edad que estudia la primaria, sus planes es poder darles una mejor educación y poder mejorar la vivienda, el se desempeña  como responsable de adquisiciones  en la alcaldía, tiene siete meses de laborar en la alcaldía de villa el carmen, lo cual ha logrado estabilizarse, anteriormente era concejal propietario del gobierno pasado, también ha trabajado las tierras por once años y ha podido dar un mejor bienestar a su familia, con este crédito quiere comprar materiales de construcción para hacer, un corredor para estar con mejores comodidad y gozar de los esfuerzos de su trabajo. da las gracias a la institución por lograr mantener la esperanza a muchas familia de bajo recurso que con anhelo desean tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Señor Douglas de Jesús, age 35, resides in Villa el Carmen in the capital city of Managua with one son of 11 years of age who studies in primary school. His plan is to give him a better education and improve their livelihood. He carries out duties with responsibility for acquisitions in the city hall. He has been working in the city hall of Villa del Carmen for six months, during which he has succeeded in establishing himself. Previously he was a town councilor in a past government. He also worked the land for 11 years and has been able to improve the well-being of his family.

With this loan he wants to buy construction materials to build a hallway in order to live more comfortably and enjoy the fruits of his labor. He gives thanks to the lending institution for succeeding in maintaining the hopes of many families with few resources yearning to have their own homes.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials in order to build a hallway

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr: Fatoumata C., est une femme de 31 ans avec 1 enfant en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de MEDINA DIAMBERE depuis 2 ans et demi, elle est très dynamique et a une bonne performance au niveau de son groupe. Elle fait du commerce d'huile végétal et de pâte d'arachide qu'elle transforme elle même. elle contribue au bienêtre de la famille en soutenant son mari dans certaines charges.
texts.en:
